story:
ONLY $2,300 LEFT TO RAISE IN 2 DAYS!

JULY 29 CAMPAIGN UPDATE: 

    $6,200 on Indiegogo
+ $1,450 in Cash/Checks
= $7,650 of my $10,000 goal!

With only 2 days remaining, here's how you can help:
  1. Make a Contribution. EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS. Even $5 makes a difference!
  2. Help Spread the Word!  Share this link on Facebook: bit.ly/ZaksLibrary


VIDEO UPDATE: This week Florence, a teacher at Namumira Primary School, showed us around the library's construction site.


_________________________________________________________________________

JULY 7 CAMPAIGN UPDATE: $5,150 RAISED TO DATE!


So far, I've raised $3,700 on Indiegogo + $1,450 in Cash and Checks ... bringing me just over the halfway mark. If you've already contributed, THANK YOU!

Please help me reach the rest of my goal -- $4,850 LEFT TO GO! 

I hope you'll consider making a contribution and  you can use the "Share Links" (above, right) to share my campaign with others passionate about quality education! You can also share this short link: bit.ly/ZaksCampaign

PS: Stay tuned for more updates from Namumira, Uganda as they continue to build their school's first library!

_________________________________________________________________________

Short Summary:

Hello, my name is Zakary Koenigs. I am 13 years old and I’m in 8th grade. Together with Just Like My Child Foundation, we’ve raised over $15,000 to build one of the first libraries in a poor, rural community in Central Uganda.

Just Like My Child Foundation has been working in this community for many years, and I’ve been lucky enough to visit 3 times. I loved visiting the schools and meeting the kids. I realized that that even though we’re different in a lot of ways, we are, for the most part, the same. We all LIKE to play, learn, have friends — and we all love using technology.

This summer, I am being Bar Mitzvah’d and I have decided that as part of my Mitzvah project (a project where we commit to something bigger than ourselves) my goal is to raise $10,000 to supply Namumira’s Library with everything it needs to be super successful, including Books in the Local Language, Reading Desks, Chairs, Educational Posters, Solar Panels for Electricity AND Computer Tablets — because I believe access to technology is important to learning and so far, kids like me in Namumira have little-to-no access to technology.

I've met the kids in Namumira. That's why this campaign is important to me. I know that this new Library will help them get a better education AND it will help keep them safe after school hours. PLUS the whole community will use it as a community resource for years to come. 

Every dollar makes a difference and your generous donation will go DIRECTLY to help these very children get a better education. Please consider helping me reach my goal!

Where the Money Goes:

My Fundraising Goal = $10,000 USD. Together, we can create a safe learning space for kids in Namumira, Uganda. Here's how the money will be used:
  • Books in the Local Language
  • Educational Posters
  • Learning Materials and Supplies
  • Solar Panels for Electricity
  • Computer Tablets -- an invaluable learning resource that will connect students with the world around them.
Just Like My Child Foundation has successfully completed building 27 school structures so they know exactly how to get this done on time, on budget, and with the greatest community involvement.
Risks and Challenges: 
  • If I don't reach my goal, every penny raised will go towards providing the Library with the items above, with a priority on books, solar panels, and computer tablets.
  • IF I REACH MY GOAL this summer, I'll travel to Namumira, Uganda with Just Like My Child Foundation in November to help paint the finished library and bring extra supplies. 
  • If you help me EXCEED my goal, additional funds will be used to empower vulnerable adolescent girls (who are living in poverty in Central Uganda) to stay in school, avoid forced child marriage and to fulfill their highest potential.

The Impact:

The Library is being built at Namumira Primary School, where the community is very eager to have a library. Not only are students looking forward to learning there, but the library will also serve as a safe space for girls and students. Parents in the community are really excited and feeling relieved that their kids will have a safe place to study after school in this new community center. 

SO FAR,  we’ve raised enough money to build the structure. Parents in the community have recently broke ground and started to build the library’s foundation.

BUT NOW,  we need extra funds to FILL the library with supplies like books in the local language, desks, chairs, educational posters, solar panels for electricity AND access to technology — because I believe technology is important to learning, and so far, these kids have little to no access to technology.

Why is a library and safe learning space so important? A more educated planet helps us all because it results in less fundamentalism and war, greater commitment to environmental stability, and better health outcomes for the next generation.

_________________________________________________________________________

Perks for Contributing:

When you donate, we'll send you real-time updates via video and email so you can see exactly where your funds are going and keep in touch with the library's progress. PLUS, you'll receive some cool perks from Uganda!

_________________________________________________________________________

$25 Provides Books & Learning Materials

Every dollar raised will help provide books in Luganda, Namumira's local language, educational posters and learning materials that students can use when they use the library to study after school hours.

_________________________________________________________________________

$50 = Electronic Thank You Card

I'll send you a thank you e-card from Uganda, that includes a photo of the students at Namumira Primary School who will benefit from the library's safe space and educational materials.

$100 = Personalized Thank You Card

I'll send you a personalised thank you note as a small token of my great appreciation for your support.

_________________________________________________________________________

$250 = Set of Jewelry from Uganda

Includes 2 Bead Necklaces and 3 Matching Bracelets. These beautiful and unique beads are handmade from recycled paper by formerly abducted and war-affected women from Northern Uganda, many of whom are speaking out and effectively advocating for social justice and reconciliation. Each piece sold helps the artisan uplift her family and community.

_________________________________________________________________________

$500 = Bundle of Gifts in a Basket from Uganda

One Handwoven Basket from Uganda filled with an assortment of crafts and local textiles handmade by mothers in Uganda.

_________________________________________________________________________

$1,000 = Personalized Photo from Uganda

Your contribution at this level will help provide Solar Panels and Computer Tablets for Namumira's Library. I'll send you a Personalized and Framed Photo of Namumira Primary School Students (and me) in Uganda when I visit in November for the Library's official grand opening.

_________________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't contribute at this time, you can still help me make a difference! Help me spread the word out by sending this to your own friends and family who are passionate about providing education and safe spaces for vulnerable children living in poverty. Use the Share Buttons above (on the left-hand side) to share my campaign with others on Facebook!

_________________________________________________________________________

Why We Cannot Accept Book Donations:

We are committed to providing Namumira's new Library with culturally relevant books in their local language so that students in Uganda get the most out of these new learning materials. Plus, books are costly to ship from the United States!

story:
I’ve taken a year off from my rabbinic training, but I'm  longing to get back to my  rabbinic training, and since it will be a while before my new venture MapleMama starts turning a profit and can pay salaries, I’ve come up with an alternative plan to fund my rabbinic education: a CSR, or Community Supported Rabbi.

I am offering  annual “subscriptions”, a commitment of a piece of my time and energy, devoted to you and your needs. This may take many forms.

  • God’s Dog Guide Dog Service: - personal, individual coaching and guidance through the spiritual wilderness of life. Always leading through questions, from one step behind. What are the questions you most want to use to find your answers?
  • Life Cycle events. I am legally authorized to conduct all functions of ministry, weddings, funerals and other life passages.
  • Teaching in individual or group sessions. Learn what I’m learning about spiritual life and history and how it can be meaningful right here and now.
  • Some new form we co-create. What do you most want right now in life?

My decades of leading men’s circles (and a few women’s retreats!), Rolfing, facilitating Shadow Work for men and women, executive coaching, and mentoring to young and old gives me the skill set and experience to offer real value right now, in the midst of my training.

My need is to raise  $8000 annually to cover administrative fees, classes and required retreats, and fees for my spiritual director.

I’m offering a tiered participation schedule:

$36 or above: A bottle of my wood fire crafted maple syrup- taste of heaven!

$180 annually- 2 personal sessions for spiritual guidance, coaching, teaching or Rolfing

$360 annually- 5 personal sessions for spiritual guidance, coaching, teaching or Rolfing

$720 annually- 12 personal sessions for spiritual guidance, coaching, teaching or Rolfing, or 5 sessions and one lifecycle event

$1800 annually- 24 personal sessions for spiritual guidance, coaching, teaching or Rolfing, or combination of above and lifecycle events, ongoing mentoring.


If you can't or don't want to participate yourself, please share this with others- or give it as a gift!
Please  get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. You can  use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hello everyone my name is Anibal Guerra a Venezuelan Computing science professor who is currently in Medellin Colombia making my PhD in Electronic Engineering.. Becoming a doctor is very important to me since being a professor has always been the dream of my life.

The reason I'm here today is, as perhaps you’ve seen, my country (Venezuela) is under a strict control of currency which requires that in order to enjoy my money (in bolivars) I must buy dollars to the Venezuelan government. But for more than a year most of student requests for purchasing dollars have been denied by the government, and in my personal case I have not received a single dollar since last May. [Check Venezuelan students currency problems]

Despite only having a student visa (as required by Venezuelan government) I have taken informal Jobs to get some money, but right now I have no money to pay the full amount of my fifth semester enrollment. I don’ t want to stop studying, but the University of Antioquia is asking me for the payment of the last semester which already ended but I have not paid yet. In the next months I will try to obtain my residence here and to be able to work formally as a professor here if needed, but it will take a couple of months left.

So your help can make me to grow professionally in I a way I can be a better professor and teach better things to new generations. I appeal to those who have the availability and willingness to help with one, two or five dollars to help achieve this objective to continue my education and become a better professor.I need to gather about 10000 dollars only to pay for the three semesters left and the past one. I believe that through my project you can plant something as valuable as the knowledge, in the lives of others. I’m sure that with your help I can make it, I’ve been studying and working as a researcher for the last 10 years [here : Facultad de Ciencias y Tecnologia, Universidad de Carabobo]. In addition, I have come to this 6th semester with a 4.8/5 score.

Finally, Money is not the only way to help; you can spread my words to your family and Friends and share my profile in your social networks. A prayer will also be good for me.

story:
Short Summary

Let us tell you the basics of this project and our vision for it. We believe Curious Mondo will impact the lives of many people around the World and you can be instrumental in this process.

Curious Mondo will provide Free, Live, Online training in different categories: Arts and Crafts, Business and Marketing, Design, Photography and Technology, Beauty and Wellness. These are in depth courses focusing on improving the skills of professionals or providing new skills for people to start a new business. All of the courses given by experienced experts in the respective areas.

The courses will be free and live during three days and then people will have the option to buy lifetime access to them. In case they want to watch the recordings over and over again. Through the sales of the recorded files we can make sure people can revisit the training as often as needed while we also have enough income to compensate the amazing experts and our own structure to make it possible.

All content will be provided live. No content will be hidden for those who pay. What you see is what you get.

What We Need 

Here is the break down of what we need:

  • A computer that we need to build to be able to hold several hours of live streaming with a specific video card for multiple cameras.
  • Some LED lights for the studio.
  • 3 big monitors
  • a small crew of people to help us run
  • A new camera. We need to work with 3 to 4 cameras. We have two.


What you get

  • You get the satisfaction of helping us launch this business
  • We have great perks, take a look on the right. You can even be on our hall of fame!!!!!
  • You will help us make a difference and impact lives.

The Impact

Now, how do we see this impacting lives?

Imagine Anna, a young single mother with three kids. Anna struggles to make ends meet with her job. She wants a better life for her kids. So she watches Curious Mondo courses, acquires some new skills and starts a part time home based business on nail art. The life of this family will now change for better.

Joe is 55 and just lost his job. He knows it is not going to be easy to be back in the market at his age. Joe has a passion for photography. He attends some of Curious Mondo free, live training and improves his skills on photography. He also learns about the photography business and marketing. Joe goes in a new journey in his life doing what he loves the most.

Sabina lives in a third World country in a small community with many challenges. She attends Curious Mondo Training programs on Arts and Crafts. She sees that she can use local resources to create beautiful pieces. She starts a group in her community, teaches them the skills she learned at Curious Mondo and the whole community now produces beautiful pieces that they can sell, export and acquire the resources they need to make their community a better place.

People will be able to access the courses online on any type of device and through our Roku Channel which is present in several countries.

There are many, many reasons why people need to improve their skills, acquire new knowledge and try new things. Many possibilities appear when you open yourself to learning. This impacts the individual, the group, the city, the country and the World.

Knowledge that people can use and see results fast can change the scenario of many lives.

You can play a big part on this vision by helping us make this a reality.

We are very close to launching. Just need a little help from our friends.

Join us on this journey!

Curious Mondo, where you conquer new possibilities.

Risks & Challenges

We have tested this format in a small market for over a year. It works! We have broken down every piece of the process and are confident this can be a great business. 

  • We are used to online media and live streaming.
  • We understand consumer behavior.
  • We leased a place for the studio, have the website almost ready and have most of the equipment to start.
  • The risk if we don't get all the money we need is to launch with just one camera. Which makes it very boring to people but that is how we did for over a year and had sales even with this limitation. Of course, the quality of the final product will not be as good and with some topics like crafts or cooking will make it very difficult to happen.
  • It is a business, there is always some risk but we are very confident we can make it work.
  • March 2016 is when we plan to start.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can always help:

  • The more you share and talk about our project, the better. It does help us a lot!
  • Use the  Indiegogo share tools!
  • Let's get the word out!

Curious Mondo- Where you conquer new possibilities!

story:
The Exponential Increase in Vaccines-Related Online Platforms Has Made the Internet One of the Main Sources of Information Worldwide. However, Online Communities With Greater Freedom of Speech Have, Regretfully, Become a Powerful Platform for Anti-Vaccine Voices and the Sharing of Defective Medical Information. Health Communicators and Medical Institutions Have Not Yet Been Taken their Online responsibility as Seriously as it Should be.

For this Reason, the Main Objectives of Cimaza Virology Comics, the Winner of the Science Hero Award in 2015, are to:

1) Raise Public (Mainly Kids & Young Learners) Awareness;

2) Inform about Means of Preventing the Transmission of Viral Diseases; and

3) Provide Basic Knowledge and Guidelines in an Easy, Enjoyable, Inspirational, and Informative Way, both in Comics & Animations.

Because  Many People Feel Uncomfortable about the For-Profit Companies Who Produce Vaccines. We Have Decided to Go IndieGoGo 

(Meaning: To Let Normal People to Fund the Work, NOT Big Pharma)

,

This work is Produced not Just by an Artist – but an by Artist with a Medical Background (Ph.D in Virology). This is a Rare Combination Which Only Adds to the Uniqueness of the Work.


It Remains to Tell You that:

The Fund Would Cover the Cost of the

Authors/Artist ---- 0 $ 

Editor---- 500  $

Animators---- 1500 $

and Voice Over-Talents ---- 2500 $ Working on the Producation of the Film.

Plus, AdWord/FB Promoting Fees at Monthly Basis ----- 500 $

Rewards Shipment Fees from ITALY to the USA/World ---- 500-1000 $

Thank you very much. 

Susan Nasif, Ph.D

story:
“Even long ago there were some men who could not make all the things that were needed. In each camp there were only a few who could make everything. The hardest thing to build was the canoe. The man who could make a canoe was very happy because the people depended on it so much.” – John Kawapit, Eastern Cree, Great Whale River, Quebec

You CAN help create NEW TRADITIONS for Anishinaabe youth through CANOE TRADITIONS. Through CANOE TRADITIONS, Anishinaabe youth CAN reNEW old TRADITIONS. Please support this project. Chii Miigwech!!!!

I am very proud of my Anishnaabe heritage. I was very fortunate to have Art Solomon, an Anishinaabe Elder, as one of my teachers.

Art once said:

"The traditional way of education was by example, experience, and storytelling. The first principle involved was total respect and acceptance of the one to be taught, and that learning was a continuous process from birth to death. It was total continuity without interruption. Its nature was like a fountain that gives many colours and flavours of water and that whoever chose could drink as much or as little as they wanted to whenever they wished. The teaching strictly adhered to the sacredness of life whether of humans, animals or plants."

I believe that the arts can be a way to better understand ourselves….to better understand each other….to know about our culture and traditions. To know where one is going, one must know when one has come from. As Louis Riel said: "My people will sleep for one hundred years, but when they awake, it will be the artists who give them their spirit back."

I have a background in education (mainly environmental science and outdoor education) as well as in the social services field. In addition, I have been involved with several youth canoe building projects.

This idea all started as a result of the Fort Severn Canoe Project. In the summer of 2012, John Hupfield and I went to Fort Severn (on Hudson’s Bay) to help conduct a month long workshop in the restoration of wood canvas Freighter canoes, with the local First Nations youth, which was featured on CBC’s The National (see http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/story/2012/04/27/f-fortsevern-canoe-restoration.html).

Though my work in Fort Severn was supposed to be restoring Freighter canoes, it involved much more, especially after the project was extended through the entire summer. Besides the work on canoes, this experience awoke my desire to contribute in a positive way, with all I had gained while doing social service work and as an educator, as well as through traditional teachings. Since I am of the Bear clan, I suppose one could say that the bear came out of hibernation.

So I returned to my artistic roots, since I learned much about my Anishinaabe culture and traditions through art….as well as being able to share such knowledge with others.

In 2015, we got funded through the Toronto Art Council's Animating Historic Sites to work at Todmorden Mills and produce the Journey By Canoe: An Indigenous Art Project and Exhibition. The canoe would portray a visual representation of a journey that we all have taken, whether the Original Peoples of this land or New Canadians from other lands. The canoe was used as a metaphor for such a journey. It was a story of one's own migration....learning not only to paddle the canoe, but also walk the path of life too. Maybe through this art project, not only was First Nation history and culture illustrated, but all the Sacred Colours (all races) involved may have found a way to bridge any cultural differences.

But this was just part of a larger plan....a small step towards a bigger goal. Building on what we achieved in the art show at Todmorden Mills last summer, we would like to work towards taking an actual Journey By Canoe. During the summer of 2017.

An Ontario First Nations canoe project is envisioned, patterned after Pulling Together (http://pullingtogether.ca/) or Tribal Journeys (http://tribaljourneys.wordpress.com/) from the West Coast. This could be called Journey By Canoe, involving a number of canoe trips from various Anishinaabe (Ojibway) communities from around Lake Huron and Georgian Bay, as well as inland from Temagami, North Bay, Lake Simcoe and the Kawarthas, with the trips ending at Manitoulin Island. Such trips are thus centered around one of the Great Lakes, the traditional territory of the Anishinaabe people.

The Ojibway or Anishinaabe people were canoe people. These series of canoe trips could bring awareness of Native culture and traditions; as well as engaging Native youth, especially with Elders. Opportunities for teachings will be had, through the various aspects of this project, from the building process to the actual canoe trips. As well these trips could bring awareness to First Nations rights; to Mother Earth; to the environment; to water; to the Great Lakes; and wilderness. Such trips could involve bark canoes or wood canvas canoes. Built by Anishinaabe youth. Using the most natural materials possible.

But such a project will be a very involved and large undertaking. Sometimes it is better to take small steps (crawl before you walk, and walk before you run). This proposed initiative is one such step.

It is hoped that such an annual journey would start in 2017....the Sesquicentennial year for Canada....but more so a beginning for Anishinabek youth.

To do so we want to build several canoes this year (2016). As well, we hope to create a non-profit foundation to pursue funding opportunities that would permit growing this idea even further....such as winter camping....maybe even looking at also building snowshoes or toboggans....or even tikinagans.

But more than anything else creating ways to get youth back out on the land.

SO with the funding from this Indiegogo campaign, Canoe Traditions, we could build several canoes, both birch bark and wood/canvas. These builds would occur at Curve Lake First Nation, during a pilot project that is supported by Chief and Council. The canoes built would all become part of the envisioned canoe journey. 

Curve Lake First Nation will serve as the base for the first series of builds. It is also possible that youth from other communities such as Alderville, Hiawatha and Scugog Island First Nations could be involved in these canoe builds at Curve Lake. This is dependent on final approval from the respective First Nation communities, which is only possible with adequate funding.

"The canoe is a very important piece of our history, the history of this Mississauga ancestral territory." - Chief Phyllis Williams, Curve Lake First Nation

Four wood canvas canoes can be built for $25,000.

Two birch bark canoes can be built for $35,000.

SO the total request for this Indiegogo campaign, Canoe Traditions, is $60,000. Anything raised beyond and above that would be applied to the overall canoe project....the overall canoe journey.

We do offer perks, dependent on the cash value donated, that may range from Indigenous art to other unique opportunities....check them out.  

Overall, we hope to raise enough funding and support to create an ongoing project, building both wood canvas and birch bark canoes, as well as related traditional items, in First Nation communities. Funding raised could also create a training allowance for participants during the canoe builds.

"First, the canoe connects us to Ma-ka-ina, Mother Earth, from which we came and to which we must all return. Councils of those who were here before us revered the earth and also the wind, the rain, and the sun – all essential to life. It was from that remarkable blending of forces that mankind was allowed to create the canoe and its several kindred forms. From the birch tree, came the bark; from the spruce, pliant roots; from the cedar, the ribs, planking and gunwales; and from a variety of natural sources, the sealing pitch. In other habitats, great trees became dugout canoes while, in treeless areas, skin, bone and sinew were ingeniously fused into kayaks. Form followed function, and manufacture was linked to available materials. Even the modern canoe, although several steps away from the first, is still a product of the earth. We have a great debt to those who experienced the land before us. No wonder that, in many parts of the world, the people thank the land for allowing its spirit to be transferred to the canoe. Hand-propelled watercraft still allow us to pursue the elemental quest for tranquility, beauty, peace, freedom and cleaness. It is good to be conveyed quietly, gracefully, to natural rhythms….The canoe especially connects us to rivers – timeless pathways of the wilderness. Wave after wave of users have passed by. Gentle rains falling onto a paddler evaporate skyward to form clouds and then to descend on a fellow traveller, perhaps in another era. Likewise, our waterways contain something of the substance of our ancestors. The canoe connects us to the spirit of these people who walk beside us as we glide silently along riverine trails." – Kirk Wipper, founder of the Canadian Canoe Museum

story:
Summary

This program brings 10 girls from under-resourced Bay Area communities to Daraja Academy in Kenya. Daraja is a high school for girls from humble beginnings who, without Daraja, would not have been able to attend school. Graduates of Daraja will lead our Bay Area girls in a two-week workshop of Daraja’s leadership and empowerment program called W.I.S.H., which stands for Women of Integrity, Strength, and Hope. The workshop will focus on team building, identity, self-esteem, peace making, and leadership. Through W.I.SH., the girls will explore what it means to be a woman and a changemaker in their own worlds, as well as in the world they share. Upon return to the US, our girls will lead their own workshops in their communities at home. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we receive for this program will pay for:
  • Flight costs
  • Room and Board at Daraja 
  • Insurance
  • (3) Adult Leaders
If you donate, you will receive: 
  • Updates on our program, with photos (any amount) 
  • Mid-program video message from our girls in Kenya ($25)
  • A personal postcard from our time in Kenya ($50)
  • "She is Powerful Beyond Measure" T-shirt ($200)

The Impact

This program will help Bay Area girls discover their inner power and identity as women and changemakers in their communities. Our program will also give them the tools to share what they have learned, through workshops that they will lead in their own communities upon our return to the US. By the end of the program, these Bay Area girls will be seen by themselves and others as excellent models of the Integrity, Strength, and Hope that our world needs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about our program by sharing this link, check out the amazing girls at Daraja Academy, and, most importantly, work to empower every girl and woman in your life!

story:
Short Summary

#LetsTeachCode is education movement which wants to bring coding into every classroom around the World, starting with 196 schools in 196 countries in 2016. 

"We are making 2016 the year of code" - Harry McCann

#LetsTeachCode was Co-Founded by 17 year old Irish school students, Harry McCann and Jack Cullen.


What We Need & What You Get

Over the space of the next 11 months we will be connecting with people in every country in the World to bring coding into 196 schools. Your funds will help us to provide the resources and equipment to the schools so they can start teaching coding to their students.

We are asking for €20,000 to get us started, and to get schools coding.

In return for your generousity we would like to thank you with some 'Thank You' gifts.


The Impact your money will have

As we said, your money will go a long way in helping us to reach students all over the World and equipping their schools with the tools, resources and equipment necessary to teach them coding.  
Your money will allow us to provide these schools with these tools, resources and equipment, so without your money, this would not be possible.


Risks & Challenges

We plan on reaching every country in the World in 2016, and bring coding into one of their schools. Every country will present a different risk and challenge, but with your money we can work people in these countries to ensure that we can achieve what we have set out to do which is introduce coding into 196 schools in 196 different countries.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute money to our project so heres a few ideas of how you can help:

  • Share on social media using the #LetsTeachCode 
  • Visit www.letsteachcode.com and pledge your time to #LetsTeachCode, and help us get in touch with schools all around the World.

story:
Help Build the 'BMSBH' Center

My name is Supawan Green, I’m a Buddhist author of some 40 books both in Thai and English. Throughout the past 20 years I have given talks, led retreats and conducted workshops comprising of meditation by using Tai Chi as a simple, non-religious means to ease mental pain for people. I have helped hundreds of students of different countries, creeds and religions to 'bring their mental self back home'.

With your help, I want to now take my teaching to a new level by establishing a center in which people can learn to use meditation through various means in order to reduce mental suffering.

It is my goal to help solve problems at the source: the mind - paving the way for global stability, peace and harmony.

The 'Bring Your Mental Self Back Home' Centre will consist of two departments:

a) Learning Area
b) Practical Area

Learning Area 

This area will help individuals understand how the human mind works and the reason for our confinement in the prison of life. Also learning how mental turmoil arises and how to combat it. Ajarn Supawan’s simple analogy of 'Tom and Jerry' will be the universal basis of learning how the human mind works. The analogy is well known amongst Supawan’s followers, but hasn’t been recognized by a wider audience; so this center will be able to propagate the use of this clear and simple device.

Practical Area

 This department will enable the students to practice what they have learnt in the Learning Area. Equipping them with the crucial tools to help them through daily lives; both at work and at home, where they have to meet people who they like and dislike and all the challenges that come with these interactions. This practice will help people to reduce and overcome their mental turmoil in all forms. The crucial tool is to ‘bringing your mental self back home’.

The results of practicing the four foundations of mindfulness are:
Solving the problem at the source: the mind. When the mind of the individual is strong due to this practice, they will develop the wisdom and know how to solve problems on their own without crossing the moral threshold. 

By tackling the individual’s mind, this will amount to solving widespread social problems – creating an ‘Enlightening Culture’. By eradicating unwholesome thoughts, their actions will be wholesome and naturally moral. 

The Rooms of the Practical Area

In terms of practicing the four foundations of mindfulness, the practitioner must engage in the practice continually in four different postures (sitting, walking, standing, lying) and in every waking moment. Therefore, a normal household environment is most ideal for this purpose. The practical area will be split into four rooms –

Massage and Meditation Room

Traditional Thai massage can easily be adapted to our ‘enlightening culture’ by emphasizing the execution of massage with mindfulness. In this room, both the masseur and the receiver will be encouraged to bring their mental selves back home to calm mental turmoil. This will also provide a wholesome occupation to prospective masseurs.

Meditative Exercise Room

This is the room where we will focus on physical activities such as Tai Chi, Qi Gong and Yoga. These exercises can help cultivate high levels of self-awareness and help people overcome mental turmoil.

Meditative Kitchen

The kitchen is the most important part of any household with lots of activities carried out here. It is therefore the ideal place to practice mindfulness with such activities as washing and chopping vegetables, cooking, cleaning and so on. All these daily menial activities contain hidden spiritual wealth. If they pursue witha the practice, the individual can easily find happiness in their everyday tasks.

Meditative Living Room

This room will focus on other tasks that aren't done in the kitchen: cleaning, sweeping, mopping, ironing, folding clothes, washing laundry from massage room,
knitting, sewing, embroidery, painting and other artistic crafts, talking meditation.

Meditative Garden

Provided that the centre has enough space for a garden, all gardening activities will also be done in meditative manners as guided by Ajarn Supawan. 

Planting the Seed of Enlightenment

You can see that this project is on a large scale and will require the appropriate funding to make it a reality. The BMSBH association would like to ask for your help to make this project become possible.

Ways You Can Help

Monetary contributions would be the most helpful way to realise the center.

Please use the links at the side to share our ambition on your social networks. 
Thank you for taking the time to listen to our plea. We hope very much that we will have your kind support.

Please contact via email: supawanpg@gmail.com or innocentperception@gmail.com

My name is Supawan Green, I’m a Buddhist author of some 40 books both in Thai and English. Throughout the past 20 years I have given talks, led retreats and conducted workshops comprising of meditation by using Tai Chi as a simple, non-religious means to ease mental pain for people. I have helped hundreds of students of different countries, creeds and religions to 'bring their mental self back home'.With your help, I want to now take my teaching to a new level by establishing a center in which people can learn to use meditation through various means in order to reduce mental suffering.It is my goal to help solve problems at the source: the mind - paving the way for global stability, peace and harmony.The 'Bring Your Mental Self Back Home' Centre will consist of two departments:a) Learning Areab) Practical AreaLearning Area This area will help individuals understand how the human mind works and the reason for our confinement in the prison of life. Also learning how mental turmoil arises and how to combat it. Ajarn Supawan’s simple analogy of 'Tom and Jerry' will be the universal basis of learning how the human mind works. The analogy is well known amongst Supawan’s followers, but hasn’t been recognized by a wider audience; so this center will be able to propagate the use of this clear and simple device.Practical Area This department will enable the students to practice what they have learnt in the Learning Area. Equipping them with the crucial tools to help them through daily lives; both at work and at home, where they have to meet people who they like and dislike and all the challenges that come with these interactions. This practice will help people to reduce and overcome their mental turmoil in all forms. The crucial tool is to ‘bringing your mental self back home’.The results of practicing the four foundations of mindfulness are:Solving the problem at the source: the mind. When the mind of the individual is strong due to this practice, they will develop the wisdom and know how to solve problems on their own without crossing the moral threshold. By tackling the individual’s mind, this will amount to solving widespread social problems – creating an ‘Enlightening Culture’. By eradicating unwholesome thoughts, their actions will be wholesome and naturally moral. The Rooms of the Practical AreaIn terms of practicing the four foundations of mindfulness, the practitioner must engage in the practice continually in four different postures (sitting, walking, standing, lying) and in every waking moment. Therefore, a normal household environment is most ideal for this purpose. The practical area will be split into four rooms –Massage and Meditation RoomTraditional Thai massage can easily be adapted to our ‘enlightening culture’ by emphasizing the execution of massage with mindfulness. In this room, both the masseur and the receiver will be encouraged to bring their mental selves back home to calm mental turmoil. This will also provide a wholesome occupation to prospective masseurs.Meditative Exercise RoomThis is the room where we will focus on physical activities such as Tai Chi, Qi Gong and Yoga. These exercises can help cultivate high levels of self-awareness and help people overcome mental turmoil.Meditative KitchenThe kitchen is the most important part of any household with lots of activities carried out here. It is therefore the ideal place to practice mindfulness with such activities as washing and chopping vegetables, cooking, cleaning and so on. All these daily menial activities contain hidden spiritual wealth. If they pursue witha the practice, the individual can easily find happiness in their everyday tasks.Meditative Living RoomThis room will focus on other tasks that aren't done in the kitchen: cleaning, sweeping, mopping, ironing, folding clothes, washing laundry from massage room,knitting, sewing, embroidery, painting and other artistic crafts, talking meditation.Meditative GardenProvided that the centre has enough space for a garden, all gardening activities will also be done in meditative manners as guided by Ajarn Supawan. Planting the Seed of EnlightenmentYou can see that this project is on a large scale and will require the appropriate funding to make it a reality. The BMSBH association would like to ask for your help to make this project become possible.Ways You Can HelpMonetary contributions would be the most helpful way to realise the center.
Please use the links at the side to share our ambition on your social networks. Thank you for taking the time to listen to our plea. We hope very much that we will have your kind support.Please contact via email: supawanpg@gmail.com or innocentperception@gmail.com

story:
Pedway is a social media platform geared to helping people and businesses network based on commonalities.  People and businesses alike can connect based on personal and professional interests.  We identify the compatibility between profiles using a unique algorithm we've developed and make recommendations to anyone looking to find others with similar values.

  • Business- Find New Connections, Grow Your Business, Receive Professional Advice, Apply For Jobs, Collaborate With Team Members, and Monetize Content.
  • Education-  View Grades, Find Schools, See Your School Schedule, Be Recruited, and See Your Competition On A Global Scale. 
  • Social- Post, Share, Chat, Comment, See Compatibility.
  • Pages- Business Pages, Events, Groups.
  • Explore- Videos, Articles, Slides, Podcast, Webinars, Photos, Games, Webinars, Events, Pages, Groups, Apps, New Friends, Place and Deals. 

  • AND MUCH MORE!!!

(Pedway was formally known as ConnectHub)


Ryan Stahl- Hello to everyone here at Indiegogo, my name is Ryan Stahl.  I was fortunate enough to grow up in beautiful sunny Sarasota, FL where my favorite past times involve boating and fishing.  I am also an avid music fanatic and thoroughly enjoy playing guitar and exploring new music.  I received my bachelor's degree in Entertainment Business from Full Sail University in Winter Park, FL and have been working in the broadcast industry since graduating in 2012.  I have experience working in sales at WXIN ( the FOX affiliate in Indianapolis).  I also have experience in the software side of the advertising sector.  I work for a software company called WideOrbit as an Implementation Specialist, where I train businesses how to use and implement our business management software efficiently to maximize revenue.  I have trained numerous stations across the U.S., including stations owned by large corporations such as Media General and Cox Media Group.  I have to coordinate all departments within a station, which includes sales, traffic, accounting, promotions, and master control.

Robert Roche- Thank you for visiting our page on Indegogo! My name is Robert Roche and I am from Orlando Florida. When I was 18, I attended Full Sail University in Winter Park, FL where I studied marketing and business and dreamt about becoming an entrepreneur. During college I was driven to be a leader, an innovator, and inspired to be on the cutting edge. After graduating by the age of 20 with my bachelors degree, I had the pleasure in playing professional golf while I followed my dream of entrepreneurship. Later on I moved to Sarasota, FL where I worked with a travel company called Grand Incentives and helped launch over 3 new travel programs. I helped pioneer their sales script, ran a team that specialized in new product launches, and helped them cultivate a customer service team which increased company sales. I am currently specializing in sales and consulting in the Orlando area until Pedway is ready to launch which then I will spend my full time helping drive it’s success. 

Pedway is an idea my partners Robert Roche and I developed to help people connect for both personally and professionally at a more in depth level than just meeting others through mutual friends.  When I moved up to Indianapolis for my first career job, I didn't know any people living there.  I had trouble finding new friends and making new connections, it was difficult for me to move to a city where I didn't know anyone.  This in turn took a toll on me, to the point where I felt alone and depressed because I couldn't find any new friends I could associate and collaborate with.  If I had a tool like Pedway at the time, I could have used it to find local friends that have much of the same commonalities as me.  It essentially is a tool used to break the ice meeting new friends on a personal level.  I am confident my experience would have been different if I had a tool like this at my disposal. 

With proper funding, we can make this dream become a reality.  We have invested many hours into this idea.  Once we receive the proper funded needed to start this campaign.  We can begin working a better future for everyone.  People will be able to make friends much easier and businesses will be able to find better quality candidates.  Today as a society we are so involved in technology and it is only going to rise to new levels.  The ability to network and meet as many people as we can to grow ourselves and our businesses is essential to success in today's fast-paced environment.  Businesses have been having trouble keeping employees in the long term.  Employees move companies too often and we are confident we can start working towards helping those employees find the right fit for their professional careers.  It will also be much easier for people to make new friends on a personal level.  Moving and traveling to new cities will be less stressful when trying to network and connect to people who have many similarities. 


1.  Cost- Starting a social media company is a very costly adventure. We have to hire a large IT team to develop our product,  update and fix bugs, and build new features as we bring new innovative ideas to the drawing table.

2.  Competition- In today’s market there are several big name social media companies. We will have to continue to innovate and build a superior product to dominate and stay on top of direct competitors.

3.  Brand Recognition- One of the most important things is brand recognition. We will need to develop a world-class marketing campaign so we may gain users and become publicly recognized.  We will need to saturate all social media outlets and do whatever it takes to overcome obscurity.

The funds from this campaign will be used to start the initial development work for our product.  We have spent a lot of time and effort creating a mock up, defining a business plan, and discussing end-to-end functionalities that Pedway will encompass.  The next step is to secure the funding necessary to make this venture a reality.  Despite whether or not we reach our goal, all funds will go towards the development work for our product.  We are confident that this new social media platform will be a success.  We just need your help getting there!

Pedway is the next generation of social media that connects people all around the world.  It essentially eliminates the “stranger” factor in both personal and professional aspects.  Companies will be able find better quality candidates much more efficiently.  Businesses will be able to better relate to their clients wants and needs, further increasing the customer experience.  People will be able to connect with one another based on the compatibility of their profiles; ultimately eliminating the fear of talking to strangers for the first time.  Pedway will be the center of all your connections in all aspects of daily life.

Obscurity is one of the most difficult obstacles to overcome when starting a new business and breaking into any market, regardless of the product.  With your help, we can get the word out about Pedway by sharing our story and telling your friends.  Please follow us on our social media outlets and share them with your friends to spread the word.

story:
We wrote #ADMITTED for every student who has ever dreamed of thriving in life by becoming successful. The student that wants to provide for their family by doing what they love for a living. This book is for every student who wants to live their best life. Each student who has dreams of going to college and is willing to do whatever it takes to succeed. We want to do our part to help students reach higher. Your support will help students just like us, to successfully navigate the process.

                   The Need & How You Can Help


  • It is our goal to raise $20,000. This will help us get #ADMITTED into the hands of the first 1,000 high school students who need this information. 
  • UPDATE- With your support, we raised $2,980 during our first campaign launch. Thank You!     We still have a ways to go. We appreciate your continued support. Together, we can make a difference!
  • We’re offering many ways in which you can invest in this project. Have a look and thanks in advance for taking part!

    The Impact: College Access For All Students

For some first generation, low income or under-resourced students, the simple act of daring to dream and setting a goal to go to college is revolutionary. All too often, student's families do not have access to resources they need to make sure their children are properly prepared for high school and the college application process. Sometimes even if they are prepared, they may not have the money, time at their disposal to make sure their child can succeed in the way he or she could if the odds were in their favor. This guide serves as an important tool bridge the gap to success. All of the important steps a student needs to take, myths they can overcome, habits they need to develop, and relationships they need to foster are all included in #ADMITTED.

"Let us think of education as the means of developing our greatest abilities, because in each of us there is a private hope and dream which, fulfilled, can be translated into benefit for everyone and greater strength for our nation." 
- John F. Kennedy

             When Will You Receive your Book(s)?

Books will ship within 45 days of the completion of the campaign.

Note: Sponsor level provides books for students in need. Books will not be shipped to you directly. 


                        Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some that people are unable to contribute. Here are a few other opportunities to help!

  • If you want to help more students continue their education, please help us spread the word and make some noise about our campaign!
  • You can send out emails to your contacts, tweet, make a Facebook post, make a phone call for us, or do all of them!
  • Please also use to use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • If you want to contact us directly with ideas or referrals. We want to hear from you! Email us at nhopson@ever-appropriate.com

                                                                     Simple! Right?  

                                                              We thank you in advance!

story:
Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights Foundation Switzerland 

The Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights Foundation was launched in 2015 to represent the international organisation Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights in Switzerland.

The Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights Foundation is a politically independent & confessionally neutral, non-for profit organization under Swiss law. The Foundation is exclusively funded by donations from within Switzerland and exclusively operates in Switzerland.

The foundation acts as a "start-up" in the Swiss NGO-scene and therefore is actively involved in fundraising, which is especially necessary to support the development of all material related to the educational program Speak Truth To Power.   


VISION STATEMENT 

"Continuing the legacy of Robert F. Kennedy and keeping to the long tradition of humanity and democracy in Switzerland, we strive for a society, in which every human being not only knows and respects human rights, but protects them during everyday life."



SPEAK TRUTH TO POWER 

Speak Truth To Power is a multi-faceted human rights education program consisting of a book, an online learning platform, a photo exhibit, an iPad app (in development phase), and a theatre play. The whole program is free for all students in Switzerland. 

Children learn through this program that they too can be human rights defenders, and they too can stand up and speak out when they see injustice happening around them.

Together with the Competence Center for Human Rights at the University of Zurich and the Teachers College in Fribourg, the Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights Foundation developed a book containing stories of international as well as Swiss Human Rights defenders from the past and presence. 



Who are the people behind this crowdfunding campaign?
We represent a group of students in their final year of studies from the University of St. Gallen in Switzerland who work together with the foundation. 
We were challenged with setting up a fundraising structure for this foundation. We strive to gain traction in Switzerland and share our thoughts about human rights with the world by doing so.  
In order to push the program we need more funding to pay for current and future events to reach out to schools and students within Switzerland. A substantial part of the funds will be used to print and distribute educational material to schools directly. 

Here you can donate to the program directly: Donate

story:
OUR GOAL:

Our goal is to create and produce a mobile app series on conflict resolution for preschool age children.

Our pilot app will include the following:

  • Seven to ten minute puppet video "appisode"
  • Interactive games
  • Sing along with original music
  • Experts corner for parents and caregivers to nurture skills

We believe we must use the digital space to develop content that generates positive interactions with peers, to counter–balance the possible loss of social–emotional skill development that can result from individual screen use. We will create an app series focused on conflict resolution to help break cycles of negative interaction and teach children skills of self–regulation in social situations, for example:

  • Resolution of peer conflicts
  • Cooperative play
  • Empathy
  • Inclusion 

                                     

                                    

During early childhood, children form lasting skills of communication, socialization and emotional development. Research also shows that at this time, peacemakers and bullies begin to emerge. Resolution of relational conflicts and the successful building of social–emotional skills can defuse frustrations that create negative outcomes, such as:

  • Bullying
  • Exclusion
  • Violent Behavior

The costs of these behaviors are impacting families and communities, and can ultimately result in violent behaviors, crime and incarceration.


WHO WE ARE: 
Building Seeds Foundation is a 501(c)(3), tax exempt, non–profit corporation, formed to impact the development of conflict resolution skills for preschool age children, including under–served communities. BUILDING healthy relationships in families, locally and globally, requires the foundational SEEDS of positive social–emotional skills learned at a young age.


APP SERIES:

Within our app series, the child will witness puppet archetypes, in live action video as well as digital games, that enact situations and behaviors that are familiar to them. Through these stories they will learn strategies to resolve conflicts during face–to–face interactions.

App Function Diagram:

                                                                  

Why Puppets? The traditional art form of puppetry is multi–cultural. Experts know that puppets unite children of the world with a common “language”.  Our puppets are the soul of our storytelling.


OUR TEAM:

Each of our team members is highly skilled in their respective fields with individual recognition:

  • Ph.D. in Cognitive Psychology: nationally published
  • Script Writers and Content Experts: published in children’s literature and educational books, and lead seminars for training of preschool teachers.
  • Creative Producer/Supervising Editor: contributed to launch of Sesame Street for first five years, three–time Emmy Award winner, Grammy Award nominated 
  • Master Puppeteer: internationally recognized
  • Creative & Design Team: Designers Guild Award, Critics Choice Theatrical Award, published interior designer, four–time Golden Reel Award winner

Up until now, we have been self funded. We need your support through tax-deductible donations to realize the next phase that will bring our app series to reality. 

Be a partner and become a member of our FOUNDERS CIRCLE.

All phase one campaign donors will be recognized as our Founders Circle, in perpetuity.

PHASE ONE: CREATION OF THE PILOT

Creation of the pilot, including research of the app format and features with the most effective impact to the child:

  • Script development by experts for pilot study in English and Spanish
  • Creation of puppets
  • Test pilot in preschools (Michigan, Indiana, California)
  • Begin scope for beta app series
  • Purchase computer and video hardware and software
  • Web site development
  • Foundation Administration

Within our app series, the child will witness puppet archetypes, in live action video as well as digital games, that enact situations and behaviors that are familiar to them. Through these stories they will learn strategies to resolve conflicts during face–to–face interactions.
App Function Diagram:
                                                                  
Why Puppets? The traditional art form of puppetry is multi–cultural. Experts know that puppets unite children of the world with a common “language”.  Our puppets are the soul of our storytelling.

OUR TEAM:
Each of our team members is highly skilled in their respective fields with individual recognition:


Ph.D. in Cognitive Psychology: nationally published


Script Writers and Content Experts: published in children’s literature and educational books, and lead seminars for training of preschool teachers.


Creative Producer/Supervising Editor: contributed to launch of Sesame Street for first five years, three–time Emmy Award winner, Grammy Award nominated 


Master Puppeteer: internationally recognized


Creative & Design Team: Designers Guild Award, Critics Choice Theatrical Award, published interior designer, four–time Golden Reel Award winner



Up until now, we have been self funded. We need your support through tax-deductible donations to realize the next phase that will bring our app series to reality. 

Be a partner and become a member of our FOUNDERS CIRCLE.
All phase one campaign donors will be recognized as our Founders Circle, in perpetuity.



PHASE ONE: CREATION OF THE PILOT


Creation of the pilot, including research of the app format and features with the most effective impact to the child:



Script development by experts for pilot study in English and Spanish


Creation of puppets


Test pilot in preschools (Michigan, Indiana, California)


Begin scope for beta app series


Purchase computer and video hardware and software


Web site development


Foundation Administration

story:
Quick Summary

My name is Urmila, I studied Painting & Meditation in India, where
I became Master Painter Instructor in 2003 & studied several more
years with Meera Hashimoto my Art Therapy Teacher at that time
in Pune Osho ashram. Now I continue to learn & study with different
teachers by online videos classes. This nurture, give Roots & Wings
to my Creativity, Curiosity, Passion & keep it in Expansion Mode.

  •  I have always work as specialist of images ... photography, graphic
    & web design, visual art, heart's imagery are part of my background.
  • Being an Artist & a Conscious Art Teacher for more than 11 years,
    I feel now to expand in this new project that involved sharing precious valuable contents to benefits people's quality of Life & Creativity.
  • This project is to produce online videos in both *english & french*
    that can reach a larger, worldwide audience who can study
    at home, at one's own pace with both PDF & Videos support.
  • People will be able to buy those online videos to watch it, keep it
    by downloading the videos files on their computer. They benefit
    in learning & repeating few steps to integrate more deeply some
    processes that facilitate to find one's own Vision & its Free Expression.     It can be also an extra motivation to dive into your creative ocean all by yourself alone but with some support !
  • By contributing to this project, you allow me to move forward with it
    in a more fast way as it help me to buy materials &     buy services that
    make possible contents & videos to be online by beginning of 2017.
  • The World need Creative, Innovative & Empowered People that
    know their Talents & Possibilities. My Vision is to contribute
    in some way to this to happen, by sharing the Preciousness I have
    received with what I still keep learning in Painting, Creativity, Meditation, Knowing who I am, my qualities & my Talents.
  • That means your financial contribution support my project
    & also many people that will benefit this practical tools to
    enhance their Creativity & Life ! Thank You for all of that !

What is needed for this project to happen
& what I offer to you as counterparties !

Where your financial contribution go :
  • There is 2 projects one in english & one in french with an amount
    of 4'444.- each, means a total of 8'888.-
    I'm starting to run first the english indiegogo campaign
    from the 28 july to 28 september 2016 then the french one
    from 7 october to 7 december to have 4 months to complete funding.
  • This Amount is made to cover the price of the materials & services
    that are needed for videos to be shoot, edit & put on vimeo pro
    at the highest quality possible, to produce good quality contents.
  • In appropriate order I buy first ... then:
    (all price are mostly in Swiss francs)
    Canon EOS 80D/18-35 USM + 2 insurances (as it is professional use)
    :: 1503.- + 369.- + 339.- = 2211.- CHF
    Manfrotto MVK 502AM-1
    :: 439.- CHF (+ delivery eventually ???)
    Studio professional (cheap) Light,
    Set of 3 Lights (softbox, 2 side & 1 up)
    :: 110.- CHF
    Final Cut Pro
    :: 300.- $
    Vimeo Pro (1 year)
    :: 200.- $
    Mac Book Pro (15.4 screen)
    :: 1790.- CHF
    External Disk 4 To
    :: 160.- CHF
    Creative Cloud (1 year/pro)
    :: 908.- CHF
    Canon Flash 430EXIIIRT (accessory light)
    :: 250.- CHF
    PZ - E1 PowerZoom (accessory video)
    :: 149.- CHF
    RodeMic (accessory sounds/mic)
    :: 83.- CHF
    Cost of Delivery &     unplanned 
    :: 77.- CHF
    = 6677.- CHF
    As I am doing all those new learnings of skills & competences
    to produce those videos, I may need to buy some books, follow
    some trainings & ask for technical support ... + a memory card,     a bag
    for the Canon camera & all I have yet not become aware of :-))))))
    :: 2211.-
    = 8888.- CHF
  • As Counterparts you will have different options, to receive what's
    most appropriate & relevant for you or as a gift for your loved one!
    They are mostly deliver in 2017 for videos & as soon as available 
    for the other options. I made a special discount on each of them,
    to manifest my Gratitude & offer it to you at a     preferential rate!
  • All Contributions is going to benefit this project,
    even if the initial goal may not be reach fully!
    So whatever ... it's going to be immensely appreciated !
  • All the Names of Contributors will be mentioned on the Video
    "What is Conscious Art" that will be shoot in 2017, please let me
    know what to mention (as name & country) I will do it with an Immense Joy & Gratitude on the Trailer's Video & this Special 
    Video that will provide Vision, Creative tips & Meditations.

Impact

Being Awake, Creative & Grounded in the Confidence of one's own Talents
is a Value that is Major for the Future of our planet, the Futur of the next Generation & contribute in some genuine ways to the evolution of Humanity. 

  •  The Futur is created in the Present, by Thoughts & Actions
    that are aligned with the Preciousness of who you are & it's unique
    possibility to express Life in a very particular &     Beautiful way,
    that only you can     manifeste by your Love & Presence. 
  •  Everything we create has a global impact on all Life, like cells
    in a cosmic body, we all have a place, a function, a role to play
    in the All ! No Life is useless, meaningless, because Life is Pure
    Cosmic Intelligence in action.

  • To Contribute is what we are made for & came for ... 
    It's the Sacred goal of each Life that is weave in the Fabric
    of Existence! It's intrinsic to our Nature, to Life & Everyone
    has its part to play ! Like the Colibri's story :-))))))

  • Conscious Art is a way to develop a way of Living that is Creative
    & Beneficial for relationships to Oneself, People, Animal, Nature
    & Life. It restore again Love, Connexion, Interdependence, Dignity,
    inside & outside!

Risks & Challenges

My intention in Creating those online videos & contents is very clear
& mature, the principale risk are those which I'm not in control off as
Health issues, Accident, Death, Technologies Crash, Natural disasters & ...

The Challenges that may can come my way are linked to time & the pace
in which I learn the new skills that are needed to produce those contents, videos & put them online in beginning of 2017.
Also to work aside in different jobs to have support & money,
to make my project happen, can have an impact on the timing.

  •  As I am very drill & enthusiast to create this project & learn
    lots of new skills, my energy is very Passion oriented which fuel
    ma Creativity, boost my Energy, strength my Vision in finding
    Solutions & Possibilities to Create what Make my Heart Pulse
    with Joy & De.Light ... I just LoOove to Learn & Create :-))))) i!i
  •  I can rely a lot on the skills I already have on the field of
    Photography & Graphic Design for challenges that are linked
    to videos & PDF conceptions ... as I am Confident & at Ease
    in my Ground based skills & talents by 25 years of practices
    & experiences in this professional field!

Any Support is welcome

Anyone who have creative ideas on supporting this project 
in some others ways are most welcome to share it by
contacting Urmila at atelierlajoie@gmail.com ! Thank You :-)))))

  • Thank You for sharing this Indiegogo campaign
    & supporting this project     by mails or social medias (FB, Twitter, ...)
  • There are easy buttons to clic on & share with your friends
    & anyone who can be interested in participating to this
    De.Light.Full Creativity Adventure & receiving a beneficial
    enhancement from those Conscious Art online videos.
  • There is also an another possibility to contribute by buying a
    painting on my Artist website with my previous Artwork.
    (the website link is available on my indiegogo main page)

Thank You soOo much <3 
Infinite LoOove & Blessings

Urmila


Conscious Art is a mix of Visionary Art, Intuitive Painting,
Vison Quest & Sacred Art.
Very connected & grounded in Meditation, 
it is practicing Art, Creativity as a Meditation & use
the Power of deep Inquiries, Self.Love, Self.Knowing
to reach Clarity, Vision, Integrity, Balance & Radiance.
.
It is a way to Create Art, Oneself & one's own Life.
The Creation include all aspects, in the same time,
the Artist, the Vision, the Action & the Art are at One.
.
Your Life is a Masterpiece & Intentional Conscious Living
value the Preciousness of this Unique Original Life that
you are expressing by Being Yourself !

story:
Songs in Silver  

Developing an art project to raise funds for child education in W Africa

  • Who I am​

Hi my name is Yinka. I have spent most of my life involved in dance, the healing arts and personal development coaching. However my main expression is through art.
I believe that my ability to create art is a gift that I have been blessed with and for many years I have searched for how to use this gift to serve a higher purpose. I recently figured out a way to do this.

My plan is to create an on-going continuous collection of art and donate 30% (gross) from the sale of each piece to the development of children's education in the town of Aneho, Togo, West Africa. This is where my father is buried. Ultimately I intend to build a significant legacy in his name. My attitude is that in doing so I allow him to give back ... through me.

                 

  • The School

In the town of Aneho there is a primary school. The main classroom for this school is a basic brick shell where the children sit on wooden benches, 3 per bench per table. Each group of 3 shares one book and one pencil. I could go on describing how basic this well intentioned school is, however my focus is not on what they already have, it is on what I can give. How we can assist.

Togo is a relatively poor country where a family of 4 living in a small town outside the capital exists on less than $20 per week. My medium sized pieces (37" x  26") will sell for around $900 each.

The money raised from the sale of my art will buy tables, chairs, books and pencils for the school. My longer term goals are to finance the building of appropriate bathroom facilities and collaborate with others to pay a local family to supply the children with one meal a day. I am also researching the purchase of an old bus to ferry children in to school from the outskirts.

I will provide more in-depth information about the school in my updates.

                                             

Although my upbringing was not as impoverished as these children, I experienced a degree of poverty and displacement that was clearly transformed through not only the opportunities for learning, but also the quality of the environment I was in.

Money donated to this project will give me an incredible opportunity to develop my art to a significantly higher level and then use it as a platform to provide ongoing, long term assistance and transform this school into a beautiful oasis of learning.

              

  • My artwork

The initial phase of this project is to create 12 beautiful high quality pieces of art which reflect the passion and vibrancy of humans enjoying sensuous movement, a subject that has inspired me through my dance and healing work for several decades. 

I develop a piece of art in 3 stages ..1) A series of pencil drawings. 2) A mock up to look at the colours and composition. 3) Bringing together the chosen materials to create the finished piece. 

I have posted here some photo's of the mock ups to give an indication of how my imagination dances. These pictures are very basic and don't yet have the depth and quality that the finished work will sing with. However, I hope you can get a feel for what I am working towards.

               


The finished pieces will be approximate 37" x 26". A description of my style would be, somewhere between a sculpture and a collage. They are set on backgrounds of luxe velvet, stone or exotic hardwoods such as Ebony, Padauk and Honduras rosewood. Central to each piece is a figure in silver with the eyelashes and jewellery constructed in semi-precious gemstones such as Turquoise, Lapis, Blue Topaz and Rose Quartz crystals. 

                                                     

  • Funding for the art making

    *  Materials ..$5,700 US                      

    *  Tools and equipment ..$4,100 US

    *  Rent for a studio space ..$6,000 US

    *  Website and other marketing tools to promote my art work ..$4,200 US​

        Total $20,000 US

             

  • Where the percentage from the sale of the artwork will go​

    *  Providing excercise books, reading books and writing materials.

    *  Installing appropriate bathroom facilities.

    *  Providing proper tables and chairs.

    *  (Long term) Contributing to the employment of a local person to cook the children one meal a day.

    *  (Long term) Collaborate with others to buy an old bus and use it to ferry children in from the outlaying areas.

Addressing the various points on this list will have a significant impact on both the local economy and the quality of community engagement with the school.

             

  • How I will market my work

This first collection will take me approximately 10 months to finish. On completion I will fully engage in the advertising and marketing process. I will do this through a professionally designed website and associated social media tools. My primary target will be the high end dance, yoga and wellness industries I have worked with over the last 15 years, as well as sports and media celebrities.

                 

One of the worlds leading marketing experts Jonathan MacDonald, has offered to donate his expertise to this project. Jonathan MacDonald has not only advised dozens of the most well known companies such as Google, Apple, Nike, IKEA, Heineken, Lego, P&G, Unilever and Adidas, but is also the founder of the Thought Expansion Network, a platform containing the worlds most expert thinkers. The entire weight of this backing will drive the marketing strategy forward to ensure the success of this venture, which ultimately manifests in a happier and healthier school.

I will post regular video updates keeping contributors informed throughout the development of the art work as well as what has been purchased and the progress being made.

               

  • Appreciating your help

​I am deeply comforted and humbled by the support and donations-in-kind I have already received. Support with editing, writing, video, art supplies, lending of tools, materials and studio space. The enthusiasm and passion from the people around me has been truly amazing.

I imagine that most of you reading this are friends I have met over the years ..possibly as I have wandered around this luscious globe offering Heart Whispering sessions or movement meditation workshops. 
I would so dearly appreciate your contribution to this project. It will enable me to develop and use my gifts for a higher purpose and give us an exciting opportunity to make a significant difference to the lives of many children.
The depth of my passion and integrity for this project is why I am reaching out to you today. 
I would appreciate any donation you can offer no matter how small, to help me achieve this dream.
Also, if you could please pass this on through social media or through email to family and friends who might be interested in donating. It would mean the world to me!

Thank you

Happi days
Yinka

For more information about who I am ---  

www.honoryourmagnificence.com
