On completion I will fully engage in the advertising and marketing process. I will do this through a professionally designed website and associated social media tools. My primary target will be the high end dance, yoga and wellness industries I have worked with over the last 15 years, as well as sports and media celebrities.                 One of the worlds leading marketing experts Jonathan MacDonald, has offered to donate his expertise to this project. Jonathan MacDonald has not only advised dozens of the most well known companies such as Google, Apple, Nike, IKEA, Heineken, Lego, P&G, Unilever and Adidas, but is also the founder of the Thought Expansion Network, a platform containing the worlds most expert thinkers. The entire weight of this backing will drive the marketing strategy forward to ensure the success of this venture, which ultimately manifests in a happier and healthier school.I will post regular video updates keeping contributors informed throughout the development of the art work as well as what has been purchased and the progress being made.               Appreciating your help​I am deeply comforted and humbled by the support and donations-in-kind I have already received. Support with editing, writing, video, art supplies, lending of tools, materials and studio space. The enthusiasm and passion from the people around me has been truly amazing.I imagine that most of you reading this are friends I have met over the years ..possibly as I have wandered around this luscious globe offering Heart Whispering sessions or movement meditation workshops. I would so dearly appreciate your contribution to this project. It will enable me to develop and use my gifts for a higher purpose and give us an exciting opportunity to make a significant difference to the lives of many children.The depth of my passion and integrity for this project is why I am reaching out to you today. I would appreciate any donation you can offer no matter how small, to help me achieve this dream.Also, if you could please pass this on through social media or through email to family and friends who might be interested in donating. It would mean the world to me!Thank youHappi daysYinkaFor more information about who I am ---  www.honoryourmagnificence.com

story:
About my Career Training

Hi! My name is Bai Jehan Jainal I'm a graduate of Bachelor of Science major in Tourism at the University of Mindanao in Philippines. I was recently offered an amazing career training at Madison Beach Hotel, Connecticut USA. My career training will last for 1 year. Last year December 2015 I was interviewed by them and luckily passed! my family was very happy to hear about the news that I pass the interview and then my older sister who is currently working abroad as a nurse in Saudi Arabia promised me that she will provide all the expenses on my training program, visa fee, plane ticket, 2 months rent etc., but unfortunately, the economy in Saudi Arabia went down and now on crisis, her loan was rejected which is my only chance and last resort to fulfill my dream and career, sad to say it's all canceled. Everything are almost in the palm of my hand, the agency already sent me the career plan everything is already set up, all I'm gonna do is to process my Visa and ready to go, some of my friends donated a small amount of money but still not enough for me to continue on my journey. That's why I'm here reaching out for help, I was hoping if some of you who can help me pursue my dream and continue on my journey, because for me there is still hope, even if there's only 1% chance for me to succeed I will still accept it. You guys are my only hope to fulfill my dream to work in Connecticut.

How can you help me on my Career Training

Unfortunately, this career training with Madison beach hotel in Connecticut  is unpaid, So It will cost me approximately $6,205. I've been working hard for this for a few months but not enough to reach for that amount so some of my friends and family donated a small amount.Through this I have been able to cover the half of the expenses but still not enough to continue my journey, and that is where you come in. I’m asking for the support of anyone else who inspired by my story to help me raise funds to cover the other half. With your support I’m aiming to raise enough money to cover my flight costs this is required to be open ticket to ensure I have to go back in the Philippines after my 1 year contract, visa fees, my first 1 month of rent and expenses while I'm in Manila in order to make this dream into a reality!

  • $160 will help me cover my Visa costs
  • $2200 will help me cover my flight costs.This is the payment of the airfare round trip Manila-US-Manila (Open ticket)
  • $220 will help me cover my 1 month of rent
  • $220 will help me cover my pocket money and expenses in Manila

Connect me with your people; share my story with your friends, family, co-workers, anyone and everyone...after all, I am a big believer in the power of communities! Or do you know someone in Connecticut, maybe someone who can help me with accommodation, give me advice on Connecticut life or, just simply wish me luck!

You can also contact me on my Skype or Viber

Skype ID : jehan0628

Viber : +63 9503 658 029

Thank you very much! All is well!

Much love, as always

Jehan

story:
Hello! 

Welcome to our crowd-funding page for Goblin, an innovative children’s theatre company.

We’ve got some very exciting plans and we and we need your help to make them happen!

Who are we?
Goblin is a children’s theatre company. Founded in 2013, Goblin have delighted thousands and thousands of audience members with high-quality children’s theatre featuring music, fun and lots of creativity. With shows such as The Ballad of Rudy, Mr Tiger Goes Wild and Penguin! Elephant! we’ve performed at some of the best venues in the UK, including The Royal Exchange, Manchester and The Southbank Centre, London as well as the Edinburgh Fringe. This year we are touring Penguin! Elephant! around the UK, and creating a very special new show with Little Angel Theatre; Emily Rising by Dan Rebellato. 

What’s the Aim?
We want to bring high-quality theatre for children into schools. GOBLIN IN SCHOOLS will be a new project which aims to create new and regular work that can go into primary schools up and down the country.

Why is it important?
Theatre companies touring to primary schools are often the first and only time children experience live performance. We’ve heard from many teachers that they’d love more high-quality offers to be available to schools. We make innovative and diverse work for children and we’d love to bring this to as many people as possible. We want to make shows that enlighten learning and the curriculum and that creatively stimulate passion in a subject. 

How are we going to do this?
We’re looking to start schools performances the Summer term of 2017, but it takes a lot of planning. Following some detailed research with teachers, we plan to create a new website and teacher resources, and with some chosen partners start creating some shows which will be ready to go into schools. The money raised will also pay for a part-time schools manager.  

And remember
Please help spread the word about this campaign especially on Facebook and Twitter and share this page with your friends/followers. 
You can follow Goblin on twitter @goblintheatre or Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/goblintheatre/
www.goblintheatre.co.uk
THANKS!

story:
Kanaan is a Palestinian cultural project works to create a digital record for  Palestinian archaeological sites and document it in order to publicize it and its history, and to enable anyone in the world to view  it and  virtual walk around in it.

 Its main objective: Digital documentation of Palestinian cultural and natural heritage using website & Mobile application (Android) by Arabic and English languages.

Kanaan objectives :

  • Digital preservation of heritage by using new technologies.
  • Definition of the Palestinian cultural heritage sites
  • Increase attention to archaeological sites and historical buildings.
  • Activate the internal and external cultural tourism.
  • Promote the culture of religious tolerance and integration of cultures, peoples and nations.
  • Increase attention to the protection of the Palestinian archaeological and historical sites.

Kanaan achievements :

  • Kanaan’s website & mobile application will provide full information about archaeological sites. The information contains overview, Images and video gallery.
  • Also, Kanaan provide interactive maps that simulate archaeological sites’ maps. The Interactive maps are easy to use and make sense of main sub locations of the archaeological sites.
  • Kanaan mobile application easily provide the nearby archaeological sites from the user by  using the GPS, and showing indoor paths and routes at  the archaeological site map to help tourists  and visitors reach the site and navigate inside it.
  • Finally, Kanaan  provides panoramic tours of archaeological sites. Panoramic tours show the nature of the archaeological sites and attention to detail, which highlights the most important sections of the sites, e.g. murals, floors, statues and places of worship.

Pilot Site :

  • At this phase of Kanaan, it takes The Monastery of St. Hilarion as a pilot site because it’s one of the most important cultural heritage sites in Palestine dating back to the Byzantine period, it still needs a lot of attention to the definition of community awareness historical and cultural importance.
  • Kanaan was applied all previously mentioned applications to the pilot site (full information about the monastery, interactive map, panoramic tour, Images and video gallery,,,,,, )
  • And also Kanaan produced a short documentary Film, which is talking about The Monastery of St. Hilarion and its main components. YouTube link:www.youtube.com/watch?v=PFrCPqHWwrA

Main Guidance

Website:

The design and updates of the website includes (but not limited to):

  • Heritage Places Slider.
  • Palestine Interactive Google Map.
  • New Heritage place Data (Overview, Interactive Map, HTML5 360 Panorama, Image Gallery, Video Gallery )
  • Heritage place departments details (Overview, Image Gallery, Video Gallery )
  • Virtual tour in 3D Model of historical place.
  • Social Network action (like, share, etc…)

And we may suggest other features during the meetings.

Mobile Application:

The design and updates of the Mobile Application includes (but not limited to):

  • MAP Support GPS (Show the path between user location and heritage place).
  • New Heritage place Data (Overview, Interactive Map, HTML5 Panorama, Image Gallery, Video Gallery )
  • Heritage place departments details (Overview, Image Gallery, Video Gallery )
  • Building map to show rooms and navigate user to rooms.
  • Path navigator.
  • Support Audio tours.
  • Social Network action (like, share, etc…)

And we may suggest other features during the meetings.

Design & Front-End:

  • Arabic / English Website Design.
  • Mobile / Tablet Application Design.
  • Attractive Design.

Time plans

We may conduct the following time plan while developing for each Heritage Place:

Financial Offer

The development of Kanaan Website & Mobile application (Design & Programming) for each historical place (Temple), we are pleased to provide our financial and technical offer:

Other Ways You Can Help:

Monetary contributions aren't the only way you can provide support! Share our project campaign with others! Your excitement is contagious!

  • Help to develop our idea.
  • Send us your advice from your own experience.
  • Donate anything you no longer need but it will help us to continue. (Camera, Laptop, Lazer scanner, ……)
  • We appreciate everyone's efforts at helping us. You can support by sharing our project camping among friends, colleagues and everyone who is interested to be one of Kanaan family and love charity.
  • Remind to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please help us make some noise about our campaign by sharing our story on your Facebook page or Twitter feed, or by sharing it with people that you know can help through Email, in order to reach the largest possible number of financiers, you are doing us a wonderful service. We appreciate that kind of support as well! Thank you! 

Each contribution will help. However, while we know some people just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean they can’t help.

                                                               We want to hear from you!

Last but not least .. Many Thanks to everyone who support us during our first pilot phase especially “Riwaq center for architectural conservation and  Iwan center for architectural heritage at the Islamic university of Gaza ( IUG) and a lot thanks to Madar company for their great efforts.
 

Contact us

Don't hesitate to reach out to us with any questions, comments, advice, or suggestions about our campaign. We are always happy to give us any suggestions or comments :) 

You can contact us at:

kanaan.ps@gmail.com

nesma.naseem@gmail.com

Follow us at Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100004982957719

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Kanaanps-959425650820093/

Send us a tweet : https://twitter.com/kanaan_ps

Subscribe us at youtube : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC86851iE28tKp7ppKKS2bpw

Please, If you are interested at this sector, and you think we can participate in Kanaan project, don´t hesitate to write me. For us, it would be a pleasure to take part in Kanaan family.

Looking forward hearing from you soon!

Yours Sincerely,,,,

story:
Why We Need Percy Station?

Somerset Street West is an undervalued urban space in the city of Ottawa. The area lacks a hub for cultural activity and exploration more than ever after the recent closure of Raw Sugar and the destruction of the Daily Grind, Middle East Bakery, Shiraz Market and A Dark Cloud Tattoo Parlour from a tragic fire last fall. The removal of these cultural institutions creates gaps in our urban fabric leading to a lack of participation in our local community. 

What is Percy Station?

Percy Station, a modular structure that thrives on rotating programming and functions as a shared community space. Through the City of Ottawa’s Streetside Spot program Percy Station will transform an area of street parking on Somerset Street near its intersection with Percy Street. Currently we have support from both the City of Ottawa and The Somerset Street Chinatown BIA.

Where Will Percy Station Be?

Percy station will be located on Somerset Street in front of the vacant lot where The Daily Grind, Middle East Bakery, Shiraz Market and A Dark Cloud Tattoo Parlour were housed before a fire destroyed their businesses in the fall of 2015.

An Opportunity to Contributing to Your Community

Percy Station creates a destination for pedestrians and cyclists in an area that has been stripped of culturally relevant businesses by a recent disaster. Reactivating this space will benefit businesses with increased foot traffic and contribute to the Somerset Street Chinatown BIA’s streetscape improvement and beautification initiatives. Programming the space will bring local artistic talent to Chinatown and discussions on urban development will excite people to explore the surrounding community.  

Improving Our Urban Landscape

Another major focus of Percy Station is to empower Ottawans through discussion and education about the processes behind urban development. Percy Station’s proximity to an undeveloped site creates a personal connection to these issues for visitors, adding incentive for self-organized conversations on improving our urban landscape. The Percy Station website will also provide space for discussion on the development of the adjacent plot, making this conversation accessible to everyone.

Funding Goal: $14,090

story:
Who we are

We are The Attic and this is our story. 
 
We are a group of passionate people from Bucharest and beyond that investigate different cultures from all over the world. We created an online platform that functions as a magazine, with the aim of publishing insightful interviews with artists and bands, as well as various features, articles, video and audio podcasts. The music approach has no typical boundaries of gender, style, time or space, but admits its importance and relevance. We question everything and try to pursuit the essence of what we believe is good, timeless and continues to resonate regardless of its release date. We organise cultural events in different venues in Bucharest, from Outernational concerts to avant-garde electronic music live performances.
 

What is Outernational Days festival

We created Outernational Days as a festival that wants to fight prejudices, vices and fears, a festival where everyone is welcome, regardless of age, cultural background, social position, gender or ethnicity.
 

photo - Andrei M

We defined Outernational as a place positioned outside of history; as a shapeless world that has been developing at the periphery of the International sphere. What makes Outernational music so distinct is its lack of exposure in mainstream and non-mainstream media, for reasons that are usually linked to ethnical biases. Outernational music comprises many contemporary hybrids from all over the world: from Kurdish halay to Romanian manele, from Bulgarian orkestras of chalga to Peruvian chicha, from Palestinian dabke to Mexican narcocorrido, Egyptian electro-chabi  and many other genres and styles.
 

What the media said

''Bucharest's inaugural Outernational Days festival which is putting Romanian folk music centre stage while fighting for space in the city's tragically diminished live scene''. Review of Outernational Days 2016 in The Quietus. 
 
''Bucharest will host Outernational Days festival this weekend. Run by The Atticeditorial team, this will be the festival's inaugural edition. “The project was born out of a cultural need [to explore] a very wide musical spectrum, to which the Romanian audience lacked access until now,” the organisers explain in their mission statement.'' The Wire magazine. 
 

''Outernational Days brings Rabih Beaini, Andy Votel to Romania in 2016. The new three-day event explores the music of peripheral cultures.'' Resident Advisor. 

 

''The sheer existence of this sort of event, especially in a context like Bucharest, is a pretty huge, almost miraculous deal. The task of putting together three full days of concerts, complete with debates, workshops and club nights, sounds like an overly ambitious task and possible financial suicide, especially without corporate sponsors.'' Revista Arta.

 

''A few months later I arranged a personal meeting with Dragos Rusu, the Editor in Chief of The Attic during CTM Festival in Berlin (January 2016). These blind date with email buddies can be a risky business as you can imagine. There is no guarantees that the words come easy. But not so with Dragos and his gang. These young bucks zipped through CTM Festival with an never-ending and wide-eyed curiosity – we almost had to tie them down in order not to lose them! Whether it was an hours-long artist talk on the schedule, or wildly improvised music set or the full-strength after-party, the editorial staff of The Attic have clearly dispensed with the need for sleep. Even in the most euphoric states of existence their interviews are jam-packed with interesting thoughts and insightful wisdom on the music taking place around us. And also fermenting in their minds was the idea of their own Attic Festival… in the tradition of CTM, but with the sounds of The Attic. Now, just five months later, Outernational Days Bucharest  is a reality and about to happen from 1. till 3. Juli in Bucharest. (I told you they don’t do sleep.)''. Dreaming In The Discotheque - Kaput Magazine.  

 

 
What We Need & What You Get
We need your help in order to continue our mission of transforming the global into local, and viceversa. Your contributions will help us make Outernational Days a self-sustainable and independent festival, which would become financially accessible to everybody, with no discrimination of any sort.
 

We really appreciate any amount you contribute. And to show our appreciation we have some cool perks to say thank you!

 

Our perks include:

  • tickets to our events from the Outernational Night series; 
  • tickets to Outernational Days 2 festival, June 30 - July 2, 2017; 
  • Outernational specially designed T-shirts and bags;
  • very limited tape/CD with one concert from the 2016 edition of the festival, on demand;
  • posters, stickers and collectables from our past & future events; 
  • vouchers of different values, to be used at Outernational Days 2 festival;
  • Bucharest city-tour conducted by members of our team; 
  • studio session with professional Romanian producers/musicians;
  • the possibility to visit and meet Romanian musicians of oral tradition, in their own environment;
  • dinner with a Romanian artist at the infamous restaurant Hanul Drumețului in Bucharest;
  • private percussion and didgeridoo lessons in Bucharest with professional musicians.
 

In order to continue our mission, we created an international crowdfunding campaign to support Outernational, with a total goal of 25.000 USD. We will use your contributions to pay the artists and bands booked for Outernational. This includes artist fees, travel and accommodation costs. 
 
The total budget of a festival with a magnitude such as Outernational Days is much bigger than our proposed goal and includes many other costs besides the artistic part (such as the rent of the Uranus garden and the necessary improvements of the space, sound-system, stage, lights, security, promotion of the event through outdoor print and social media).
 

Awareness

We want to raise awareness of the Outernational concept, so we've come up with 5 punctual Outernational Night events that will happen in Bucharest before the second edition of our festival. Every event will comprise premiere concerts with bands from all over the world, local ensembles, as well as panel discussions, lectures and movie screenings.
 
  • October 1, 2016, Outernational Night #1: The Dwarfs of East Agouza (Cairo) 
  • Facebook event

The Dwarfs of East Agouza is a trio from Cairo, Egypt, featuring Maurice Louca (Alif, Bikya), Sam Shalabi (Land of Kush, Shalabi Effect) and Alan Bishop (Sun City Girls, The Invisible Hands, Alvarius B.). Born during 2012 when the three were living in the same apartment building in Cairo’s Agouza district, the trio’s instrumental improvisation-based explorations are propelled by Louca’s North African percussion loops and shimmering keys, Shalabi’s West African tinged free jazz guitar and grounded by Bishop’s driving Krautrock-style acoustic bass.

 
  • October 28, 2016,  Outernational Night #2: Jerusalem in my Heart (LB/CA) // Impex (RO)
  • Facebook event
Jerusalem In My Heart (JIMH) is a live audio-visual happening since 2005, with Montréal-based producer and musician Radwan Ghazi Moumneh at its core. Moumneh is a Lebanese national who has spent a large part of his adult life in Canada and has been a fixture of the Montréal independent music community from his early days as guitarist in various notable 90s bands to his tireless activity as a sound engineer and producer over the last decade. Moumneh is also active in the Beirut and Lebanese experimental music scenes, where he spends a few months every year. 
Impex imports and exports rhythms and sounds from the universe to the world and vice versa. Sound wise, the band goes through a large array of styles, from house, rock, manele, jazz, Romanian emo, IDM, electro and folk music to contemporary classical music. The band is composed by the three founding member (Horatiu Serbanescu, Andrei Dinescu, Eugen Imecs) plus frequencies maestro and guitarist Janin Pasniciuc. They are the creators of Steaua de Mare, Zebre, Aneb/Plevna or Shamaneslim projects, sharing their tunes into the diverse mix of IMEX! During a live show, many surprise guests take the spotlight, their ages varying from 15 to 70 years old.
 
  • December, 2016, Outernational Night #3: Baba Commandant & The Mandingo Band (BF)   
  • Facebook event

 

Baba Commandant & The Mandingo Band are a contemporary group from Burkina Faso. Coming from Bobo-Dioulasso, the group is steeped in the Mandingue musical traditions of their ancestral legacy. The enigmatic lead singer Baba Commandant (on his real name Mamadou Sanou) is an original and eccentric character who is well respected in the Burkinabé musical community. 

 
  • Spring 2017, Outernational Night #4: Ogoya Nengo & The Dodo Women's Group (Kenya) 
Ogoya Nengo, born Anastasia Oluoch in 1943, in a small village called Magoya, near the Kenyan shores of Lake Victoria. Hailing from a family of singers and orators, she soon joined their trade and practice as social messengers and commentators, commonly referred to by the locals as Dodo singers. Already in her early teens Anastasia had achieved much acclaim in her society and received the name "Ogoya Nengo" which means "The Priced One" at the early age of 13. Ogoya became the rave of the time, criss-crossing the region with their music, singing to great chiefs, warriors and colonial officers who became enraptured by her talent. Ogoya Nengo's approach to Dodo, a genre which is in danger of vanishing, is a very personal one: Her timeless and mystical music is characterized by her powerful voice.
 
  • Spring 2017, Outernational Night #5: The Master Musicians of Jajouka (Morocco)

"A 4.000 year-old rock'n'roll band.” William S. Burroughs

The Master Musicians of Jajouka became a counter-cultural icon when Brian Jones of The Rolling Stones confessed that even he had trouble standing up to “the constant strain of the festival” during the performances he recorded in their tiny village in the foothills of Morocco’s Rif Mountains. Their reputation was cemented when Rolling Stones Records released “Brian Jones presents the Pipes of Pan at Joujouka” in 1971, and that reputation continues until today.

 

Outernational Days 2 

June 30 - July 2, 2017

For the second edition of Outernational Days we want to bring to Bucharest musicians from Morocco, Greece, Mali, Asia, Kenya, amongst other areas. We want to increase the number of female musicians playing on stage and develop new ensembles of local musicians. Besides music, we want to screen film documentaries and organise more discursive events (lectures, panels, a/v installations). 

foto - Alex Negulescu

We want to create a unique space from the Uranus garden, the venue of our festival. We want to engage local visual artists who would contribute in offering to the audience a nocturne dimension of the festival. This garden hides one of the last standing water castles in Bucharest, engineered by Anghel Saligny and built sometime around the 1800s. The landmark survived massive demolition during the Communist period and multiple fires. Uranus manages to capture the true essence of Outernational and urban space in Bucharest, tempting through a combo of distinct elements and a relaxed, cool atmosphere created in the heart of chaos and unrest. It is a sheer oasis, around which everything gravitates with speed.

foto - Alex Negulescu

 

We want to enhance the involvement of the local communities in our festival, get more volunteers, organise more music workshops, screen more documentary films and encourage new local music ensembles/projects to play on stage. 

foto - Alex Negulescu

 

Here are just a few of the music projects that we propose and would like to present at Outernational Days 2:

 

  • The Sun Ra Arkestra

Sun Ra was one of the greatest and least known jazz artists of the last four decades, whose influence on diverse musicians is little known to the general public. A pianist and band leader, his style ranged from retro swing to avant free, and often in the same piece. His band could play a swinging Gershwin tune and almost imperceptibly soar into their free cosmic equational tones as if they possessed a single mind. 

The Arkestra still performs today, under the able direction of alto saxophonist Marshall Allen. Sun Ra said and wrote many strange things while he was upon this planet. The easy, mindless reaction is to just label him "weird" and hide behind that facile label. Another possibility is that he was passionately engaged in and by his creative mythology, and that what he really meant could only be articulated in his music.

 

  • Karkhana 

BEIRUT-CAIRO-ISTANBUL: Combining some of the most innovative players from Beirut, Cairo and Istanbul, Karkhana met in Beirut for the first time in February 2014. They recorded both live and in studio for Italian vinyl label Sagittarius A-Star. They recently meet in Beirut again, albeit with a variation on their last line up, to share their blend of free jazz and psychedelic with various shades and traces of shaabi, tarab, sufi and much more.

 

  • Hailu Mergia with Tony Buck & Mike Majkowski

Hailu Mergia was a star in the 1970s: As keyboarder of the legendary Walias Band he jammed in the hotels of Addis Ababa with such legends as Duke Ellington and Manu Dibango. Mergia took advantage of a US tour to flee the Mengistu regime in Ethiopia and has since been living as a taxi driver in Washington, D.C. The Awesome Tapes from Africa label is to thank for the revival of Mergia’s unique music, with reissues of the album “Hailu Mergia & His Classical Instrument” ( 1985 ) and the dizzying-sum-fetching record “Tche Belew” ( 1977 ) which created a furore. Mergia is now back on the road, with exceptional Australian musicians Tony Buck ( The Necks ) on drums and Mike Majkowski on double bass. Mergia’s music is hypnotic, futuristic and nostalgic in equal measure: The trio’s intense concerts are true one-of-a-kind experiences.

 

  • Meridian Brothers (Colombia)

Meridian Brothers is tropical / psychedelic group from Colombia. Born in Bogotá in 1998 and based on the musical interests of composer Eblis Alvarez, in the beginning, the project was focused exclusively on cassette recordings and experimentation with alternative ways of playing instruments and electronic media.

 

  • Mark Ernestus' Ndagga Rhythm Force (Dakar / Berlin)

This is not sanitized music for the feelgood market. This is the real deal, stripped down to its essentials - stringent repetitiveness meets rhythmic complexity. Singer/MC Mbene Diatta Seck, talking drum master Modou Mbaye and dancer Fatou Wore Mboup with their stunning stage presence and energy are joined by legendary veteran characters like sabar drummer Bada Seck and guitar player Assane "Ndoye" Cisse - who have both played with Baaba Maal for some 30 years - and some young hotshots from the Dakar scene.

 

  • Les Filles de Illighadad - Fatou Seidi Ghali & Alamnou Akrouni (Niger)

Fatou Seidi Ghali and Alamnou Akrouni reside in the tiny village of Illighadad, Niger. Fatou plays the tende, and an old blue guitar, slightly bent because of the extreme weather. She is one of only two Tuareg female guitarists. Together with her cousin, vocalist Alamnou Akrouni, they strip Tuareg music from all progressive leanings, right back to its bare essence. Various Western African artists have expanded the Tuareg-blues movement on a global scale, but rarely have these soul-purging sounds resonated so candidly and emotively.

 

  • James Holden with live band

British musician James Holden is a man of many talents: zeitgeist-defining label boss of Border Community, trend-setting producer, hugely in-demand monster remixer, and a talented DJ. He developed a new project with the intent on keeping live collaborative performance at the centre of his music-making for the foreseeable future.

 

  • iNSANLAR (Turkey)

iNSANLAR consists of Turkish musicians Cem Yıldız on vocal, bağlama and electronics, Barış K on electronics and Hogır on percussions and vocal percussions. The trio delve deep into their Anatolian ancestry with this piece, they go as far back as the 16th & 17th Centuries.

 

  • Bombino (Tuareg/Niger)

Omara "Bombino" Moctar is an internationally acclaimed Tuareg guitarist and singer-songwriter from Agadez, Niger. His music frequently addresses Tuareg geopolitical concerns and is sung in the Tuareg language of Tamasheq.  With the widely-acclaimed international release of Agadez, Bombino has established himself as a definitive and timeless African guitarist.

 

  • Okay Temiz presents Oriental Wind Ensemble (Turkey)

Okay Temiz is a leading Turkish fusion jazz percussionist and drummer. Okay Temiz's Oriental Wind years established him as an ethnic jazz musician. He works with traditional tunes, but does not just play them in a different setting with different instruments. He takes it further into improvisation. Meanwhile, other non-Turkish musicians in the group are not trying to play Turkish music either. They have ideas of their own.

 

  • Shamanelism (Romania)

Shamanelism is an unconventional band whose members are convicts from prison for juvenile from Rahova (Bucharest) and Craiova. The band was formed several years ago and it was conducted by Romanian musicians Andrei Dinescu, Horațiu Șerbănescu and Ion Dumitrescu. The main aim of the project was to help reconsider the relationship between the society and the penitentiary system, beyond and kind of prejudice, helping the inmates to reintegrate in the community after detention.

 

We will continue working with our friends from the Future Nuggets and Paradaiz collectives on developing new projects commissioned for the festival. 

In time, we want to develop spirited projects commissioned for Outernational, together with artists and ensembles who performed in our past Outernational events: Rabih Beaini, Vincent Moon, Idris Ackamoor, Senyawa, Paradise Bangkok, Praed, Alan Bishop, Maurice Louca, Khidja, Booty Carrell, DJ soFa. 

 

Please help us grow this festival to an amazing community event!

 

Our goal is flexible, so even if we don't reach the entire of it, any of the funds we will get from your donations will be used to continue our series of Outernational events and develop the second edition of Outernational Days. 

The Impact

Your donations will have a massive impact on the festival. Not only are you helping fund the artistic part of the festival for 2017, but you are helping support live music for this year and years to come. Your donations help us keep the ticket prices affordable, so that everybody can enjoy live music and have a multicultural experience at affordable costs.  

Outernational is a much wider and unexplored terrain, with a huge potential to expand. We are aware of the condition of music in influencing social perceptions and ultimately try to better understand the world around us.

The first edition of Outernational Days festival gathered a total of 3,000 participants during the three days of the festival, for both the locations: Uranus Garden (no. 144 Uranus St.) and Control Club (no. 4 Constantin Mille St.). The audience was very diverse, from teenagers to adults, from young students to parents who came with their children. 

Your contributions will help Outernational Days become an annual summer festival, where everybody is welcome!
 

Risks & Challenges

What if we don’t reach our goal? We will still use any money raised to help continue our mission: the series of Outernational Night events and the festival Outernational Days 2, but we risk not being able to bring all the projects in 2017.

  • We may need to reduce the number of days of festival to 2 days.
  • We may need to reduce the number of the bands participating.
  • We may need to increase the cost of tickets.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    In case you may not be able to donate at this time, don't worry. There are other ways you can help. 

    • Please share this campaign with your friends, family, acquaintances and any music lover you know. Please use the Indiegogo share tools. You can also:
    • Share the event website: http://the-attic.net/outernational
    • Attend any of our future events from the Outernational Night series. 
    • Volunteer for a few hours at Outernational Days 2.

    Thank you for your support! Please let us know your thoughts and ideas on how to grow together this festival - your feedback is highly important!

     

    We love you all!
story_txt:
Who we are
We are The Attic and this is our story. 
 

We are a group of passionate people from Bucharest and beyond that investigate different cultures from all over the world. We created an online platform that functions as a magazine, with the aim of publishing insightful interviews with artists and bands, as well as various features, articles, video and audio podcasts. The music approach has no typical boundaries of gender, style, time or space, but admits its importance and relevance. We question everything and try to pursuit the essence of what we believe is good, timeless and continues to resonate regardless of its release date. We organise cultural events in different venues in Bucharest, from Outernational concerts to avant-garde electronic music live performances.

 

What is Outernational Days festival
We created Outernational Days as a festival that wants to fight prejudices, vices and fears, a festival where everyone is welcome, regardless of age, cultural background, social position, gender or ethnicity.
 



photo - Andrei M


We defined Outernational as a place positioned outside of history; as a shapeless world that has been developing at the periphery of the International sphere. What makes Outernational music so distinct is its lack of exposure in mainstream and non-mainstream media, for reasons that are usually linked to ethnical biases. Outernational music comprises many contemporary hybrids from all over the world: from Kurdish halay to Romanian manele, from Bulgarian orkestras of chalga to Peruvian chicha, from Palestinian dabke to Mexican narcocorrido, Egyptian electro-chabi  and many other genres and styles.

 
What the media said
''Bucharest's inaugural Outernational Days festival which is putting Romanian folk music centre stage while fighting for space in the city's tragically diminished live scene''. Review of Outernational Days 2016 in The Quietus. 
 
''Bucharest will host Outernational Days festival this weekend. Run by The Atticeditorial team, this will be the festival's inaugural edition. “The project was born out of a cultural need [to explore] a very wide musical spectrum, to which the Romanian audience lacked access until now,” the organisers explain in their mission statement.'' The Wire magazine. 
 

''Outernational Days brings Rabih Beaini, Andy Votel to Romania in 2016. The new three-day event explores the music of peripheral cultures.'' Resident Advisor. 
 
''The sheer existence of this sort of event, especially in a context like Bucharest, is a pretty huge, almost miraculous deal. The task of putting together three full days of concerts, complete with debates, workshops and club nights, sounds like an overly ambitious task and possible financial suicide, especially without corporate sponsors.'' Revista Arta.
 
''A few months later I arranged a personal meeting with Dragos Rusu, the Editor in Chief of The Attic during CTM Festival in Berlin (January 2016). These blind date with email buddies can be a risky business as you can imagine. There is no guarantees that the words come easy. But not so with Dragos and his gang. These young bucks zipped through CTM Festival with an never-ending and wide-eyed curiosity – we almost had to tie them down in order not to lose them! Whether it was an hours-long artist talk on the schedule, or wildly improvised music set or the full-strength after-party, the editorial staff of The Attic have clearly dispensed with the need for sleep. Even in the most euphoric states of existence their interviews are jam-packed with interesting thoughts and insightful wisdom on the music taking place around us. And also fermenting in their minds was the idea of their own Attic Festival… in the tradition of CTM, but with the sounds of The Attic. Now, just five months later, Outernational Days Bucharest  is a reality and about to happen from 1. till 3. Juli in Bucharest. (I told you they don’t do sleep.)''. Dreaming In The Discotheque - Kaput Magazine.  
 

 
What We Need & What You Get
We need your help in order to continue our mission of transforming the global into local, and viceversa. Your contributions will help us make Outernational Days a self-sustainable and independent festival, which would become financially accessible to everybody, with no discrimination of any sort. 
We really appreciate any amount you contribute. And to show our appreciation we have some cool perks to say thank you!

 
Our perks include:

tickets to our events from the Outernational Night series; 


tickets to Outernational Days 2 festival, June 30 - July 2, 2017; 

Outernational specially designed T-shirts and bags;
very limited tape/CD with one concert from the 2016 edition of the festival, on demand;
posters, stickers and collectables from our past & future events; 
vouchers of different values, to be used at Outernational Days 2 festival;
Bucharest city-tour conducted by members of our team; 
studio session with professional Romanian producers/musicians;
the possibility to visit and meet Romanian musicians of oral tradition, in their own environment;
dinner with a Romanian artist at the infamous restaurant Hanul Drumețului in Bucharest;
private percussion and didgeridoo lessons in Bucharest with professional musicians.

 
In order to continue our mission, we created an international crowdfunding campaign to support Outernational, with a total goal of 25.000 USD. We will use your contributions to pay the artists and bands booked for Outernational. This includes artist fees, travel and accommodation costs. 
 The total budget of a festival with a magnitude such as Outernational Days is much bigger than our proposed goal and includes many other costs besides the artistic part (such as the rent of the Uranus garden and the necessary improvements of the space, sound-system, stage, lights, security, promotion of the event through outdoor print and social media). Awareness
We want to raise awareness of the Outernational concept, so we've come up with 5 punctual Outernational Night events that will happen in Bucharest before the second edition of our festival. Every event will comprise premiere concerts with bands from all over the world, local ensembles, as well as panel discussions, lectures and movie screenings.

Facebook event

Ogoya Nengo's approach to Dodo, a genre which is in danger of vanishing, is a very personal one: Her timeless and mystical music is characterized by her powerful voice.

Fatou Seidi Ghali and Alamnou Akrouni reside in the tiny village of Illighadad, Niger. Fatou plays the tende, and an old blue guitar, slightly bent because of the extreme weather. She is one of only two Tuareg female guitarists. Together with her cousin, vocalist Alamnou Akrouni, they strip Tuareg music from all progressive leanings, right back to its bare essence. Various Western African artists have expanded the Tuareg-blues movement on a global scale, but rarely have these soul-purging sounds resonated so candidly and emotively.
 
James Holden with live band
British musician James Holden is a man of many talents: zeitgeist-defining label boss of Border Community, trend-setting producer, hugely in-demand monster remixer, and a talented DJ. He developed a new project with the intent on keeping live collaborative performance at the centre of his music-making for the foreseeable future.
 
iNSANLAR (Turkey)
iNSANLAR consists of Turkish musicians Cem Yıldız on vocal, bağlama and electronics, Barış K on electronics and Hogır on percussions and vocal percussions. The trio delve deep into their Anatolian ancestry with this piece, they go as far back as the 16th & 17th Centuries.
 
Bombino (Tuareg/Niger)
Omara "Bombino" Moctar is an internationally acclaimed Tuareg guitarist and singer-songwriter from Agadez, Niger. His music frequently addresses Tuareg geopolitical concerns and is sung in the Tuareg language of Tamasheq.  With the widely-acclaimed international release of Agadez, Bombino has established himself as a definitive and timeless African guitarist.
 
Okay Temiz presents Oriental Wind Ensemble (Turkey)
Okay Temiz is a leading Turkish fusion jazz percussionist and drummer. Okay Temiz's Oriental Wind years established him as an ethnic jazz musician. He works with traditional tunes, but does not just play them in a different setting with different instruments. He takes it further into improvisation. Meanwhile, other non-Turkish musicians in the group are not trying to play Turkish music either. They have ideas of their own.
 
Shamanelism (Romania)
Shamanelism is an unconventional band whose members are convicts from prison for juvenile from Rahova (Bucharest) and Craiova. The band was formed several years ago and it was conducted by Romanian musicians Andrei Dinescu, Horațiu Șerbănescu and Ion Dumitrescu. The main aim of the project was to help reconsider the relationship between the society and the penitentiary system, beyond and kind of prejudice, helping the inmates to reintegrate in the community after detention.
 
We will continue working with our friends from the Future Nuggets and Paradaiz collectives on developing new projects commissioned for the festival. 
In time, we want to develop spirited projects commissioned for Outernational, together with artists and ensembles who performed in our past Outernational events: Rabih Beaini, Vincent Moon, Idris Ackamoor, Senyawa, Paradise Bangkok, Praed, Alan Bishop, Maurice Louca, Khidja, Booty Carrell, DJ soFa. 
 
Please help us grow this festival to an amazing community event!
 
Our goal is flexible, so even if we don't reach the entire of it, any of the funds we will get from your donations will be used to continue our series of Outernational events and develop the second edition of Outernational Days. 


The Impact

Your donations will have a massive impact on the festival. Not only are you helping fund the artistic part of the festival for 2017, but you are helping support live music for this year and years to come. Your donations help us keep the ticket prices affordable, so that everybody can enjoy live music and have a multicultural experience at affordable costs.  
Outernational is a much wider and unexplored terrain, with a huge potential to expand. We are aware of the condition of music in influencing social perceptions and ultimately try to better understand the world around us.

The first edition of Outernational Days festival gathered a total of 3,000 participants during the three days of the festival, for both the locations: Uranus Garden (no. 144 Uranus St.) and Control Club (no. 4 Constantin Mille St.). The audience was very diverse, from teenagers to adults, from young students to parents who came with their children. 
Your contributions will help Outernational Days become an annual summer festival, where everybody is welcome!
 
Risks & Challenges

What if we don’t reach our goal? We will still use any money raised to help continue our mission: the series of Outernational Night events and the festival Outernational Days 2, but we risk not being able to bring all the projects in 2017.

We may need to reduce the number of days of festival to 2 days.
We may need to reduce the number of the bands participating.
We may need to increase the cost of tickets.



 
Other Ways You Can Help

In case you may not be able to donate at this time, don't worry. There are other ways you can help. 

Please share this campaign with your friends, family, acquaintances and any music lover you know. Please use the Indiegogo share tools. You can also:
Share the event website: http://the-attic.net/outernational

Attend any of our future events from the Outernational Night series. 
Volunteer for a few hours at Outernational Days 2.


Thank you for your support! Please let us know your thoughts and ideas on how to grow together this festival - your feedback is highly important!
 
We love you all!

story:
WE ARE THRILLED WITH ALL THE MEGAPHONING AROUND THIS MOVEMENT. TO KEEP UP WITH THIS MOMENTUM, JOIN US OVER AT EntrepreneurTheGirl.com

 
 

This campaign is an invitation for you to join a team of talented women in bringing this book to the bedrooms and libraries of girls (and boys) everywhere. Your support for this book will back us in covering our costs for developing high quality illustrations, art direction, printing, writing, editing and outreach.  We are committed to creating a book we hope will become one of those beloved masterpieces that girls can proudly share with their daughters and granddaughters, friends and students as an empowering tale of fun and discovery.  

Like you, we believe in paying women and mothers the value of their hard work, and know that every contribution will create excitement towards making this book the best quality possible.    

Your contribution also propels our efforts to develop exciting multi-modal learning tools, including carefully developed home and classroom curriculum, a girl’s conference, public talks with inspiring women, mindfulness resources, and more.

 

 

Who we are.

Working with a team of talented women Artists, including illustrators, art directors, typographers, graphic designers, videographers, web developers, and teachers all over the world, we are Camalo Gaskin & Aubrey Gail Ferreira and spent the last year building a learning platform for Entrepreneur The Girl, which began with writing the first book called  Entrepreneur Finds Her Way.

 

 

Why this means so much to us (and think it will mean a lot to you too).

A few years ago, when this project first began, my daughter came home crying and full of anxiety. After a series of field trips to visit the workplaces of some of her classmates' parents, she confessed that she had no interest in any of the jobs she had seen.  She feared none of those jobs would make her happy. She worried that she had no idea how she would earn money in the future. And she resigned to never wanting to leave home.

That night I looked around for children's books that might address her worries, but I found none. Instead I began "story channelling," telling her a narrative off the top of my head...

An adventure of a girl who sets out everyday to learn new lessons, meet strangers with unique questions, to discover the many ways money is made, and to find her own definitions of happiness, by asking what really makes people happy.

 

 

This nightly series of stories lasted for months. There the character, Entrepreneur, was born.

We realized these were stories that needed to be written. As women of color, working with a team of women from all over the world, we come with a set of experiences that inform our understanding of the urgency for this kind of inventiveness.

We set out to create a narrative to encourage personal agency, self-sufficiency, and social engagement. In doing so, we developed a project that stretched beyond the idea of financial independence into the realm of self-actualization. Mindfulness became central to our narrative. We found that a deep knowledge of self has a way of connecting one person to every living thing.

 

 

Entrepreneur, setting out to find practical answers, discovers an alignment between her deep self and the potential impact she can make in the lives of others. She becomes an agent of change in her community and beyond.

 

 

What we’re raising money for.

After spending hours, days, weeks and months writing, editing, storyboarding, developing multi-modal curriculum, researching the publishing process for this book, getting feedback, running it by our biggest critics (incl. the children in our lives), we realized how much excitement there is about getting this kind of new literature and learning tools about inventive girls out on bookshelves and into the hands of women and girls (yes, and boys) of all ages.  We also realize that this is a BIG ENDEAVOR.  

 

How the money will be used.

Behind this project is a team of women. We believe in paying writers, artists, teachers, educators, pedagogues, researchers, thinkers and mothers their worth for contributions to this project and to society.

The manuscript has already been finished for months and gone through several weeks of editing. It's co-authored by a published poet, teacher and creative writing educator, along with a women’s health and wellness advocate and mother. Together, we dedicated several months to crafting this intentional story which addresses a broader cultural void.  The crowdfunding also covers expenses including illustrators, art directors, printers, distribution, publicity, digital infrastructure, outreach, etc.

We are committed to producing the highest quality of work. As the first in a series, we see this becoming a treasured children's book  that can be celebrated for years to come. As you can imagine, this task has required some serious work, the pooling of many resources, and much careful dedication. We are only now announcing it publicly after months and months of work. To say that we all have spent hundreds of hours of work on this project would be an understatement.

Broken down, here's what your donations will be used for:

 

This is a labor of love.

As we work to make this book public, as well as the tools, talks, and learning programs associated with it, we are exhausting our resources. We would love your support in making our funding goal possible.

 

How thankful we are.

Your contribution makes all of this hard work and dedication from a big team of talented women pay off. We see every donation as an affirmation of this movement. For that, we are super grateful!

Thank you! Thank you! Thank YOU! 

Sincerely,

Camalo & Aubrey + a rad team of talented women alongside us.

P.S. If you have a unique proposal to support this project, we invite you to get in touch.

 

Do you have girls & women in your life who might also love this project?

Friends & Followers social sharing goes a long way. If you can't contribute much today, tag us & share with your FB, Twitter, Instagram, and Periscope peeps.

#EntrepreneurTheGirl          #EntrepreneurFindsHerWay

We would love love love for you to share this with everyone you know interested in this movement to spread new radical narratives!

 

 

CONTINUE TO JOIN US OVER AT EntrepreneurTheGirl.com

Sources:

  1. Studies on mindfulness for young children.
  2. Wall Street Journal, The Gender Gap in Charitable Giving.

story:
Some information about me:

Hello everybody,I’m Sophea, English teacher and director of the Asean International English School in Angkor Borei, 70 km south of Phnom Pehn.

I was born in 1990 into a poor family close to Takeo town. I started my primary school in 1997 and graduated from high school in 2009. Unfortunately my family couldn’t support me so I could start the university just in 2011.

I start studying English in Our Objective Organization, a very valid school. In the meanwhile I began the English Literature course at university just in the week-ends. In 2012 I got my first job as English teacher and interpreter in Hope Agency Organization. I was overworking and doing manual jobs not in my tasks for little money and not enough for paying my studies. So I was obliged to look for another job and after months I found a teaching position in a private school in Angkor Borei. However, soon I realized that the manager didn’t care about the education of the children, neither about paying the bills of the school or the salaries of the teachers. I was exhausted of working for not honest people so I decided to take the control of the situation, I became the new director of the school, I paid all the debts the former manager left by selling the only possession my parents could give me, and I founded the Asean International English School in April 2014. One year later I was graduated from my university.

The reason why Asean School is born:

That’s how our school was born. At the beginning was very difficult and now I’m still paying some of the old debts but I’m positive. This year we have one hundred students from four to sixteen years old. We are an NGO so we don't get any help from the government. The monthly fee for children is based upon the income of their family, if they are very poor we try to get some scholarship for them. At present we have twenty children who doesn't pay anything and we will like to help more families but it is not easy to find external helps. Our school provide for each student English courses three hours per day every day. We have five teachers and they need to be paid as well. The history of our country is not helping us, Cambodia is trying to get up after years of war and a very dark period in the Seventies’. Education doesn't get enough money from the government and to be fluent in English will be an important base in the education of the children. We would like to help much people possible because the highest percentage of poor people is located in the countryside.

These are what the school needs:

For the moment I rent the space where I create the school. There are just three classrooms, soon four, and we really need money for school supplies of any type, new blackboards, a printer, fans, new computers, felt pens, books, notebooks, pencils and intelligent toys for the youngest kids, projectors and many other basic things for a good teaching place. My project now is to make the space more suitable for the kids, I would like to build a library with many books, dictionaries, material for listening course and movies with subtitles. My idea is to construct a playground for the youngest and to provide uniforms for all the students. So far we relied on the volunteers help as well. At present we don’t have much to offer, just one shared room and bathroom and good meals together. Because we count on them, we need to build some rooms or bungalows, and to buy some bicycles in order to make their stay more pleasant. 

Considering that I pay 300$ for renting the school and volunteers rooms and that I pay the teacher 100$ per month, I spend 900$ per month and the only certain income is about 800$ for the student fees. I have a monthly overdraft of 100$ in case there are no volunteers, and during the hot season is quite difficult to have people around.

We need about:

1400$ for school supplies

2200$ for the library, books and dictionaries, for one year

500$ for the playground

500$ for school uniform for needy people

1000$ for the volunteers rooms and bicycles (just adapting the old room for the moment)

(1200 dollars would be the year overdraft of my school but I won’t add it because the budget to reach will be too high and for my first fund rising I prefer to remain low).

The total is 5600$

These are more information about school:

https://traventurous.wordpress.com/2015/11/17/making-a-difference-at-angkor-borei/

http://www.aseanschool.info/index.html

http://www.helpx.net/host.asp?hostid=30521&network=9&status=updated

https://www.workaway.info/account-en.html

story:
THE DRS. WOLFSON ECO PROJECT FUNDRAISER

Every child deserves to be in a school that supports their health, their happiness and their education. Unfortunately, most public and private schools in America fall way short of that standard. Kid’s aren’t healthy; in fact, they’re sicker than ever. Kids aren’t happy, as more kids than ever are being treated for mental health issues. Kids aren’t learning, as studies show American school age children academically behind their peers in other developed countries.

And why are school-age kids having these problems? Because schools feed kids bad food. They expose kids to environmental toxins. They don’t let them play outside in non-polluted soils. They teach them to take tests rather than to learn.

The Drs. Wolfson ECO School in is a unique, nature-based learning experience for kids in pre-K through 6th grade. It’s a school where playtime outside in non-polluted soils is encouraged, where only organic nutritious foods are served, and where kids aren’t constantly exposed to environmental pollutants. The Drs. Wolfson ECO School’s focus is to nurture a child’s natural inquisitiveness in an organic, toxic-free environment, while boosting their self-confidence and teaching them to become independent learners and thinkers.

SCHOOL FEATURES AND BENEFITS FOR CHILDREN

The Drs. Wolfson ECO School is a K-6 elementary school that promotes practices that develop healthy, happy children that do well academically and socially. We instill nutritional, lifestyle and learning thought values that last a lifetime.

Only organic, Paleo foods are served at the ECO School. The environment is free from toxic paints, cleaning chemicals and other environmental pollutants. The soil is pure and generous amounts of outdoor active playtime are part of each day.

Kids are encouraged to think and learn in a fun environment, with enthusiastically committed teachers focused on the health, happiness and success of your children.

It is the policy of the ECO School that it shall not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color and/or national origin in the administration of educational policies, scholarships, opportunities or any other school programs.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Revenues generated from student tuition will not meet the full costs to educate each student. That’s why the ECO School must generate income from private donations, corporate contributions, grants and other fundraising.

Donations impact lives. Donations power us to properly meet the developmental and educational needs of school age children. So they are healthy. So they are happy. So they become learners, thinkers and doers.

After ECO School operating costs are covered, 100% of this fundraisers proceeds will be used to fund student tuition.

THE IMPACT

Your contribution will make a difference in the lives and health of entire generations of children. By teaching kids how to live naturally and eat the right foods as part of their elementary education, your contribution will help them gain a school to provide the necessary foundation for healthy living.

The Drs. Wolfson have been quite successful at teaching people how to live naturally, without prescription medications or invasive procedures. They’ve been featured on NBC and CNN, as well as The Wall Street Journal and USA Today. They are two of the most followed and trusted holistic physicians on Facebook.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Take action! Feed kids only organic Paleo foods. Remove environmental pollutants by using only natural household cleaning and personal care products. Encourage kids to be active outside every day.

Follow The Drs. Wolfson on Facebook! We’ll be posting a series of articles that explore ways to keep kids healthy naturally, and ways to properly educate elementary school age children.

Help spread the word! Use this campaign’s social sharing buttons, conveniently located next to the Back It button in the top right section of this page. Let your friends and family know about this important cause and encourage them to support it with a donation!

ABOUT THE DRS. WOLFSON

The Drs. Wolfson are doctors that have emerged as two of the world’s leading natural holistic health physicians. Their natural holistic health information, natural lifestyle and natural healthcare approaches have been featured on NBC and CNN, and in publications like the USA Today, The Wall Street Journal and The Washington Post. They are amongst the most followed natural holistic health doctors on Facebook. Tens of thousands of people watch their natural health videos, hundreds of thousands read their posts each week, and more than 100,000 doctors and people just like you have attended their speeches and training. Dr. Heather Wolfson is a chiropractor. Dr. Jack Wolfson is a board-certified cardiologist, author of the # 1 Amazon best-seller, The Paleo Cardiologist: The Natural Way to Heart Health, and winner for the Natural Choice Award as a holistic M.D. Together, this husband and wife team are The Drs. Wolfson.

If you have any questions about the ECO School or this fundraiser campaign, please email them to health@thedrswolfson.com
