story:
Greetings!

Hello, I am Dr. Ani Kalayjian.  I am the founder and President of Meaningfulworld and The Association for Trauma and Outreach and Prevention (ATOP), as well as a therapist, educator, and author. My years of work have brought me international recognition as an expert on the transforming psychological effects of trauma in disaster victims.  This has allowed us to travel to over 45 countries, to bring healing, empowerment, and transformation to those who have suffered the devastation of disaster, whether human-made or natural.


Our Goals

We need $6,000 USD, to bring healing workshops to the surviving communities in three countries -- Palestine, Israel and Jordan.  We will also train the professionals, ministers and teachers, and camp staff who are traumatized as well. 

Imagine being displaced for 60 years. Imagine not having a livelihood, employment, food, and electricity for over four years. This is what is motivating us to leave the comfort of our homes and go to the Middle East and make a difference in the surviving communities. Over 200,000 people have been killed. Over 8 million people have been displaced to four different countries, and there is no hope of the conflict ending in peace. We are going to the Middle East to empower the survivors, to help them release their grief, trauma and suffering, to give them tools for healing through workshops, empathy, dialogue, conflict transformation, as well as conducting research to share with the scientific and diplomatic communities around the world.

[*Contributions for non profits can only be made using credit or debit cards.]

Example of ATOP's Work 1: Mission to Sierra Leone (Part 1 of 3).

Humanitarian Mission to the Middle East: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dh1-juQNbEI&feature=youtube_gdata


Perks

We have some wonderful symbolic but meaningful gifts to show our appreciation, such as a Ancestral Meditation CD, books on healing, live energy balancing and yoga sessions, and even a live presentation at your venue, by our 2015 team.

How We Will Use Your Donation

Your donations will be used to enable an ATOP Meaningfulworld humanitarian outreach team to travel in May 2015.  Whatever we are able to raise, will be solely dedicated to this Empowerment Humanitarian Mission. If we do not reach our goals, we may assist smaller number of people. 

Example of ATOP's Work 2: Symposium at United Nations International on Woman's Day

The Value

The humanitarian outreach missions by Meaningfulworld are invaluable to our world community. Unfortunately, tragedy can strike anywhere. It is our goal to educate, heal and empower people with compassion; to endure, to love themselves, respect each other and to live with meaning and peace. 

By teaching professionals, students, NGOs (non-government organizations) and field workers in each of these countries how to handle the effects of disaster, we are helping them to help themselves. Then, even after we leave, our teachings can be utilized to continue helping those in need.  

For over 25 years ATOP Meaningfulworld has worked in over 45 countries around the world, bringing healing in the most traumatized parts of the world such as Sierra Leone, Kenya, Rwanda, Burundi, DR Congo, Haiti, Romania, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, and many states in America (after hurricanes, earthquakes, 9/11, as well as Gulf and Iraq war Veterans). 

Example of ATOP's Work 3: Mission To Haiti

Spread the word!

Thank you for taking the time to learn about our campaign.  Please let others know about us by using word of mouth, email, or the IndieGoGo share tools on this site.

By spreading the word about our fundraiser you will help us achieve our goals. Not only to raise funds for this mission, but also to help us reach out to more people in need, wherever they are in the world.

Example of ATOP's Work 4: United Nation Day of Peace
story_txt: Greetings!Hello, I am Dr. Ani Kalayjian.  I am the founder and President of Meaningfulworld and The Association for Trauma and Outreach and Prevention (ATOP), as well as a therapist, educator, and author. My years of work have brought me international recognition as an expert on the transforming psychological effects of trauma in disaster victims.  This has allowed us to travel to over 45 countries, to bring healing, empowerment, and transformation to those who have suffered the devastation of disaster, whether human-made or natural.Our GoalsWe need $6,000 USD, to bring healing workshops to the surviving communities in three countries -- Palestine, Israel and Jordan.  We will also train the professionals, ministers and teachers, and camp staff who are traumatized as well. Imagine being displaced for 60 years. Imagine not having a livelihood, employment, food, and electricity for over four years. This is what is motivating us to leave the comfort of our homes and go to the Middle East and make a difference in the surviving communities. Over 200,000 people have been killed. Over 8 million people have been displaced to four different countries, and there is no hope of the conflict ending in peace. We are going to the Middle East to empower the survivors, to help them release their grief, trauma and suffering, to give them tools for healing through workshops, empathy, dialogue, conflict transformation, as well as conducting research to share with the scientific and diplomatic communities around the world.[*Contributions for non profits can only be made using credit or debit cards.]Example of ATOP's Work 1: Mission to Sierra Leone (Part 1 of 3).Humanitarian Mission to the Middle East: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dh1-juQNbEI&feature=youtube_gdataPerksWe have some wonderful symbolic but meaningful gifts to show our appreciation, such as a Ancestral Meditation CD, books on healing, live energy balancing and yoga sessions, and even a live presentation at your venue, by our 2015 team.How We Will Use Your DonationYour donations will be used to enable an ATOP Meaningfulworld humanitarian outreach team to travel in May 2015.  Whatever we are able to raise, will be solely dedicated to this Empowerment Humanitarian Mission. If we do not reach our goals, we may assist smaller number of people. Example of ATOP's Work 2: Symposium at United Nations International on Woman's DayThe ValueThe humanitarian outreach missions by Meaningfulworld are invaluable to our world community. Unfortunately, tragedy can strike anywhere. It is our goal to educate, heal and empower people with compassion; to endure, to love themselves, respect each other and to live with meaning and peace. By teaching professionals, students, NGOs (non-government organizations) and field workers in each of these countries how to handle the effects of disaster, we are helping them to help themselves. Then, even after we leave, our teachings can be utilized to continue helping those in need.  For over 25 years ATOP Meaningfulworld has worked in over 45 countries around the world, bringing healing in the most traumatized parts of the world such as Sierra Leone, Kenya, Rwanda, Burundi, DR Congo, Haiti, Romania, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, and many states in America (after hurricanes, earthquakes, 9/11, as well as Gulf and Iraq war Veterans). Example of ATOP's Work 3: Mission To HaitiSpread the word!Thank you for taking the time to learn about our campaign.  Please let others know about us by using word of mouth, email, or the IndieGoGo share tools on this site.By spreading the word about our fundraiser you will help us achieve our goals. Not only to raise funds for this mission, but also to help us reach out to more people in need, wherever they are in the world.Example of ATOP's Work 4: United Nation Day of Peace

story:
Short Summary

Nepal Earthquake Epicenter Relief!

The Nepal Humanitarian Project 2015, our most recent Nepal Humanitarian Project,  returned on April 01, 2015. We completed our projects with your help.  Thank you.

However, what has happened now is what everyone has worried about for years. The Big One (earthquake) has been a topic of discussion for many years. Well, it has happened.  I was walking through the Thamel district of Kathmandu with the students and was talking about this very event. What would the disaster be like if there was a huge earthquake? We visualized the destruction as it now exists in reality. 

The very people we helped in March and April, and many more,  need your help again. We have a group in the Chitwan are who are going to take supplies into the Gorkha region which is located at the epicenter of the 7.8 earthquake. The world sees the destruction of Kathmandu. But, the reports from the epicenter are nonexistent.  However, the needs there are as great as or greater than that which is being experienced in Kathmandu.  The outlying rural areas are in dire need and access to the area for humanitarian assistance is problematic for many humanitarian agencies.  

The locals people are on the frontlien and they feel they can help. Please read from my contact in Chitwan, Bishnu Pariyar...

Thank you so much for yours concern to Nepal during the time of tragic event via earthquake. I feel it would (be easy to) distribute the humanitarian help and relief to the affected people in Gorkha as it (is a well-known) area (to us) and I feel (it would be) easy to distribute in Gorkha district. I will send you the pictures of it. I will buy the food stuffs and related things with the funds (you send) and our Church team will go there and distribute the relief help.

We are safe and fine and we have no harm from the earthquake (in Chitwan). Lots of lives and properties have been lost here in Nepal. The toll death rate from the earthquake has reached to 4000 and more than 6000 people have been injured. We have the frequent shock from the earthquakes and we have 7.8 Rictor Scale earthquake and hit mostly in Gorkha, Dhading and Kathmandu and its surrounding district. We are staying outside our home that is in Church. We stayed in Church with the Children. The scientists have told that its effect and shock  remain for 3 days and it last tomorrow noon time. Please pray for the affected people here in Nepal.

We want to provide those funds as quickly as possible. In fact, we have some people who will front the $10,000 we are asking for in this fundraiser.  However, it is only a loan.  We must return the funds. We have the contact. Will you help us get the funds to the people at the earthquake epicenter who need it most?  

Jay Comfort is Project Director. He has been involved in humanitarian projects in Bosnia Herzogovina for over 10 years from 1998 - 2008. In addition, Jay has hiked to over 3,800 meters to Mugu, Nepal to install solar panels and efficient wood-burning stoves for several mountain villages.  He has also visited Leh, Ladakh, India engaging in similar humanitarian projects for school children, in addition to five years of humanitarian work directly with the Nepali people.  

Will you help us, help them??

How your gifts will be used...

  • We need a minimum of $10,000 at this immediate time. 
  • We will buy water, tents, blankets, food, and medical supplies.
  • The funds will go to the Nepali people at the epicenter of the earthquake. People in Gorkha, Dhading and then Kathmandu. 

Immediate Response is needed

This is a huge humanitarian crisis that needs your help now!

  • Emergency supplies needed now! 
  • We have contact with local people who know the area.
  • The Nepali contacts we will fund will be helping friends, neighbors, and relatives.

Urgent help! 

Our fundraising deadline is 45 days, but the need is urgent! 

  • Please give generously so that we can alleviate the suffering now.
  • The locals Nepali are waiting for your funds to buy needed supplies in Chitwan to take to the epicenter.

Ways You Can Help

If you can give even one dollar it is helpful, but also get the word out.  Collect funds that you can send to us:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Indiegogo has proven to be an effective way to raise immediate funds! 
  • Help us! Help them! 

If you help us, we can do it!

The locals Nepali are waiting for your funds to buy needed supplies in Chitwan to take to the epicenter.    Ways You Can Help If you can give even one dollar it is helpful, but also get the word out.  Collect funds that you can send to us:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Indiegogo has proven to be an effective way to raise immediate funds! 
Help us! Help them!    If you help us, we can do it!

story:
Our Story

Dididai Spain is a small charity that helps children with disabilities in the Dididai ward of Bal Mandir Orphanage in Kathmandu, Nepal. The Dididai ward was dedicated to children with disabilities who are now without the general necessities and specialized supplies needed for their survival. After the devastating earthquake that hit Nepal on the 25th of April the death toll at the time of writing is at 3,000 and those known to be injured at least double that figure. The orphanage now lies in ruins and what remains is unsafe for the children to stay in.   Luckily the children were not in the building at the time of the earthquake but they are currently sleeping outside in the cold without the  shelter or supplies necessary for their continued safety and well-being. Many of the children have disabilities and as such they are particularly vulnerable to disease and sickness. These children are in desperate need of support in the form of emergency aid.  


What We Need 

The children are currently safe, but sleeping outside in cold and wet conditions without water, and food is scarce. Tremors continue to rock the country, which undoubtedly is terrifying for all the people of Nepal. There is also the threat of disease as time goes on and many of the children are particularly vulnerable to this. Even though we set the goal at £1500, every tiny bit helps and no donations will go to waste as we need to purchase essential supplies such as

  • clean water
  • food
  • medicine

Until we reach them we can not be sure what other essential equipment will need to be purchased but we will be updating on what money is spent on. Please donate what you can.

The Impact

Carolyn Evans, who works alongside Dididai Spain, has volunteered at Bal Mandir for almost five years and is a Paediatric Occupational Therapist who has worked both in education and for the NHS. As such she is extremely aware of what the children need on a medical and personal level. We are anxious to send as much aid as we can as soon as possible to make sure these children stay safe and healthy in spite of what has happened. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute for any reason you can help by sharing this campaign, the more people who see it the more people who may be able to help. So please share! 

Raising awareness of what happened in Nepal generally would also be a great help as there are so many who have been affected and they need as much support as can be offered. For more information on the aftermath of the earthquake:

 http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-32475030

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-32476820

Thank you!

story:
The Umoja Games scholarship is another part of the long-term strategy to keep the younger generations dedicated to the sport while also advancing themselves on a scholastic level. We at Umoja Games believe that the combination of good academic performance and enthusiasm for sports, in particular soccer, are recipes for a well rounded individual that can go on to achieve much greater feats.

Each year, we provide our young athletes with the chance to apply for scholarships ranging from $200 to $750. The more money we raise, the more scholarships we can award.

This year, the Umoja Games Scholarship Program has grown faster than we ever anticipated, and we have received a record-number of applicants. With your support, we can encourage more of our young athletes to excel in the classroom while pursuing their passion of soccer.

story:
I will update subscribers shortly.

Thank you for your kind words, support and encouragement.

This isn't over yet.... just needing to reflect on lessons learned and rest.

Due to health and housing issues, I have a great deal of difficulty doing this, but I am committed to creating the world I want see, even if I die trying.

story:
TinkerTainers are MakerSpaces, created specifically for children with a keen interest in the principles of STEAM-based education. Set up in reclaimed shipping containers, these spaces are portable, low-cost structures that can be easily erected just about anywhere, making them the perfect solution when addressing the infrastructural problems plaguing education in South Africa.


The dream is create stand-alone makerspaces for Africa's kids who show real talent in the fields of scitech, robotics and electronics and a passionate desire to learn. The space, equipped with all the latest tech, will encourage children to move beyond the injustices of history and look to a future that holds promise of real change.

The biggest project at TinkerTainer Cape Town will be the search for 8-10 truly talented young adults to be a part of the first group of students experiencing the TinkerTainer's after-school programmes, designed to equip kids with the skills necessary to take an idea and turn it into a reality that can change their personal situations and empower and enrich the lives of the communities they live in and ultimately, the world at large. TinkerTainer will encourage learning through play and support the creative and exploratory journeys of children discovering Sci-Tech, from concept to completion.

On the 15th June 2015 (yes, that’s just 1 week away!!!) and in celebration of Youth Day, the #TinkerTainer team is embarking on a journey to create awareness and share knowledge with the South African public about the  #MakerMovement  and  #STEAM education.

We are working on securing sponsorships and support in the areas of: travel (transport* and accommodation**),  #MakerMaterial,  #MakerSpaces  and hardware (robotics kits, parts for self-assembled 3D printers and filament, circuit boards, laptops/tablets, books and any #STEAM material possible).  This project means so much to me that my partner and I have decided, regardless of what happens with support from the public and/or private sectors in South Africa, we will take to the road anyway, accompanied by our 2 Siberian Husky siblings and our (at best) temperamental mobile internet connection.

We will visit schools and communities around the country, using any means of transport necessary to create widespread awareness of this project, why we are doing it and the benefits for every community that is blessed with a #TinkerTainer.

The challenge is on now to get the #TinkerTainer idea funded and we are ready to shout it from the rooftops!

*a vehicle, including petrol or a shuttle service or cab that is prepared to take us with the huskies

**anything pet friendly, even a caravan in the yard!


CURRENT ISSUES IN EDUCATION IN SOUTH AFRICA 

  • 48% of South African learners drop out of school before they complete
    Grade 12
  • Of the 1 261 827 learners that enrolled in 2002 for year one, only 562 112 made it through to year 12 in 2013. That’s a dropout rate of 65.2%!     
  • A serious lack of suitable facilities, up-to-date resources and activities in South Africa that promote constructive engagement among children



  • Every child who attends  and sticks to the TinkerTainer Programme
  • The communities around the TinkerTainer
  • The country as a whole

While the TinkerTainer will focus on creating sustainable, life-altering change for children living in poverty in South Africa’s townships, any child with a keen interest in STEAM will be welcomed at the TinkerTainer. A culture of community will be fostered from day one, drawing on the spirit of Ubuntu that prevails in our country.




Ultimately, this space would need state of the art computer technology capable of 3D design and programming, desks, chairs and workspaces, 3D printers, regular printers, reliable fast internet access, tools with which to tinker; robotics, electronics and mechanics kits, PCB printers and etching equipment  and a good security system (including surveillance). Initially, the aim is to secure enough funding to secure a physical LAB space for 10 children per group and a coach (ideally 2-3 containers would be a great space, but it's not absolutely necessary. we have access to several options, including converting available garages in the various communities), tables and chairs, 5 computers, a projector, stationery and, last but most importantly, robotics and electronics components (MakeBlock, SparkFun and littleBits have been identified as preferred suppliers), tools and LEGO blocks among others.

Important points for backers to note:

  • We are considering the containers as a nice to have at this point, and certainly not the make or break of this project. We can and will utilise any available space the community can offer us to start these kids off on their STEAM journey.
  • Should we not reach our campaign target, all funds raised will be allocated to buying whatever kits and equipment the budget will allow and the learning will commence.

the concept of a container classroom

Obviously, the more funding I can secure initially, the more secure the starting block for TinkerTainer becomes, but I am fully committed to the vision of this project and ensuring it's success.

Breakdown of costs to cover for one TinkerTainer Makerspace, assuming that we set it up in available premises within the community:

UPDATE:
The quote for the shipping container was in fact much higher than originally estimated, so I have decided to minimise the startup costs by housing the TinkerTainer project in a brick and mortar home and then to run a second round of funding at a later stage. 
I am currently also in conversation with a few local companies regarding vehicle (and branding) sponsorships to enable us to cover a larger area during the #TinkerTainer #RoadShow and to get kids to competitions and excursions we may need to attend at a later stage!






I think the most important aspect to any campaign involving working with youth and communities toward change is funding. I don’t want TinkerTainer to rely on donations and funding forever, but would rather see it grow into a self-sustaining business, funded by a percentage of the earnings from the products and projects the team of educators and children create. With this end in mind, every project tackled will be marketed in an online store on completion. My vision is for teams to be guided toward tasks that address and solve specific problems in their communities and immediate environments. The kids will then develop, build, code,  test, tweak and improve the solutions they dream up and ultimately sell or license to governments, organisations, communities or individuals who need them, thereby further funding the TinkerTainer initiative.


TinkerTainer will promote educating children in all aspects of living a sustainable successful life and children will earn an income off every sale of the solutions they are involved with. Wherever possible, we will strive to keep the TinkerTainer fee-free for all participants and children will be encouraged to get involved in projects that can be retailed to both the private and public sectors and with funds acquired through successful participation in science and robotics competitions and fairs. I am also in the process of registering TinkerTainer as a non-profit organisation, but the formation of a Voluntary Association in South Africa requires an agreement in the form of written or unwritten constitution between three or more people and I am am being cautious about who I appoint to fill the other 3 places!


I do not foresee any major risks in undertaking this project, provided that high-level security is implemented around the safeguarding of the equipment required and that a culture of respect is nurtured in every child with access to the TinkerTainer space.

The concept of introducing robotics into education is not new to the world, and I am not trying to reinvent the wheel. I simply want to work to a similar formula to what Fundi Bots is doing in Uganda, Afrimakers in 10 African countries, Afrobotics and countless others all over Africa. African children have shown a readiness to embrace technology as a tool to learn (Ethiopian kids teach themselves using machines they have never seen before!), but many of them simply cannot afford it.

I want to bring the magic and wonder of the amazing world of robotic technology to them, but I cannot do it without your help!


I recognise that there is more to launching a community, education and technology project than financial backing, and any advice, all suggestions and every offer of assistance is welcome. TinkerTainer can be contacted via email, or by filling out the contact form on the website.

If all you can do to help get this project off the ground is share it with your network and help spread the word about the TinkerTainer, that is ok too! Every person who is talking about this initiative is one more person helping to make sure that Africa’s children are being given a chance to foster change!

Thank you for your time.

*Should you choose a pledge which includes shipping, please add $10 to your total amount. Wherever possible we will endeavour to keep the shipping as low as possible, and we will subsidize any shipping cost over $10. Thank you.

the concept of a container classroomObviously, the more funding I can secure initially, the more secure the starting block for TinkerTainer becomes, but I am fully committed to the vision of this project and ensuring it's success.Breakdown of costs to cover for one TinkerTainer Makerspace, assuming that we set it up in available premises within the community:




UPDATE:

The quote for the shipping container was in fact much higher than originally estimated, so I have decided to minimise the startup costs by housing the TinkerTainer project in a brick and mortar home and then to run a second round of funding at a later stage. I am currently also in conversation with a few local companies regarding vehicle (and branding) sponsorships to enable us to cover a larger area during the #TinkerTainer #RoadShow and to get kids to competitions and excursions we may need to attend at a later stage!

I think the most important aspect to any campaign involving working with youth and communities toward change is funding. I don’t want TinkerTainer to rely on donations and funding forever, but would rather see it grow into a self-sustaining business, funded by a percentage of the earnings from the products and projects the team of educators and children create. With this end in mind, every project tackled will be marketed in an online store on completion. My vision is for teams to be guided toward tasks that address and solve specific problems in their communities and immediate environments. The kids will then develop, build, code,  test, tweak and improve the solutions they dream up and ultimately sell or license to governments, organisations, communities or individuals who need them, thereby further funding the TinkerTainer initiative.TinkerTainer will promote educating children in all aspects of living a sustainable successful life and children will earn an income off every sale of the solutions they are involved with. Wherever possible, we will strive to keep the TinkerTainer fee-free for all participants and children will be encouraged to get involved in projects that can be retailed to both the private and public sectors and with funds acquired through successful participation in science and robotics competitions and fairs. I am also in the process of registering TinkerTainer as a non-profit organisation, but the formation of a Voluntary Association in South Africa requires an agreement in the form of written or unwritten constitution between three or more people and I am am being cautious about who I appoint to fill the other 3 places!I do not foresee any major risks in undertaking this project, provided that high-level security is implemented around the safeguarding of the equipment required and that a culture of respect is nurtured in every child with access to the TinkerTainer space.The concept of introducing robotics into education is not new to the world, and I am not trying to reinvent the wheel. I simply want to work to a similar formula to what Fundi Bots is doing in Uganda, Afrimakers in 10 African countries, Afrobotics and countless others all over Africa. African children have shown a readiness to embrace technology as a tool to learn (Ethiopian kids teach themselves using machines they have never seen before!), but many of them simply cannot afford it.I want to bring the magic and wonder of the amazing world of robotic technology to them, but I cannot do it without your help! I recognise that there is more to launching a community, education and technology project than financial backing, and any advice, all suggestions and every offer of assistance is welcome. TinkerTainer can be contacted via email, or by filling out the contact form on the website.If all you can do to help get this project off the ground is share it with your network and help spread the word about the TinkerTainer, that is ok too! Every person who is talking about this initiative is one more person helping to make sure that Africa’s children are being given a chance to foster change!Thank you for your time.*Should you choose a pledge which includes shipping, please add $10 to your total amount. Wherever possible we will endeavour to keep the shipping as low as possible, and we will subsidize any shipping cost over $10. Thank you.

story:
Help Provide Computers to Needy Students and Schools in Costa Rica

Most of us take for granted how much computers have improved how we live our lives.  For others, they have not gotten the chance.  We would like to change that.  How would you feel if you knew that you could easily change the lives of the less fortunate and help provide them without access to computer technology?  We already know, it feels great!

Our newest program is already underway.  We at Global Digital Divide, Inc have already collected 6 desktop computers, 2 laptops, 1 monitor and 1 printer.  That's just a small amount of what we need to provide to meet your goal and not leave any disappointed students and schools.  We need your help in securing $10,000 in donations over the next 30 days to fully fund this newest program.  With your generous donations we will acquire more new and used desktop computers, laptops and tablets, prepare them to be used right away and transport them to already qualified Costa Rican students and schools.


We Give More Than Just Computers

Your donation goes towards more than just providing computers.  We prepare each donated device so that recipients can get the most out of them.  Each donated device comes with:

  • Start page set to the world renown Khan Academy.  The Khan Academy is a 'completely free to the user' non-profit educational website that provides instructional videos and practice exercises primarily in the area of K-12 math, science, computer programming, history, art history, economics, English language and more.
  • Pre-installed typing software so students can easily and quickly learn how to type.  Knowing this skill early will make using the computer much more efficient.
  • Already set up free email and chat programs
  • Pre-installed Skype, Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and more
  • And more coming, we're always searching for more beneficial software and services we can put on every donated device.  Each successfully executed campaign brings valuable feedback on how we can increase the effectiveness of our donated computer technology


Who We Are: Global Digital Divide, Inc

  • Global Digital Divide, Inc is a registered 501(c)(3) charity so you can feel secure knowing that all funds go towards legitimate non-profit activities and that your generous support is fully tax-deductible. 
  • It was officially started after seeing how difficult it was to acquire such technology and initially bringing a few smart phones and laptops to Costa Rica. After seeing the profound impact it had on the recipients, the idea of Global Digital Divide, Inc was formed.
  • The husband and wife team decided they could start Global Digital Divide, Inc and help bring excess computer technology from the USA and elsewhere to Costa Rica but on a much larger scale.
  • Now that Global Digital Divide, Inc is now a fully registered 501(c)(3) public charity, we can expand and reach more students and schools than we could possibly imagine before
  • But this is only possible with the generous support from you!


Our Campaign and How You Can Get Involved

  • We need to secure at least $10,000 over the next 30 days to fully fund our newest campaign and fulfill our obligations towards the already qualified recipient students and schools.
  • You can get more personally involved with us and the recipients with our perks!
  • If we reach our goal and go beyond it, we can acquire more computers, laptops and tablets and give to more students and schools.  There are so many students and schools who could benefit.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still provide technology to as many qualified students and schools as we can.  


The Ball Is Rolling But We Need Much More


We have already collected this equipment above but it's just a fraction of what we need to meet our obligations.  We have already qualified many students and schools who have demonstrated a need for such computer technology and a capability to use it.  Our goal is to provide either a desktop computer, laptop or tablet to all already qualified students, schools and classrooms.  If we go over our goal of $10,000 over the next 30 days, we can qualify more students and schools to receive donated technology and provide more types of devices to more students in existing schools and classrooms.


Help Us Get These Capable Students Access to Computers


Imagine the Possibilities

·  Imagine that the child of organic shade grown coffee farmers gets access to a donated Global Digital Divide computer (made possible from your generous support) and makes contacts with specialty coffee buyers in the USA.  By selling their coffee directly to eager buyers they are able to command higher prices and sell more.  Their income increases and they are able to live a middle class lifestyle.

·  Imagine a gifted child gets access to a donated Global Digital Divide computer (made possible from your generous support) and is able to maximize their potential in this modern technological world and goes on to create a tech startup that employs thousands in the region and creates more opportunities around the world.

·  Imagine a student gets access to a donated Global Digital Divide computer (made possible from your generous support), learns how to type, learns how to use Word, Excel and PowerPoint, and gains access to valuable educational tools.  This leads them to University study and a productive and rewarding life in the modern world.


What is the 'Global Digital Divide'?

The 'global digital divide' is the gap between individuals, societies and cultures that have access to computer technology and those that do not.  Some regions of the world have more access to technology than others and individuals within societies have more access to technology than others.  The ones that have access are able to better advance in terms of education, business, trade, entertainment and communication.  Here are various ways that not having access to technology is detrimental to individuals and societies:

  • Fall behind in education where so much is dependent on easy access to information and software
  • Fall behind in commerce and trade when connections are difficult to make without internet accessibility
  • Unable to easily communicate across borders and gain access to new or different methods
  • Everybody could use a little bit of entertainment.  Those without computer technology are missing out on the enormous amount of entertainment options available on the internet, mobile apps and more

It is Global Digital Divide's mission to help bridge the 'global digital divide' in Costa Rica, and in the future, other parts of Latin America.  We want to bring the opportunities that computers offer to those who currently do not have.


Our Challenges

Running these programs takes time and money and is not possible without your generous support.  There are many things we need to do to be successful:

  • Acquire new and used desktop computers, laptops and tablets as inexpensively as possible.
  • Make any necessary repairs to get the equipment in the best working conditions.
  • Install custom software and apps (Khan Academy, free email, Skype, typing programs, etc) so the recipients get the most out of their donated devices.
  • Ship this equipment to Costa Rica and transport it to specific schools.
  • Provide support to them so they can get the most out of their donated devices.


How You Can Support Us

  • Share this campaign online and through your social media platforms
  • Tell all of your friends, family and colleagues about our campaign
  • Follow us and provide support along the way with messages
  • Promote the benefits of closing the 'global digital divide' in your local community
  • Remember to donate whatever you can
  • Purchase your supporters perks now – while they are available


Thank You For Supporting Our Cause


- From Global Digital Divide, Inc

story:
Hi there....

My name is Colin and I'm a doctoral student at the University of Pennsylvania studying higher education. Our program includes an international study abroad course and this year the destination was South Africa. Under the direction and watchful eye of our faculty leader, we explored the education and culture of South Africa.

While there, my friends and I spent at day in Kliptown in Soweto outside of Johannesburg.  There we were introduced to SKY, the Soweto Kliptown Youth foundation. At their center they feed, house, and educate young people who live in truly challenging conditions. For some the center is an extension of their family where they find shelter, food, water, mentors, and safety.

During our visit the young ones in the bunch were delighted to play games with us, take photos and then look at them on our phones, dance, and enjoy our company -- strangers from another place. The older kids performed dance routines and asked questions. It was a wonderful day full of hospitality and grace.

Within the center there is a library. A large room that could be so much more than it is today. The space has shelves of unorganized books, there are no chairs to sit on or tables to use, and while the space has natural light in the day when the sun goes down it's dark.

Through this campaign and the generosity of others, I plan to help SKY rebuild their library and transform it into a learning center.

I hope you'll join with me. Here's my plan:

  1. Collect pre-loved books from local libraries, universities, friends and neighbors.
  2. Collect art supplies, coloring books, and educational toys.
  3. Raise funds to purchase furniture and badly need supplies for literacy aids, art supplies, and computers.
  4. Travel to SKY and with the help of the community clean, organizing, and setup a new learning center. This center will be a place that will expand the horizons and opportunities for the youth in Kliptown.

The money that is contributed through this campaign will be used to finance the shipping of the books and materials collected in the United States and to purchase furniture, cleaning supplies, art supplies and computers for the center as well to help fund my trip to South Africa to set everything up. An approximate budget is below:

  1. $1,500 shipping of books
  2. $3,500 cleaning supplies, furniture, art supplies, furniture
  3. $3,000 tablet computers 
  4. $2,000 travel and contingency fund
I hope you'll join with me to support the wonderful youth in Soweto. Every contribution will go to support this wonderful cause and will help to bring the world of knowledge and reading to SKY and the youth of Kliptown. 

Join me.

story:
The Plan

Old Bedford Village is a living history museum located in south central Pennsylvania, just off the PA Turnpike and Interstate 99.  We have numerous special events throughout the year, and host thousands of students from throughout the region annually for field trips.

Old Bedford Village is staffed largely by volunteers, who do an incredible job telling the story of the past to younger generations.  While our visitors typically leave very happy with their visits to our Village, one complaint we do sometimes receive is that not enough cabins are occupied with interpreters.  Finding volunteers is a constant challenge, and while we know that nothing can replace our interpreters, the technology now exists to supplement our guests' experience when no interpreter is available.  

The app will include text, photographs, and audio to help tell the story of each cabin, making sure that no matter when you visit or what the availability of our volunteers is, you will have someone, at least virtually, who is able to guide you through the history of each of our nearly 40 cabins.  The video introduction is a sample of how we would like the app to operate.

If you have ever visited our Village, or if you have an appreciation for history and sharing the stories of the past with our younger generations, we would greatly appreciate your help in creating the Old Bedford Village Self-Guided Tour App, helping to keep Old Bedford Village as one of the preeminent examples of life in the 18th and 19th centuries. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking funds in the amount of $3,500.  All content for the app has already been written by volunteers John Wessner and Emily Deremer, free of charge.  

The quote we received from our app developer, Cyber Protection Group, is for $2,400.  

The remainder of the cost will be applied to paying for studio time and for hiring local voice talent to record the audio for the app.  Please see the video gallery for a draft version of our introduction and the Williams Cabin entries.

Annual maintenance fees for the app and the app store are an additional $352, so any remaining money raised will be used to help cover these costs both for the present and in the future.

We have a variety of contribution levels that include both annual passes and single-visit passes to thank you for your contributions.  This will allow you to visit the Village free of charge to try the app for yourself!

While we fully believe we can meet our goal, if for some reason that is not the case, we will hold these funds and continue to seek sponsors and additional sources of income to complete the project in the very near future, and we will notify you of our progress along the way.

If your generosity allows us to receive funds far above the cost of the app, the cost of maintaining buildings that date as far back as the 1700s is great, and additional money raised will be applied to the maintenance and upkeep of the Village.

The Impact

Your help will allow Old Bedford Village to remain relevant both now and going forward for many years to come.  For nearly 40 years, Old Bedford Village has been a place for families to play and learn together.  With your help, we will continue this tradition for a long time to come, in a new and exciting way for today's families!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help us financially at this time, we certainly understand!  Please consider helping us by sharing our mission with your friends via Social Media and/or e-mail!  It's simple to do using the share tools right here on indiegogo.com!

story:
About Diversity

Hi! My name is Lukas. I am a trans advocate and educator, and the president of Diversity. 

Diversity is a student organization formed in December 2014 in Ningbo, China. In January 2015, and after a lot of struggle, we were officially recognized by our University. One of its main particularities is the challenging context in which it is inserted: a hybrid space that characterizes a Sino-Foreign University. 

Diversity is formed by LGBTQIA students and alumni, and many allies. It aims at creating a diverse and respectful campus environment, free from discrimination and inclusive of all students, regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity. 

Diversity's main activities are workshops and lectures, film and movie screenings, weekly "Safe Space" support group meetings, and research and consulting.

We also contribute to the LGBTQIA people beyond University settings. In June 2015, we organized the Ningbo LGBTQ Students Summit in order to provide training and capacity building to future LGBTQIA student leaders. In July 2015 we organized a Professional Mixer as an opportunity for LGBTQIA people to meet and learn more about how to navigate their workplace.

Financial Situation

Unfortunately, until this point, we haven't gotten any financial support. Therefore, all the multiple activities we do are mainly self-funded. Last semester, we sold buttons and t-shirts to fundraise, but as we grow we realize that there is a lot to be done, and we cannot cover all the costs associated with providing the support our peers need.

The amount we are trying to gather was calculated based on some expenses we believe we will have throughout the whole year. We will post updates of activities we organize both here as well as on our Facebook page (Diversity-LGBT-Ningbo).

All the funds will go towards supporting sexual and gender diversity in China, especially through the following: providing educational and awareness sessions, capacity building workshops, mentoring and peer counseling programs, support groups, film screenings, and research.

Main Challenges

Advocacy and raising awareness for sexual and gender diversity is becoming more and more difficult in China. Public opinion in the country regarding “non-traditional” sexual orientations and gender identities remains predominantly negative. In most cases, educational institutions lack the basic knowledge around sexual and gender diversity. For this reason, the difficulties are greater than in many other parts of the world. We will utilize a Sino-Foreign University as a safe space from where to expand our range of action.

No money? Spread the word!

If you can't contribute financially, please help us spreading the word!

  • Share our campaign using Indigogo's share tools! 
  • Like us on Facebook!

In July 2015 we organized a Professional Mixer as an opportunity for LGBTQIA people to meet and learn more about how to navigate their workplace.

   Financial Situation 
Unfortunately, until this point, we haven't gotten any financial support. Therefore, all the multiple activities we do are mainly self-funded. Last semester, we sold buttons and t-shirts to fundraise, but as we grow we realize that there is a lot to be done, and we cannot cover all the costs associated with providing the support our peers need.
The amount we are trying to gather was calculated based on some expenses we believe we will have throughout the whole year. We will post updates of activities we organize both here as well as on our Facebook page (Diversity-LGBT-Ningbo).
All the funds will go towards supporting sexual and gender diversity in China, especially through the following: providing educational and awareness sessions, capacity building workshops, mentoring and peer counseling programs, support groups, film screenings, and research.

    Main Challenges  Advocacy and raising awareness for sexual and gender diversity is becoming more and more difficult in China. Public opinion in the country regarding “non-traditional” sexual orientations and gender identities remains predominantly negative. In most cases, educational institutions lack the basic knowledge around sexual and gender diversity. For this reason, the difficulties are greater than in many other parts of the world. We will utilize a Sino-Foreign University as a safe space from where to expand our range of action.
    No money? Spread the word! If you can't contribute financially, please help us spreading the word!



Share our campaign using Indigogo's share tools! 


Like us on Facebook!

story:
My name is Peter Danby and I am setting up this project to help save the lives of 19 children - and more - that I met recently in Kathmandu, Nepal.

I have worked independently in the area of leadership development for 23 years and as an associate with London Business School. I also run a small charitable trust called Small Acts of Kindness. Our aim is to support the education of children and young people in areas effected by extreme poverty or conflict. For the last 5 years we have been working with Tamil communities in Sri Lanka then, this year, I made contact with Dhruba, who helps run RUWON Nepal, an organisation working to empower women in the rural communities in Nepal. I booked my flights to go and visit his small orphanage - another of his projects - and see his work among the women and children in the rural villages around Kathmandu. Then the earthquake hit.

I saw the damage and heard the stories. Then, I heard that the small orphanage where I was staying was also in danger. The single donor was stopping her funding and these children would soon be ‘re-allocated’ - that means some of them will spend the rest of their childhood, perhaps longer in ‘domestic service’. We have managed to keep it open for a month or two but the money is nearly gone. 

Why is this important to me? I just can’t imagine what these children have already endured in their short lives. They come from the villages in rural areas, the poorest of the poor - and then they lose their families. Then the earthquake, and now, they will lose their new mother and their new home. I have to help in some small way.

I hardly need to tell you the impact that your donations will have on these children. Keeping the home open will give them a totally different life; security’ love and opportunity rather than yet more suffering and possible abuse.

More than that; we will use these funds to develop the facilities and capacity of the home to help other children within Nepal and this local community. We are already working on a project with two local girls’ schools and we are planning a visit in February with a group of sports coaches, facilitators and teachers. The home can become a centre for volunteers to come and help these children and others like them. 

The home currently costs $30,000 a year to run - a large portion of that is the rent. I have set the target at $60,000 so that we can secure the home for the immediate future.  The long term goal is to purchase or build a property but this will be another project. 

The funds will be sent directly to RUWON Nepal Star Orphanage. There is no intermediary and I will be helping, through Small Acts of Kindness, to manage the funds and how they are used. The funds will be used for rent, food, clothing for the children, improving the facilities and providing the care staff. All the funds  will be used in this way regardless of how much we raise.  

What can we offer you for you generosity? 

For donations of $25 - You will have to forgive the broken English but you will receive a letter and photograph from the children to thank you for your donation (first 100)

For donations of $100 - You will receive a cap with the Small Acts of Kindness name and logo (first 50).

For larger donations - We can’t afford flights but we would be happy to arrange or you to go and visit the orphanage and see Kathmandu at first hand.

story:
Hello All!

My name is Nicole Austin and I am the Founder of PUREST Academy for Kids. PUREST Academy for Kids, Inc was established in February 2014 with a mission to promote overall educational growth and development for children age 6 weeks to 6 years of age, by providing quality childcare at affordable prices. Early childhood education is vital in a child's overall growth and development.  Children need a quality program that gives them the tools they need to have a successful transition into Kindergarten. Our program focuses on providing families with a program fulfilling their complete educational needs regardless of their financial situation.

Opening a Child Care Facility requires a series of steps. We must first find a location. Next, we must receive approval from the City in which the facility is located, allowing use of that facility as a child care center. We then must submit the licensing application to the State of California Child Care Licensing Division. We have completed every one of these steps! We are well on our way to being licensed. However, during our Fire Inspection we were made aware that the current Fire Alarm System in the facility needs to be upgraded. This was an unexpected hurdle that we must cross in order to become a licensed facility. 

Our goals are clear, we want to bring a much needed service to families in our community. This journey has been a long yet rewarding one and we can truly see the light at the end of the tunnel. Help us complete this vision.

What We Need & What you Get

The cost to put in the required fire alarm system is $8,000. As donors, you will receive a few perks for your generosity! For contributors that donate $25, we will display a public "Thank You" on our official website. For contributors that donate $100 or more, we will display their names in our Preschool. For donors that donate $1000 or more, we will display their name or company logo on the red carpet backdrop of our Grand Opening.

The Impact

Our Infant and Toddler program not only offers families an opportunity to rejoin the workforce, but the program is also beneficial to the childcare providers employed here. These childcare providers have an opportunity to increase their monthly income and obtain benefits such as affordable health insurance, life insurance, and retirement plans.

Low to Moderate income  families will benefit greatly from our program. Low to Moderate income families have a hard time finding high quality childcare/Preschool services for their children that they can actually afford.
Our goal is to provide that service for these families, so their children are given equal opportunities and tools to have a successful transition into Kindergarten. Early childhood education has a substantial impact on the success of a child once they reach school-age years. Our program will provide the appropriate foundation that will aid in the children having a smooth and successful transition from Preschool to Kindergarten. If we empower our youth, we empower the future. Families need more than a "babysitting" service. At PUREST Academy we understand that the possibilities for what children can learn is limitless. When children leave our program they will have developed a LOVE FOR LEARNING. This is one of the strongest foundations for a child. This foundation can ensure that no matter what comes their way, they will be excited to continue their learning experience.

Risks & Challenges

At the moment, we have been paying rent on our facility and creating a safe and nurturing environment for children to grow and thrive. We need our facility to be licensed so that we can begin generating income to continue to be a successful business.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone may not be able to donate to our cause. We are okay with that. All we ask is that you please spread the word! Please forward and share our story. Indiegogo has some amazing sharing tools! God Bless!

"God gave me the vision, and I intend to follow it."

story:
Short Summary

I'm going to Colorado this summer to meet my teacher, Elizabeth Mattis-Namgyel. I'm also turning 30 this year, so it's a bit of a milestone year for me in general. 

If you want to give me a gift I would be utterly grateful for a financial contribution to getting me to Colorado in July. This is all I want and I have no expectations of contribution (Thank you to those of you who have already contributed!) from anyone. 

I'll pay for it myself because it's happening regardless - but it would be amazing if you were able to contribute as it will take some of the financial pressure off the whole venture. 

Breakdown of the Whole Kit-and-Kaboodle

The flights will cost around £1200, give or take, because there's nothing direct to Colorado from London. 

I've already paid for the retreat registration (Thank you to Judith and Gretchen for helping me out there!), which was $475USD. 

The retreat centre doesn't have accomidation so I'm gonna have to book something through Air BnB and that's looking at between £300 and £400 because it's nine nights. 

I'll also need to rent a vehicle to get me from where I'm staying to the event so there's that cost, plus petrol. 

AND, as if that wasn't enough - I need to feed myself too, and I have hollow-leg syndrome. 

In total the whole thing is likely going to come to about £3000 or so. I technically can pay for the whole thing piecemeal, over time, but it's going to leave me strapped for cash and really squeeze on my savings, so anything you can contribute will be amazing and very gratefully received. 

The Impact

I am incredibly dedicated to my practice and ultimately I want to teach and also run my own retreat centre where people can come to learn, find inspiration and become that much more open to life and all it has to offer. This is just one step in that direction and will contribute so much to all I have to learn and discover. 

Plus I'll dedicate the merit like a fiend to you and everyone you know. It's like a massive compassion/generosity practice for everyone involved! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the money please, please don't feel obligated to provide. You can help by sharing this link far and wide! That in itself is hugely beneficial too.

story:
Background

Hello!  My name is Allan and I am the inventor of the WriteRight Pencil Grip and Trainer! It was inspired by a family member, an Occupational Therapist working in a New Jersey Public School District, who one day exclaimed to me:

 "We need a pencil grip that WORKS!"   

As an engineer and entrepreneur, with a passion to solve problems, create and invent, we developed a new pencil grip.  Our product truly addresses the challenges millions of children and older individuals with special needs face each and every day trying to hold a writing implement!

In addition to a design patent that has already been issued (US D710,492), a utility patent is pending for our product.   We have received feedback from the United States Patent Office that it is likely to be granted very soon!

We've spent countless hours and thousands of dollars getting the idea from concept to pre-production,  With the help of family, friends, teachers, and professionals, we've sold over 5,000 pre-production units manufactured using high tech 3D printing technology.   We have sold our product all over the United States and around the globe!

With our modern society fixated on the latest and greatest technology explosion, it is fun to be excited over one of the oldest inventions that perhaps started it all. 

THE PENCIL.

The WriteRight is simply the greatest innovation to assist those who want to do the simplest of tasks:  Signing their own name.

Help us take our product to the next stage in its evolution!

What's So Special About the WriteRight

Historically, "pencil grips" have been a mish-mosh of plastic, rubber and silicone shapes, most of which were developed in the 40s and 50s. For decades, there has been little to no innovation in the humble pencil grip. 

That is not to say there has not been a need.   The therapist who inspired the WriteRight pencil grip has been perpetually frustrated with the products on the market.   She works with hundreds of children every year, ranging from mild to severe challenges when writing.  Most children would give up or complain of fatigue, while others would not use the grip for fear of being mocked by their peers.    She had tried every grip on the market, and nothing worked for any length of time.  None of the grips were designed with the entire physiology of the hand in mind, merely the position of the fingers.

Our product addresses more than just the position of the fingers.  The WriteRight is designed to fill the negative space of the hand, promoting the natural tripod grip: The integrated tail sinks into the palm of the hand causing the pinky and ring fingers to curl inward, and the friendly eyes and mouth are visual cues for proper finger and thumb placement.   For children with mild writing issues, our grip becomes a trainer, promoting muscle memory.  For severe conditions, our grip will enable children to grow into adulthood using our product as we have sizes through adult.

The innovation did not stop with the shape of the product!  We integrated a mechanical pencil which is included with the device.   It never requires sharpening, can never be removed, is always at the correct location, and always provides the perfect point for easy penmanship.  A simple "click" of the eraser, and the child can advance the lead.  Pop off the eraser when the lead is done, and add another.  Simple. 

Another challenge with today's product design is that the grips are symmetrical, for use in either hand.   But the hands are mirrors of each other, not just symmetric.  So we created sizes for both left and right handed users spanning the ages of three to adult.   We have not come across another grip where both the left and right hand are addressed.   One size definitely does not fit all.

  Parents of children who use our product discover that their child can pick up our product, intuitively understand how to use it  and simply start writing within seconds.  Where nearly all other products have failed, the WriteRight Pencil Grip has excelled.

As we make progress, we are actively working on a version with a pen.  An important discovery made at a special needs event demonstrated that  teens and adults with musculoskeletal and neurological conditions such as TBI, CP, MS, MD, are desperate to be able to write.  There appears to be no real solutions for them.   This is a highly under-served group of  individuals who simply want to be able to sign their own name.   We believe we have the solution.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $35,000 in capital for the following purposes:

#1:  Design, develop and manufacture  the necessary production molds to move our product into full scale, low cost injection molding process using high quality plastic resins.  Best of all, we plan to make them all right here in the USA.

#2: Re-build our website to make it more user friendly, and easier to order product.

#3:  Fund travel expenses to go to tradeshows to demonstrate our products to the correct industries.

#4:  Complete the patent application process as soon as possible as time is running out on our filing, and some additional capital is necessary.

Whether or not we reach our desired goal, all the proceeds raised will go towards funding the production molds first and foremost.   We will start with our size Medium Right, as this is the most popular size purchased to date.

To show our appreciation for your contribution to our  campaign, we have a variety of perks to offer.   Please check them out!


The Impact

In our world dominated by computers, smart phones, electronics, computer games, and the like, there is one indisputable fact.  Children will need to learn to write before they can proficiently type.  Signing one's name will likely never fall out of favor.  Penmanship is rarely taught in schools any longer, but the need to write has not gone away.  


Our product is timeless, yet our culture, and cultures around the world, are spending less and less time coaching the basic skills of life, such as writing.  Children are not becoming proficient with this most basic skill.   And for those children with special needs, gripping a pencil can be an arduous chore.


Professionals have said that training of how to use a pencil properly needs to occur before the age of 8, after which poor habits are difficult, if not impossible, to correct.   Our product targets this particular age group, and we have had teachers of young children tell us that "they wish every student they had could use a WriteRight."


There are over 20 million children in grades pre-K to three, our target market, in just the United States!   Millions are not learning to hold a pencil in the proper and efficient, tripod grip.  This improper grip often leads to slower writing, inferior penmanship, hand fatigue, and in some case, tendinitis or other degenerative ailments.


Perhaps the most startling discovery we have made is that children actually use our product.  Teachers and Therapists alike tell stories about how children dislike using the existing slip-on pencil grips.   They pull them off, or slide them around, lose them or simply ignore them.   Many children tease those using other pencil grips.  With our WriteRight featuring its friendly animal features and shape, children are competing to use the grip.  It's amazing!  In one case, a therapist told us that "one child without any writing issues came up to me and said, 'I think I need help writing.  Can I have the dolphin pencil, too?'"


Our Challenge

Our challenge right now is the need to speed to market.  We are ready to move to the next step, which is full scale production. This is how we can produce tens or even hundreds of thousands at the lowest possible price.   Our issue is the "catch 22" of any start-up enterprise.   We need to be ready to build production volumes in order for big retailers to place large orders.  The problem is we need large orders to justify investing in the capital.  Raising a relatively small amount of capital through this campaign will resolve the conundrum.  


Regardless of the outcome of this campaign, we will keep pursuing the next step.   It will just take more time.   With all of your help, we can accelerate the move to production, and start winning the larger orders. Our dream is to get our product out to those who need it around the globe.


Other Ways You Can Help

"Cash is king" as the saying goes.   And yes, it's true, raising this capital will accelerate our penetration into the marketplace.   But equally important is spreading the word about our product.   One sale at a time on our website (www.theWriteRight.com) generates a small amount of cash.  The faster those individual orders come in, the more quickly we can have enough capital to make that big next step.

If you would kindly pass along the information about our product using social media, or the next time you are talking with friends, family or co-workers, please mention our product to them.   That would be such a big help.  Thank you!

Professionals have said that training of how to use a pencil properly needs to occur before the age of 8, after which poor habits are difficult, if not impossible, to correct.   Our product targets this particular age group, and we have had teachers of young children tell us that "they wish every student they had could use a WriteRight."

There are over 20 million children in grades pre-K to three, our target market, in just the United States!   Millions are not learning to hold a pencil in the proper and efficient, tripod grip.  This improper grip often leads to slower writing, inferior penmanship, hand fatigue, and in some case, tendinitis or other degenerative ailments.

Perhaps the most startling discovery we have made is that children actually use our product.  Teachers and Therapists alike tell stories about how children dislike using the existing slip-on pencil grips.   They pull them off, or slide them around, lose them or simply ignore them.   Many children tease those using other pencil grips.  With our WriteRight featuring its friendly animal features and shape, children are competing to use the grip.  It's amazing!  In one case, a therapist told us that "one child without any writing issues came up to me and said, 'I think I need help writing.  Can I have the dolphin pencil, too?'"
   Our Challenge  Our challenge right now is the need to speed to market.  We are ready to move to the next step, which is full scale production. This is how we can produce tens or even hundreds of thousands at the lowest possible price.   Our issue is the "catch 22" of any start-up enterprise.   We need to be ready to build production volumes in order for big retailers to place large orders.  The problem is we need large orders to justify investing in the capital.  Raising a relatively small amount of capital through this campaign will resolve the conundrum.  

Regardless of the outcome of this campaign, we will keep pursuing the next step.   It will just take more time.   With all of your help, we can accelerate the move to production, and start winning the larger orders. Our dream is to get our product out to those who need it around the globe.

Other Ways You Can Help
 "Cash is king" as the saying goes.   And yes, it's true, raising this capital will accelerate our penetration into the marketplace.   But equally important is spreading the word about our product.   One sale at a time on our website (www.theWriteRight.com) generates a small amount of cash.  The faster those individual orders come in, the more quickly we can have enough capital to make that big next step.
If you would kindly pass along the information about our product using social media, or the next time you are talking with friends, family or co-workers, please mention our product to them.   That would be such a big help.  Thank you!

story:
Who We Are

PARSA was established in 1996 and has been working with orphanages and schools for the last 8 years. It is a registered 501c3 nonprofit in the United States.

What We Will Do

1. Bring each child to the appropriate grade level for his or her age by providing tutoring and support in groups and individually according to the national curriculum. During these sessions children will also learn how to behave in school; a senior teacher who will test and monitor each child's grade level progress. PARSA will also seek extra professional help for children who have learning challenges from a psychosocial trainer. These sessions will be daily for all of children.

2. Provide a variety of activities from sports to games to arts and theater, which are vital to their happiness, as well as their development. A daily program of physical and intellectual activities is key to giving these orphan children a step forward in their ability to transition to the community when that time comes.

3. Pre-vocational training activities will be given for older children with different kinds of work, either through crafts, projects, or training in services, such as gardening, or learning about machines, This will help us develop a more comprehensive training program in the future to develop job tracks for the them. In these activities, the older children will also learn job skills like discipline, timeliness, and how to manage money. 

What We Need, What You Get

What is needed, more than anything, is financial support.

  • The cost is approximately $40 per child per month
  • We'd like to get this off the ground for six months to start
  • Funds will go towards additional staff like teachers and social workers

If you donate, expect to receive a photograph of one of the Shamsa children and a possible picture made by them.

What's More

In addition to the above priorities, we also:

  • Facilitate doctor's visits and medical care
  • Observe and refer troubled children to psychosocial care
  • Give children consistent lessons in hygiene and appropriate behavior
  • Expose the children to caring adults in their home setting

Other Ways to Help

PARSA and Shamsa Children's Village are grateful for all forms of assistance, but technical and financial assistance are particularly valuable.

  • Narrowly focused collections, like for school supplies, are always helpful
  • Technical expertise for ongoing construction projects is also appreciated

If you would like to donate in one of the above ways instead, please send a message.

Websites

  • PARSA: http://afghanistan-parsa.org/
  • Shamsa Children's Village: http://afghanistan-parsa.org/shamsa-village-orp...

Point of Contact

The point of contact for this fundraising campaign is Bethany Lerch. She can be reached at beth.lerch@gmail.com for more specific questions. Thank you for your support.
