story:
NEPAL EARTHQUAKE RELIEF FUND FOR NUBRI

On April 25th, a massive 7.9 earthquake hit Nepal, claiming the lives of over 8,500 people, and injuring twice that number. Many parts of the country were stricken by the quake. Since then, Nepal has been experiencing several aftershocks which further worsen the situation. Many people are left homeless and hungry. On May 12th, Langtang, a remote region in the North, encountered another major 7.3 earthquake that killed over fifty people and injured over four hundred. Although Nepal has received a lot of aid and support from many foreign countries, many people from the affected areas are not receiving any relief or support from the Nepali government. In order to address this, many people who are currently studying or working in Kathmandu and the affected regions are working on figuring ways to get relief funds and support to their villages.

My name is Tashi Bista.  I’m from Lo Manthang, a village in Mustang, Nepal. I currently go to school at Phillips Exeter Academy in the United States. While I am fortunate that my family and village were not impacted very greatly, the earthquake has directly affected many close friends and connections of mine (from other parts of the country, particularly Nubri in this case), and I consider this issue very real and important to me. So, I’m organizing a group of friends in Nepal and the US to help with the earthquake relief efforts. Our plan is to crowd fund via a non-profit institution called Himalayan Children’s Fund (HCF). HCF raises funds for Venerable Khenchen Thrangu Rinpoche’s institutions in India and Nepal. Thrangu Rinpoche is a highly regarded Buddhist monk and teacher who has dedicated his life to preserving and protecting the teachings of the Buddha and the Himalayan Buddhist way of life. He has established institutions all around the globe that serve his intentions. He also established a private non-profit school, Shree Mangal Dvip (SMD), in Kathmandu in 1987, for the Himalayan children who are deprived of modern education, healthcare facilities, and healthy environments to grow in. I finished grade ten at SMD in 2012. I had the privilege of serving the school for a year and half, working in the director’s office.

HCF’s mission:

“The Himalayan Children's Fund is a way for people around the world, and the west in particular, to connect with the lives of people in the Himalayan Region of Nepal, India and Tibet. HCF provides support for Thrangu Rinpoche's many compassionate activities such as schools, monasteries and clinics. By providing support for education, food, clothing, medicine and other needs we hope to equip the children and adults with the tools necessary for life enhancement while helping to preserve the culture of the people which is primarily of Tibetan and Buddhist heritage.”

Our plan is to work closely with some of our friends at SMD, and the monks from the Thrangu monastery in Kathmandu, whom I know very well. They have been tirelessly working to raise funds and get supplies transported to their villages, and they need immense support in order to keep on helping the victims. We have targeted the area of Nubri in Nepal, because it’s one of the hardest-hit areas, one of the most remote, and also one of the poorest.  It has mostly been overlooked by relief efforts to this point.

Here are some of the problems we have seen so far in the Nubri area, and our proposed solutions.

Problem #1: HOUSING

Most people saw their houses knocked down to the ground, and they have nowhere else to shelter themselves and their family members. It is one of the major problems, especially during this time of the year in Nepal. It’s monsoon season in Nepal, and the situation is getting worse in the remote village areas, such as Nubri. Tulku Damcho, a Buddhist monk from that region, writes, “The monsoon is the major problem at the moment. There are many people who don’t have anywhere to sleep.” Nepali friend Dorje Tsering reports: “The rain pours in through the tarps where we’re building right now, since it’s uncovered from the sides. We want the villagers to have good, stable tents that can survive the monsoon season.”

Solution: HCF is providing tents/tarps and mats to shelter those homeless families on a short-term basis, so that the villagers have a sense of belonging somewhere. The monks and students delivering supplies want to provide tarps/tents that can survive through the monsoon season. “We just want to make sure everyone is healthy and safe,” says Dorje Tsering.

On the long-term basis, the ground team is starting to rebuild the community by reconstructing health posts, schools and other community buildings that would provide basic infrastructure and needs for the villagers. Tulku Damcho says, “We want somewhere to store the supplies we have, and somewhere to base our project.”

Problem #2: HEALTH CARE

Many people are injured, and the earthquake destroyed all the health posts in Nubri region. Dorje states that it takes several days to get medications and healthcare facilities to the villages in the mountains.

Solution:The team plans to carry in more medical supplies to the villages that have been affected by the quake. Their strategy is to try treating all minor injuries that can be treated with basic medical supplies, so that most earthquake victims in the area won’t need to get to Kathmandu for treatment.

Problem #3: FOOD

Team member Tsewang Gyurme, who finished grade ten from SMD, reported that the people in his village have limited access of food supplies, and it worsens day by day. Most of the people in these regions depend on farming the land for their livelihood. Gyurme stated that all stored food supplies have been buried under the rubble.

Solution: The team plans to provide food packages to the villages - which will include rice, dal (lentil) and dry food such as noodles, biscuits, and bars. The team also plans to bring the villagers together to plant vegetables and fruits, and for this we would also need to buy some seeds.

Problem #4: TRANSPORTATION

Lack of transportation is one of the major problems in the region. The harsh geography of the region makes effective roads impossible to build. Aid supplies have to be carried in by the villagers/porters, and that takes a few days. The monsoon season is adding fuel to the fire by making the only routes to the region impossible to hike in. Dorje writes, “Nubri remains cut off from road access and from any form of communication.” The ground team has to wait to take tents and more relief supplies to these villages until the muddy routes open.

Solution: According to the team on the ground, taking helicopters to the region is the most effective way to bring in the aid supplies, and this won’t be possible without funds to cover the transportation costs.

Who are we?

Tashi Bista is a Nepali student from Mustang, studying at Phillips Exeter Academy in Exeter, NH, USA.  He is the coordinator between the fundraising team in the US, and the team on the ground in Nepal.

Tulku Damcho is a Buddhist monk and teacher from Nubri, Nepal.  He is a highly trained and accomplished tulku, or recognized reincarnation of a previous Buddhist master.  He oversees many of Thrangu Rinpoche’s projects, and he will be the director of our on-the-ground team.

Tashi Wangchuk is a Buddhist monk from Bhutan who lives in Lumbini, Nepal. He completed the traditional 3-year retreat in the Tibetan Buddhist tradition and served as principal of SMD Branch School for monks in Namo Buddha, Nepal. He has been tirelessly active in helping to provide relief since the earthquake struck on April 25.

Amy Schwartz is a history teacher at Phillips Exeter Academy in Exeter, NH, USA. Her connection to Nepal comes through her study and practice of Tibetan Buddhism under the guidance of her teacher, Venerable Thrangu Rinpoche.

Lhakpa Tsewang Lama is a “senior” student at SMD, who is from Lhi village, one the many villages affected by the quake. He finished grade ten at SMD in 2012, and is currently serving the school as a teacher, teaching Computer Science. Lhakpa is one of our main liaisons in Nepal and a close collaborator on this project. He will send us updates, photos, information, and specific reports of progress as the relief project progresses.

Raghav Bhat is a junior at Phillips Exeter Academy. Although Raghav grew up in rural New England, he has lived in Chennai for a couple years. With his interest and involvement in Hinduism and Buddhist meditation, he has become close to many Nepali people. Being the host brother of Tashi Bista while Tashi studies in the US, he has been able to learn about Nepal and the devastating effects of the earthquake.

Dorje Tsering is also from Lhi village. He works as the manager of a non-profit organization called Hope Alliance, which is based in Australia. Hope Alliance has been helping to provide education to the children in Lhi village.

Melody Nguyen is an eleventh grader studying in Phillips Exeter Academy from Vietnam. Although she has never been to Nepal herself, she feels strongly that such a humanitarian disaster deserves attention and sympathy. She hopes that this initiative will gather support from the Exeter community and from all the people around the globe.

Sachin Holdheim is a student of Indian and German descent at Phillips Exeter Academy in the US. His experience living in New Delhi, India with his family and at the Academy with roommate Tashi Bista has helped him to understand the plight of Nepal, and hopes to gather support and recognition for this disaster in his local community.

Byron Valenzuela is a senior at Phillips Exeter Academy. He has never been to Nepal, but his friendship with Tashi Bista has given him a glimpse of Nepalese culture, and this friendship has also served as a bridge to the unfortunate suffering that the people of Nepal are experiencing.

Tsewang Gyurme is also a senior at SMD School in Kathmandu. He finished grade ten and has dedicated his recent time to serving SMD School. He will be starting the IB program at ICZ school in Zurich this fall. Tsewang is one the active members on this project.

Dolma Sherpa is from Sindhupalchowk, one of the hardest-hit regions, that lies in the north of Nepal. She recently finished three year course of paramedics (General Medicine) from Nepal Institute of Medical Science and Technology in Kathmandu. She has been actively participating in earthquake relief campaigns that aim to provide healthcare to the people in her village, and in Kathmandu.

Josh Desmond is a student at Phillips Exeter, who lives in Boxford, Massachusetts. He is a great friend of Tashi, and is looking to help contribute in any way he can. He has experience working with film and video editing, and will work to raise awareness online.

Jennifer Shang is an upper at Phillips Exeter Academy from Jakarta, Indonesia. She writes, “I think what happened in Nepal is a terrible tragedy. And we as people, even if we are not from Nepal or the surrounding countries, we have to come together to do whatever we can to help.”

story:
Krátké shrnutí

Dobrý den, přátelé!

Jmenuji se Filip Šuster, spravuji kanál YouTube.com/FipaLive2 a obracím se na Vás s prosbou o podporu překladů přednášek Nassima Harameina.

V současnosti jsem přeložil přednášku z roku 2010 z konference La Caja De Pandora a přednášku z roku 2015 z Conscious Life Expo. Proč tedy žádám o podporu, když je překlad dokončený? Zpětné financování je důležité proto, že umožňuje vybrat prostředky na nákup nových videí, které je pak možné přeložit a sdílet (tak tomu bylo např. u přednášky z roku 2015), dále je podpoříte činnost oficiálního FB Nassima Harameina pro ČR a SK a další překlady.

Informace by měly být volně dostupné všem.

Pokud nemáte účet PayPal, ale přesto chcete překlad podpořit, můžete také Váš příspěvek zaslat na č. účtu 224035421/0300, Měna: CZK, IBAN: CZ56 0300 0000 0002 2403 5421, BIC (SWIFT): CEKOCZPP.

Projekt v číslech

Překlad Nassim Haramein 2010

  • Délka videa celkem: 473 minut
  • Odhadovaná doba překladu: > 50 hodin
  • Počet normostran čistého textu: 129
  • Počet znaků vč. mezer: 233 205
  • Hodnota překladu: 2 322 €

Překlad Nassim Haramein 2015

  • Délka videa celkem: 96 minut
  • Odhadovaná doba překladu: > 10 hodin
  • Počet normostran čistého textu: 31
  • Počet znaků vč. mezer: 55 705
  • Hodnota překladu: 558 €
  • Cena zakoupení přednášky: 45 $

Co potřebuji & Co nabízím

Co potřebuji:

  • Úhradu základních nákladů spojených s překladem.
Co nabízím:
  • Překlad všech 6 dílů přednášky.
  • Překlad bonusového dvouhodinového dílu Otázek & Odpovědí.
  • Překlad další tvorby Nassima Harameina.
Dosavadní přispěvatelé mimo kampaň:
  • 500 CZK Iveta a Libor Kubenovi
  • 1500 CZK Anonym
  • 807 CZK Anononym
  • 1345 CZK Janka Fabová 

Pokud by se podařilo společnými silami vybrat více prostředků, než očekávám, budu v překladech dále pokračovat a nasdílím s Vámi následující (v tomto pořadí):

  1. Přednášku Nassima Harameina z února 2015 (The Conscious Life Expo).
  2. The Connected Universe (Film Nassima Harameina, který vyjde v roce 2015)
  3. Překlad Nassimova patentu zařízení a metody pro simulaci magnetohydrodynamiky.
  4. Překlad Nassimova patentu krystalu do výše uvedeného zařízení.
  5. Další.

Rizika & Výzvy

Rizika neexistují žádná, protože překlad hlavního projektu je dokončen.


Děkuji Vám všem za podporu!

Filip Šuster
story_txt:
Krátké shrnutí Dobrý den, přátelé!
Jmenuji se Filip Šuster, spravuji kanál YouTube.com/FipaLive2 a obracím se na Vás s prosbou o podporu překladů přednášek Nassima Harameina.
V současnosti jsem přeložil přednášku z roku 2010 z konference La Caja De Pandora a přednášku z roku 2015 z Conscious Life Expo. Proč tedy žádám o podporu, když je překlad dokončený? Zpětné financování je důležité proto, že umožňuje vybrat prostředky na nákup nových videí, které je pak možné přeložit a sdílet (tak tomu bylo např. u přednášky z roku 2015), dále je podpoříte činnost oficiálního FB Nassima Harameina pro ČR a SK a další překlady.
Informace by měly být volně dostupné všem.
Pokud nemáte účet PayPal, ale přesto chcete překlad podpořit, můžete také Váš příspěvek zaslat na č. účtu 224035421/0300, Měna: CZK, IBAN: CZ56 0300 0000 0002 2403 5421, BIC (SWIFT): CEKOCZPP.

Co potřebuji & Co nabízím Co potřebuji:
Úhradu základních nákladů spojených s překladem.
Co nabízím:
 Překlad všech 6 dílů přednášky.
Překlad bonusového dvouhodinového dílu Otázek & Odpovědí. 
Překlad další tvorby Nassima Harameina.
 
Dosavadní přispěvatelé mimo kampaň:

500 CZK Iveta a Libor Kubenovi
1500 CZK Anonym
807 CZK Anononym
1345 CZK Janka Fabová 


Pokud by se podařilo společnými silami vybrat více prostředků, než očekávám, budu v překladech dále pokračovat a nasdílím s Vámi následující (v tomto pořadí):

Přednášku Nassima Harameina z února 2015 (The Conscious Life Expo).
The Connected Universe (Film Nassima Harameina, který vyjde v roce 2015)

Překlad Nassimova patentu krystalu do výše uvedeného zařízení.

story:
WORKING WITH DESERVING STUDENTS

 I want to keep educating students as I did the last sixteen years. Now, with your help I want to launch an International Exams Preparation Center. 

(TOEFL,SAT,GRE,GMAT,USMLE and other)

(View Budget below)


Several thousands of poorly prepared students passed through our EducationUSA office and received training and preparation. Most of them approved the TOEFL and SAT exams; many got scholarships to United States Universities. Besides working on academics and college applications and exams, they also experienced American Culture.

Now that my office is closed, and I in much need of your help to open it again.

My name is Rosmery Romero and I am of Bolivian nationality.  I had the chance to go to the United States to finish high school and do my undergraduate studies.  I managed to graduate from  Medaille College with and B.S. in Human Services. When I first  went to the United States my English knowledge was very deficient.  However, after a year of being there, I graduated from high school with honors.  While in college, I was on  the Deans List each consecutive year, belonged to many associations, was a member of Who is Who among Students from American Colleges and Universities, and  I managed to graduate as a Suma Cum Laude student. 

                                     

                                               (You can view original at Gallery)

Later, upon returning to Bolivia, I started working for Foster Parents International where I was in charge of the Donor Services Department and also worked as a community service specialist.  

I started working at the Centro Boliviano-Americano, Bolivian American Binational Center. After fifteen years of working as an English language teacher, teacher-counselor, and supervisor, I was assigned to work as an EducationUSA advisor. 

 At that time, advising was only an interesting concept. Information about studying in the United States was given once a week from 15:00 to 17:00 from a corner of a conference room.

I  had been working as an EducationUSA Adviser for the past sixteen years, since 1999. 

During the time I worked in EducationUSA,  I have done so much to make the department expand.

I have improved the attention to the public and sold the idea of going to study and taking advantage of the excellent university education available in the U.S.A.  

 I have also been working very hard on building in the students an  awareness of the importance of returning to Bolivia with newly gained knowledge in order  to  contribute to the development of Bolivia and to make this country a better place to live in; a goal every Bolivian has the duty to fight for.

I became a Senior Adviser in an extremely busy office. It was a hive of activity with many satisfied and interested people looking for information and services. 


Unfortunately, Education USA closed due to a radical and abrupt change in the administration of the Bi-national Center that was taken over by a leftisy Labor Union that did not believe that Education in the USA was good .

When closing the office, the expectations of thousands Bolivian students ended up in suspense.  I feel confident that with much effort, time and the necessary resources, I will help these individuals to fulfill their expectations. 

It is my intention to continue doing what I had stopped doing a couple of months ago.  I feel there is much to give through my work.


                                                               

"An investment in knowledge pays the best interest."
(Benjamin Franklin)

I also want to learn good English!

 Many people will benefit from a better education that will  not only change their lives, but that will also contribute to the development of the country and the continent. 

Since I am no longer under the umbrella of the binational center and its limitations, I am confident that I will be able to reach the community on a larger scale.  To achieve my goals and objectives,  it would be of utmost importance to open an office and a couple of spaces in order to continue the advising work and even go beyond that.   This project is valid and reachable.  This job will enable more than 15,000 students per year to receive better training and formation that will make them perfect fits and recipients of financial aid from many universities in the United States.   The students that for any reasons decide to remain in the country will have necessary tools to become assets in their local universities and make a difference in their communities. 

It is my goal to make a difference in young Bolivian students so that they are more committed to the development of our country, thus changing Bolivia into a better place to live. 

We want  to call your attention to show how a small effort from you, how a small donation, can render unsuspected results and effects of the focused population of Bolivian outstanding young adults. These students have high expectations to develop their abilities.

The Bolivian government has recently implemented the Sovereignty Scholarships. Many young academically outstanding and deprived individuals were sent to study in foreign countries, at graduate and undergraduate level. 

They went to universities from England, Japan, China, Cuba, Spain, Switzerland, Germany, Belgium, to name a few countries.

    Only very few of them applied to the United States because of lack of knowledge of application deadlines and requirements.

This program will not only focus on teaching  English and preparing young adults to obtain decent TOEFL and SAT scores.  It will also provide them with  life tools that would enable them  to re-evaluate their goals and objectives, to:

•    Expand their horizons and set their goals.

•    Contribute to developing their necessary skills to complete high school and pursue a university degree.

•    Help their decision making to choose the right field of study.

•    Contribute to the development of their personal, social, and academic skills to face school and university challenges.

•    Facilitate access to higher education in a supportive cultural environment, enhancing their preparation for college/university entrance, either locally or in the United States. 

•    Encourage future generations to pursue higher education.

•    Motivate students to identify and use their talent and potential.

•    Provide positive professional role models.

•    Establish community networks so that students support one another.

•    Identify problems that could interfere with the achievement of their goals.

•    Monitor students’ progress.

A small action from a willing individual or institution, together with creativity, and good, proactive management, is causing positive effects in a excluded population. It all depends on the will, honesty, and on a strong drive to get positive outcomes.  It will make the earth a better place to live and will contribute to forming young responsible and prepared individuals who will be the solution to a  country that is somewhat politically and economically corrupted. 

The financial aid that I am asking for will be nothing compared to the magnitude of the results.  It is  my intention to  work in such an efficient, creative way that the same project  can replicate in other states and communities

It is my intention to open a four-room office that will offer enough space for video conferences, preparation for exams, training, university searches, pre-departure orientation,  advice on visas and other services.  This dream place will have a few computer stations and four desks, one for me, and the other three for colleagues and aids.

story:
Bringing the heat...

Mission Without Borders has been helping the poorest people of Eastern Europe for over 55 years. We sponsor 30,000 children and families, provide assistance to over 150,000 elderly and offer a wide range of programs designed to help people mired in poverty and without hope to become self-sufficient. Over 90 cents of every dollar we receive goes to programs to help the needy.

For over 15 years MWB has run the Sarny Vocational Institute in war torn Ukraine. The school provides a free education for young persons too poor to get more than a few years of high school providing few, if any, employable skills. Sarny enables students to earn state certified certificates in a variety of vocational areas. With this certificate these kids are assured of having the skills they need to get good jobs, restore hope in their lives and earn a secure future.

But now with all the problems in Ukraine, the Institute is faced with an uncertain future. Not only are their utility costs being increased a staggering 6 times this fall but the boiler they are so dependent on has broken down and is not fixable. Winters are harsh in Ukraine and without a boiler, the school will have to close. This would be a huge disaster. 

We need to replace that boiler to make sure the Institute continues to offer hope and a future for many. But there is no money in the budget to do that.

Over the years, several thousand students have earned certificates and gone on to lives with hope and prosperity such as they had never known. Despair, suicides, hunger, homelessness and many other terrible realities are no longer a part of their daily lives. Sarny is a good news story. But if we have to close Sarny, then all those children waiting for their chance at a future will no longer have that chance. They will be sent back to their lives of poverty and hopelessness. The good news will become bad.

By offering your support you aren't just sending a few dollars for a cause you are making a life changing future possible for a young person.

For a few dollars you are giving a child their future

We are asking for $10,000 which will allow us to replace the broken oil burning boiler with one that will burn wood and peat. That will dramatically lower monthly operating costs as well as being more environmentally friendly.

Most importantly, it will mean the school stays open, giving hope and opportunity to thousands more children in the years ahead.

If we are fortunate enough to receive funding above our goal we would direct that money to where it is most needed. For example we could upgrade the free dental clinic and food services programs at the school. We supply these programs not only to the students but also to elderly in need. We also would be able to provide more in the way of school supplies and course materials. 

Giving more than a chance....

The Sarny Institute is not just a school. It's the path to prosperity for children who all their lives have lived in grinding hopeless poverty and despair. I've been there and seen for myself the homes some of these kids live in. They are shacks we wouldn't shelter our animals in. Hunger is a constant companion, for these kids there is just no future without the skills they can acquire at Sarny.

Mission Without Borders has been graduating students from the Sarny School for fifteen years. We have enabled thousands of young people to, simply put, have a life. A life of hope, prosperity, dignity and self-sufficiency. We just can't lose that all because of an old broken down boiler.

Can we do this?

Recently there was a state certification of the courses we teach which our institution has to undergo every ten years according to Ukrainian legislation. As part of the process the students had to defend their final diploma projects before the certifying board. Testifying to the quality of the education provided by the Sarny School 100% of our students were successful. As a result, our school renewed its state certification. This means that the Sarny Vocational/Educational Center is approved to continue its work. Our future students will also be able to acquire a state-approved diploma that gives them the skills needed for quality, well-paying jobs. 

We have the staff, we have the expertise, the building, the facility, the knowledge and the determination to be there for these young people. Join us in making sure their future still has promise and hope.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can we please ask that you help us get our campaign out to as many people as possible? 

Send emails to all your contacts with a link to us at http://igg.me/at/SavingSarny/x/80331, tell your family, friends, church and work colleageus and neighbors about us. Talk about us on Facebook, Twitter, on your Blogs and wherever else you mingle in social media. Feel free to use Indiegogo share tools located in the toolbar next to the image at the top of this page.

Thank you for coming to our campaign and thank you for whatever kind of support you extend to save the Sarny School and the future of literally thousands of future students. This is a very big deal.

story:
Visit our Website for more details at www.mothermiracle.com

On February 22, 2015, I had the vision of a new and beautiful school with lots of children enthusiastically studying in the classrooms.  Some were playing volleyball in the central courtyard of the school, while others were eating lunch in the large dining hall.  I saw in my vision the kindergarten students were playing with dolls and cars in the play room.

I picked up the phone and called the contractor to tear down the aging, original ground-level classrooms, which were unsafe due to damage by years of flooding, and started to build a 20,000 square foot, 3-story structure, elevated four feet from the ground to be above the flood level.


I started the construction of a new school building without the necessary funds in hand but with tremendous faith in our friends and supporters around the world, who I knew would help us to complete this project. Many of my friends, family, and local people told me that I was crazy, but I believed that with the help of sponsors and donors like yourself I could finish this project within two years. My vision was so strong that the contractor believed that I could come up with the funds and decided to proceed with me on the project.

The massive three-story structure will be completed by the end of December, and when I walk through the nearly-complete building, I cannot believe how all this happened so fast! Many people around the world sent us generous donations, some as little as $10, but with many such contributions from hundreds of people it has all came together.  I have been able to pay the contractor for his work so far.

Construction is still going on, and there is still lots of finishing work ahead, but the school does not have sufficient funds to complete the construction of the building. I now have four months to come up with $70,000 to pay the contractor for completing the first phase of the construction:  14 classrooms, 3 science laboratories, 12 bathrooms, dining hall, kitchen, library, 3 staff rooms, principal's office, 2 guard rooms, art and music room, storage room for uniforms, 3 school supply storage rooms, and a room full of toys for primary school kids.  Mother Miracle needs your help so that we can complete the construction and start finishing the classrooms in time for the 2016-2017 school year.

To show our appreciation for your generous donations, the school will honor major contributors with permanent plaques in the school. For sponsorship of an entire classroom ($29,000 or above), we will place a plaque with the name of donor in that classroom.  For donors who contribute approximately 1/3 of a single classroom construction ($10,000 and above) we will make groupings of three sponsors per classroom and will display the names of those sponsors on a permanent plaque in the classroom.  For all major donors, we will send photos and the video of the opening ceremony with students and teacher of their sponsored classroom.

All donations of every size are deeply appreciated.  It is by working together with many people throughout the world that we have managed to come so far.  Donations as small as $10 or $50 are as meaningful as $500 or $5,000.  If you believe in our mission, please give whatever you can and know that we will put your generous contribution to the best possible use.

For the past thirteen years, Mother Miracle Community Development Programs has striven to improve the lives of the people in Shisham Jhari, Rishikesh. With your donation toward our construction, you will give these deserving and intelligent but poor children a chance to help themselves. Give Mother Miracle a legacy that can continue into future generations. When our building is complete and we reach full capacity, we will be able to provide a world-class education to 420 deserving students per year. Please give whatever you can to help make the world a better place. Please share this email with your friends and colleagues.

story:
Jade has been singing  since before she could read karaoke and has formally taken vocal lessons since she was 9. 

She is part of the Pacoima Singers - http://pacoimasingers.com/ Musical Theatre Group from the Pacoima Middle School Television, Theater and Performing Arts Magnet.  This is her last year and the whole group of 38 students are going to Washington DC for four days to participate in The America Sings Festival - http://americasings.org/ as the representatives for Southern California.  They will have an opportunity to meet with students from all over the country.

The trip will cost  about $4,000 for the student and their chaperone (parent).  She has been working very hard with choreography, singing and is excited to be a part of this wonderful once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.

She would really appreciate any donations no matter how small.  All donations are tax deductible and the school tax ID# is 95-6005470 Pacoima Middle School 99919 Laurel Canyon Blvd. Pacoima, CA 91331.

Thank you for your support!!!!

story:
Hello there, 

My name is Gavrielle Thompson. I just graduated high school at Sacred Heart Cathedral and I'm headed off to Lewis and Clark College in the fall thanks to a generous financial aid package and help from Students Rising Above. 

But before I continue my education at a beautiful liberal arts college in Portland, Oregon I have a thrilling and  adventurous summer planned.

It all started in 2011 when I went on a 12 day Youth LEAD course with Environmental Traveling Companions. I never knew that sleeping under the stars, getting close to a group of complete strangers, and immersing myself in nature is all that it took to help me find myself. From that day I've been Involved with ETC. I've climbed the leadership ladder by being involved in the youth fellowship program for 2 years and this past summer I was a youth instructor for 2 courses- an 18-day All Young Women's Course and 12-day All Abilities Course. They were both incredible opportunities for me to put my new outdoor leadership skills into action and to be a role model for other youth from undeserved backgrounds. 



Through ETC I was chosen to be a recipient of a Scholarship from Daniel Fox's W.I.L.D Image project. This amazing scholarship which will allow me to attend the National Outdoor Leadership School (NOLS) Alaska Southeast Sea Kayaking Course. I will be kayaking in the Tongass National Forest. For 28 days I will be paddling along Mitof, Kupreanof, and Kuiu Islands surrounded by whales, sea lions, seals and sea otters. But I can't start my adventure just yet, I need your help to make it happen!

I need $750 for a round trip plane ticket to Alaska. It would mean the world if you could help by contributing.  Not only will I be a total "wild woman" when I return, but I will come back with so many invaluable skills to help me become a better outdoor leader and wiser environmental steward. I plan on using these skills to continue to expose underprivileged youth to the great outdoors and to create a stronger bond with mother nature. 

I want to thank all of you from the bottom of my heart. I hope our paths cross in the future so I can share with you my adventures in Alaska. Maybe it will inspire you to take a trip to the outdoors or become a better steward of the earth. Even if you can't contribute, I'm grateful that you took the time to read this and hopefully you'll pass it along. 

I hope you all have a wonderful summer! Thanks again!

Yours truly,

Gavi Thompson

P.S. PLEASE INDICATE IF YOU WANT YOUR SPONSORSHIP TO GO TO JUST ME OR TO BOTH OF US

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My name is Kedyn Sierra, a current junior Film Student at the Ruth Asawa San Francisco School of The Arts, and Photographer for DPR Construction Inc.

I was raised in the dense forest of the Yucatan Penninsula, Oxkutzcab, where things literally come alive in the night. I was surrounded by amazing wildlife and domestic pets to the point where they became family. I grew to love animals.

My parents sought out for a better life for our family. At the age of 7 they brought me to San Francisco to fulfill their dreams for me. Here I struggled to learn the language and felt like I couldn't trust many people.



I became isolated, and my parents knew I had to be reintroduced to the outdoors to feel at home and alive again. This is something my parents couldn't financially do.

We applied to the  Seven Tepees Youth Program my sixth grade year - after having learned that they take people camping. I was accepted and that program took me and all the students involved on a week long camping trip to Lassen Volcanic National Park during the summer, a place I never thought I would visit. Then my Freshman year in high school, I was connected to Environmental Traveling Companions (ETC).

I participated on a 24-day Sea-To-Source Youth LEAD expedition with ETC. As I went sea kayaking, backpacking, and whitewater rafting I felt like I was at home. These were activities I would never experience without the help and support of the ETC community and friends. 

I was so impacted by that summer trip, I decided to apply to become an ETC Youth LEAD Fellow and help lead kayaking and climbing trips for other groups of undeserved youth. I was accepted and have served in the Fellowship program for the past two years. It has been amazing and I've become a better outdoorsman, and a better leader.

This July I will be starting the next frontier in my leadership development. 

I will be going to Southeast Alaska to take part in a 30-day NOLS sea kayak expedition thanks to a scholarship from Daniel Fox, Founder of The Wild Image Project

This trip will help strengthen my connection with the nature through kayaking in the wilderness of the Tongass Islands. I will be able to use the skills I learn from this NOLS trip to lead my peers and to apply them to my future career and life goals.

The last hurdle is to fundraise $750 for my flight  to Alaska. If I am able to reach this goal I can start counting down the days until my departure.

Please help by contributing whatever amount you can afford because any amount will help Gavi and me closer to our joint $1500 goal. This is a one-time opportunity of a lifetime for me! I am thrilled to share my experience with you all through my photography when I return from my wild adventure. Thank you again.

Kind Regards,

Kedyn

P.S. PLEASE INDICATE IF YOU WANT YOUR SPONSORSHIP TO GO TO JUST ME OR TO BOTH GAVI AND ME.

story:
A devastating 7.8 magnitude earthquake hit our country. And we need your help to build transitional shelters to the families directly affected by the earthquake. You donations will go DIRECTLY to the earthquake victims. 

  • Hi, My name is Jay Poudyal and I am a wanderlust, traveller and a storyteller. For the last two years I have been traveling to villages in Nepal and sharing stories of an everyday common Nepali through my blog called Stories of Nepal. www.storiesofnepal.com & www.facebook.com/StoriesNepal. The Facebook page is a community of 120K+ followers.
  • 45 minutes after the earthquake struck I started walking with my camera and documenting the plight of the victims through their personal stories, experiences of the earthquake, their losses and fears along with the destruction the earthquake had caused and sharing it through the blog. On the 3rd day I started a fundraising campaign through which we carried food and tarps to 5 highly affected districts for over 200 families. (Kavre, Sindhupalchok, Dhadhing, Rasuwa & Nuwakot) and built 50 transitional shelters for 50 families in Sindhupalchok. 
  • With the Monsoon fast approaching the families are more vulnerable to landslides, the hostile weather and other diseases. You contributions will provide more families with transitional shelters to get by through this Monsoon before they start rebuilding their lives. 

What We Need

  • We need to collect USD 10000 dollars. The generated funds will go towards building transitional shelters to families directly affected by the earthquake. The updates of where the funds are going will be provided through the Stories of Nepal website (www.storiesofnepal.com) & the Facebook page (www.facebook.com/StoriesNepal).

The Impact

  • Without a roof over ones head, it becomes impossible to think about rebuilding one's lives when families are consumed by loss and sorrow. The fund will have a major impact in helping people get on their feet to start rebuilding their lives and to come in terms with the reality and what must be done. With a roof over their head their attention then will be diverted towards their lives and how to make a living now that they will not have to worry about where to seek shelter. 

  • Other Ways You Can Help

  • I request everyone to help us get the word out by sharing the Fundraising with your friends and family.

Thank You.

story:
Don't see it as a handout or charity. See it as an investment into someone's future, giving them the tools they need to create a better future for themselves. Help plant the seed for someone in need.   

Poverty, prejudice, and suffering are all things that impact the quality of life for many people in our country’s most impoverished areas.  Many people give up hope, get stuck in a rut, or lose themselves to negativity and leave their families in need of assistance; sometimes for generations.  The Designed Future programs have been uncovering the underlying issues and helping people take charge of their lives since 2012. 

Help People in The Poorest Communities Survive and Thrive 

We're launching our neighborhood initiative to transform the poorest communities throughout Michigan. This is where you come in. The poorest communities in Michigan are counting on us, and we are counting on you. Designed Future cannot create the large-scale change we wish to accomplish without funds. Your donation provides immediate resources that help the most vulnerable individuals rebuild a life. Your investment will touch the lives of thousands of individuals and families struggling to overcome multi-generational cycles of disenfranchisement and poverty.

The funding required for our Neighborhood Initiative is $25,000. Your gift helps us lift people in the poorest communities out of poverty and build better futures. Neighborhoods are an important component of an economically viable urban city. Designed Future seeks to bring hope and empowerment to low-income residents in diversely populated and economically challenged neighborhoods throughout Michigan. Your funding will provide the resources they need to increase economic opportunity for their families and communities. 

Who We Are 

We are Designed Future. A fundamentally inclusive, just, and caring organization mobilized to alleviate suffering and break the cycles of poverty and marginalization. We have been improving the lives of those struggling with financial stressors, loss of employment, addiction, domestic violence, serious health issues, and strained family relationships through our innovative and life-changing programs. Now we are looking to expand our efforts to the poorest neighborhoods in Michigan starting December 1st. 

We believe that if you change your mind, you change your life. Those we serve create radical change from the inside out. They learn to take control of the mind and use it to build an entirely new future for themselves- a future that is inspiring, achievable, and most importantly, of their own design. Through daily training over 40 days, ineffective habits of thought are changed, and a completely new mindset emerges that enables them to powerfully move forward in life. Individuals become self-sufficient and productive members of society. 

How We Can Make This Happen

It is the people living within a community that makes the community. We believe that change begins when individuals take charge of their lives. Our services aim to improve all areas of life. During our Neighborhood Initiative, we intend to reduce the number of welfare recipients in the communities we're entering. Our goal is to have marginalized individuals become self-sufficient. We also will be measuring crime rate outcomes, as we believe the crime rate in these areas will decrease.

Our Neighborhood Initiative provides a 4-part series of solutions that empower local residents in economically challenged communities to create a designed life. For four consecutive weeks, a weekly five-hour session takes place at facilities within the impoverished neighborhoods. 

Invest in Our Neighborhood Initiative...

Please Donate Today. Give a gift and help us bring hope for a brighter future.

story:
* ABAJO EN CASTELLANO *

Hi, my name is Rakel and I am the author of this multi-format book for children called I'm always ok.

I'm Always Ok, Meditation, Yoga and other wellness tools for children is a very dear book to me. It came in suddenly, while taking a shower on a winter afternoon, so I rushed out and wrote it all down. I was ecstatic. About two months later I was diagnosed with breast cancer and I realized that the book was probably for me... at least for a while, as the journey unfolded. I'm at the other side of much of what's transpired in these crazy last two years, and it is now time to make this beautiful book available.

So, what's so special about this book and why support it?

Because...

THIS IS THE BOOK OF THE FUTURE  & you'll be the FIRST TO GET A COPY

1. In this book children are teachers to other children, inviting practices in a way that is relatable, fun, easy and full of support.

2. In being a multi-format project, it offers very real interaction, and I truly believe that's how books will soon be by definition. How?

  • Multilingual from inception: the book will be released in Spanish and English, quickly followed by Basque, French, Italian, Portuguese and German.
  • Multi-format: it will first be released as paperback and Kindle, and soon after as an audiobook containing not only the narration of the book itself, but also absolutely engaging and interactive practice tracks.
  • Coloring: the youngest ones will be able to continue to engage with it creatively.
  • Workbook: the book becomes a template for theatre plays, creative writing, and a structure for children to express what's going on with them in an articulate way under the guidance of educators and other caretakers.
  • Website: it will continue to grow in tools and resources.
3. It's just the first. I'm Always Ok is the opening title of Evolution Revolution Books, publishing company I intend to create under which to bring forth many more books of the future.

So, here we have a book that is multilingual, bi-continental, exists in the cloud, in your hands, in your senses, and invites your child to continue to co-create it with me.

What are these funds for?

(1) Pay for the work of my fantastic illustrator and graphic designer, Kanif Beruna.

(2) Record the audiobook, which I will do between Spain and New York.

(3) Pay for several translations I can't do myself.

(4) Cover all necessary legal expenses to protect the integrity of the work.

(5) Cover the costs of incorporating Evolution Revolution Books.

This is a GREAT book, I've no doubt about it, and it is going to get done. All funds will be dedicated to making that happen either very quickly, if the full amount can be raised, or in steps, as initial sales become the source for next phases.

And... it is just the beginning. I'm Always OK is only the first of a great deal more books to come (the next, about to enter story-board stage).

Why trust me?

I've produced festivals, organized tours, taught, translated, reported, published, performed, and walked an incredible journey of self-realization and self-love. I tell you, what you're supporting here you'll proud to be the first to recognize and get on board with.

If nothing else, I ask you to get the word out, re-post this campaign on social media, email your friends, show other parents at your kids' school, your local after-school program teachers, spread the word at yoga studios, meditation centers. A big part of the *Evolution Revolution* we all desire consists in having children remember that All Is Well in All Ways, and grow into heart-centered, self-aware human beings who consciously shine their own light. 

Two years ago I wished that, growing up, someone had told me that I'm always ok, I always have enough and there is nothing to fix. Today these truths are my great guides, and I'm happy to be able to offer them to your kids in a way they can relate to them.

                                                                       ~~~~~~

Hola, me llamo Rakel y soy la autora de este libro multimedia para niños titulado Siempre Estoy Bien.

Siempre Estoy Bien, Meditación, Yoga y otras herramientas de bienestar para niños es un libro que quiero mucho. Vino de repente, una tarde de invierno hace un par de años. Unos dos de meses después me diagnosticaron cáncer de pecho y me di cuenta de que quizás el libro era para mi... por lo menos por el momento. Estoy al otro lado de mucho de lo que se ha presentado desde entonces, y ahora es el momento de que este precioso libro esté disponible para todos.

¿Qué tiene este libro de especial y por qué te gustaría apoyarlo?

Porque...

ES EL LIBRO DEL FUTURO y serás el PRIMERO EN HACERTE CON UNA COPIA

1. En este libro los niños son profesores de otros niños, invitando prácticas de una manera fluída, divertida, fácil y llena de apoyo.

2. Al ser un proyecto multimedia, ofrece interacción real, y presiento que es así como serán pronto los libros, por definición. ¿Por qué?

  • Multilingüe: el libro será publicado en inglés y castellano, seguido en seguida de euskera, francés, italiano, portugués y alemán.
  • Multi-formato: será publicado primero en Kindle y papel, seguido de un audiobook que contendrá no solo la narración del libro en sí, sino también pistas de sonido super atractivas para que se puedan practicar las herramientas.
  • Libro de colorear: los más pequeños podrán seguir relacionándose con el libro de manera creativa.
  • Manual: el libro se convierte en plantilla para obras de teatro, escritura creativa, y estructura para que los más pequeños puedan expresar lo que les está pasando de una manera articulada con la ayuda de educadores, padres, y otros cuidadores.
  • Página Web: seguirá creciendo en cuanto a herramientas y recursos.

3. Es solo el primero. Siempre Estoy Bien es el título que inaugura Evolution Revolution Books, editorial con la que planeo publicar muchos más libros del futuro.

Así que aquí tenemos un libro que es multilingüe, bi-continental, que existe en la nube, en tus manos, en tus sentidos, e invita a tu hij@ a continuar creándolo conmigo.

¿Para qué son estos fondos?

(1) Pagar el trabajo de mi fantástico ilustrador y diseñador gráfico, Kanif Beruna.

(2) Grabar el audiobook, algo a realizar entre España y Nueva York.

(3) Pagar las traducciones que no puedo hacer yo.

(4) Cubrir todos los costes legales necesarios para proteger la integridad del trabajo.

(5) Cubrir los costes de incorporación Evolution Revolution Books.

Este es un GRAN libro, de eso no me cabe duda, y va a ser publicado. Todos los fondos serán destinados a que ocurra bien sea muy rápido, si la campaña alcanza su objetivo, o en fases, según las ventas iniciales cubren los costos de los siguientes pasos.

Y... es solo el principio. Siempre Estoy Bien no es más que el primero de una gran lista de libros (el siguiente está a punto de entrar en la fase del story-board).

¿Por qué confiar en mi?

He producido festivales, organizado tours, enseñado, traducido, informado, publicado, actuado, y caminado un increíble camino de amor y consciencia. Lo que estáis apoyando aquí, estaréis orgullosos de haber sido los primeros en reconocer y pujar.

Si nada más, os pido que mováis el proyecto, compartáis la campaña en medios sociales, escribáis a vuestros amigos, la mostréis a los padres de otros niños del colegio, los monitores y profes de actividades extra-escolares, corráis la voz en estudios de yoga, centros de meditación. Gran parte de la *Revolución de la Evolución* que deseamos todos consiste en ayudar a los más pequeños a recordar que Todo Está Siempre Bien, y convertirse en seres humanos conscientes de sí mismos, que viven desde el corazón y eligen brillar desde su luz propia.

Hace dos años deseé que, de niña, alguien me hubiera dicho que siempre estoy bien, siempre tengo suficiente y no hay nada que arreglar. Hoy estas verdades son mis grandes guías, y me hace feliz el poder ofrecerlas a vuestr@s niñ@s de manera que puedan integrarlas fácilmente.
story_txt:
* ABAJO EN CASTELLANO *Hi,
my name is Rakel and I am the author of this multi-format book for children
called I'm always ok.
I'm Always Ok, Meditation, Yoga and other wellness
tools for children is
a very dear book to me. It came in suddenly, while taking a shower on a winter
afternoon, so I rushed out and wrote it all down. I was ecstatic. About two
months later I was diagnosed with breast cancer and I realized that the book
was probably for me... at least for a while, as the journey unfolded. I'm at
the other side of much of what's transpired in these crazy last two years, and
it is now time to make this beautiful book available.
So, what's so special about
this book and why support it?

Because... THIS IS
THE BOOK OF THE FUTURE  & you'll be the FIRST TO GET A COPY 
1. In this
book children are teachers to other children, inviting practices in a
way that is relatable, fun, easy and full of support.
2. In
being a multi-format project, it offers very real interaction, and I truly believe that's how books will soon be
by definition. How?


Multilingual from inception: the
     book will be released in Spanish and English, quickly followed by Basque,
     French, Italian, Portuguese and German.

Multi-format: it will first be released
     as paperback and Kindle, and soon after as an audiobook containing not
     only the narration of the book itself, but also absolutely engaging and
     interactive practice tracks.

Coloring: the youngest ones will
     be able to continue to engage with it creatively.

Workbook: the book becomes a
     template for theatre plays, creative writing, and a structure for children
     to express what's going on with them in an articulate way under the
     guidance of educators and other caretakers.

Website: it will continue to grow
     in tools and resources.
3. It's just the first. I'm Always Ok is the opening title of Evolution Revolution Books, publishing company I intend to create under which to bring forth many more books of the future.

So, here we have a book that is multilingual, bi-continental, exists in the cloud, in your hands, in
your senses, and invites your child to continue to co-create it with me. 
What are these
funds for? 
(1) Pay
for the work of my fantastic illustrator and graphic designer, Kanif Beruna.
(2) Record the audiobook, which I will do between
Spain and New York. 
(3) Pay for
several translations I can't do myself.
(4) Cover
all necessary legal expenses to protect the integrity of the work.(5) Cover the costs of incorporating Evolution Revolution Books.
This is a GREAT book, I've no doubt about it, and it is going
to get done. All funds will be dedicated
to making that happen either very quickly, if the full amount can be raised, or
in steps, as initial sales become the source for next phases.
And... it is just the beginning. I'm Always OK is only the
first of a great deal more books to come (the next, about to enter story-board
stage). 
Why trust me?
I've produced festivals, organized tours, taught,
translated, reported, published, performed, and walked an incredible journey of
self-realization and self-love. I tell you, what you're supporting here you'll proud to be
the first to recognize and get on board with. 
If nothing else, I
ask you to get the word out, re-post this campaign on social media, email your friends, show other parents at your kids'
school, your local after-school program teachers, spread the word at yoga studios,
meditation centers. A big part of the *Evolution Revolution* we all desire consists in having children remember that All Is Well
in All Ways, and grow into heart-centered, self-aware human beings who consciously shine
their own light.  
Two years ago I
wished that, growing up, someone had told me that I'm always ok, I always have
enough and there is nothing to fix. Today these truths are my great guides, and
I'm happy to be able to offer them to your kids in a way they can relate to
them.                                                                       ~~~~~~

story:
Please help us launch My Wings & the Giving Wings charity program, and help children soar!    

 

 

My Wings are a new style of children’s shirts that actually have wings. These wings are artistically designed with original art that creatively depict the wings of butterflies, dragons, and fairies. My Wings creative playfulness can fuel a child's learning and development. These uniquely playful shirts nurture every child's inclination for fantasy and curiosity. Each shirt also includes an activity booklet that playfully helps develop confidence, self-esteem, creative exploration...and to soar in life!

My Wings has teamed up with Shriner's Hospital for Children®-Northern California and Pay It Forward Sweden to create the Giving Wings charity program, which gives My Wings shirts to children with various types of special needs, to utilize in playful healing recovery. Many children have had their “wings clipped” through hardships in their early lives. This unique program will uplift these children...giving them their wings back!

We thank you for your generous contributions to help us launch My Wings and the Giving Wings program.      

Each My Wings purchase and Giving Wings program contribution through the Perks on the right includes the following:    

 

 

 

In this fund raising campaign you can take either or each of the following actions:

  •  Buy My Wings shirts for children you know.
  • Contribute to the Giving Wings program, explained below, and help children at Shriners Hospital for Children®-Northern California & through the Pay It Forward Sweden Foundation.
  •  Give a contribution to support this campaign without requiring a Perk in return.

To buy My Wings shirts, or to contribute to the Giving Wings program, or to contribute to this campaign without requiring a Perk in return, please select the appropriate Perk listed on the right.

 

 

                             "When I wear My Wings I feel like a happy butterfly."

                                                       — Aeralin Zen, 7 years young

 

My Wings are available in 3 sizes: 

  • US 2-4 Y (EUR 98/104)
  • US 4-6 Y (EUR 110/116)
  • US 6-8 Y (EUR 122/128) 

 

 

GIVING WINGS PHILANTHROPY

With your help, children around the world will receive the inspirational and imaginative My Wings shirts to use as playful instruments in recovery. By contributing to the Giving Wings program you can uplift a child and give them their wings back!

Please contribute now to help us launch My Wings!
 

                                                                                                                     

                                                 The Giving Wings Video

 

 

 

 

How It Works

 

 

Your generous contribution to My Wings, whether it’s $5 or $5,000, enables us to fund our first production run of My Wings shirts, produce the accompanying activity booklets, and deliver My Wings to children around the world.

I have self-funded thousands of dollars to get to this point, but now need help from others to take My Wings and the Giving Wings program to children around the world. I humbly and respectfully ask for your help to reach our goal and to uplift children and help them to soar in life. Thank you!

Please contribute now by selecting your desired Perk:

    • You can purchase one or multiple My Wings shirts for children you know by claiming the appropriate Perk.
    • You can also contribute at various levels to the Giving Wings program and help give My Wings to children in need using the Giving Wings Perks on the right.
    You are welcome to select and purchase multiple Perks; however, each Perk requires its own transaction. If you'd like to claim multiple Perks, please make a new contribution for each Perk.
     

    After the completion of the My Wings funding campaign, a questionnaire will be sent to contributors asking which style and what size shirts they desire, and to what address they want the shirts delivered. Contributors to the Giving Wings program will select in the questionnaire which organization they would like to support.

    Giving Wings contributions will fund the production and delivery of My Wings shirts to our growing list of partners in the Giving Wings program. Initially Shriners Hospital for Children® and Pay It Forward Sweden will gift the shirts to benefit the children they serve. 

    With your help we can expand the Giving Wings program to include other organizations around the world that support children in their right to a safe, healthy, and playful childhood.

    Please contribute now by selecting your desired “Perk” listed to the right.
     

    What’s Included

    My Wings are made of 100% organic and Fairtrade cotton, with digitally printed polyester chiffon wings and sleeves. They are produced by our Fairtrade manufacturers that certify compliance with specific environmental, labor, and developmental standards.

    Every My Wings shirt design is an original work of art. 

    The wings are stunningly beautiful designs that depict butterfly, dragon, and fairy wings. The printing is on the front side of the wing to give maximum color vibrancy to each wing design; the back side is not as bright as the front. 

     

     

    The Activity Booklet and My Wings Card

    Every My Wings shirt comes with an activity booklet and My Wings card that help develop confidence, self-esteem, and creative exploration. These activities are designed for adults and children to play with together, fostering quality bonding time.

     

     

     

    Activity Booklet and My Wings Cards available in English and Swedish

     

    How Funds Will Be Used

    We will fund our first production order, build an eCommerce web site for future orders, expand the Giving Wings program with additional supportive organizations and marketing, and launch our global online marketing campaign promoting My Wings and the Giving Wings program.

     

     

    Our First Giving Wings Children Support Organizations

    We are pleased to be partnering with:

    • The Shriners Hospital for Children® Northern California
    • Pay It Forward Foundation of Sweden

    We are currently developing relationships with other organizations that can help more children around the world.

     

     

     

    The My Wings Story

     

    BY THE FOUNDER OF MY WINGS

     

    My Wings began to take life in 2007, when I was a music teacher of young children, after graduating from U.C. Santa Cruz with a bachelor’s degree in community studies and minors in business management and social sciences, with a heavy focus on creative arts.

    It was my passion to awaken the children’s curiosity and musical gifts at such a young age. At one point during the classes we would dance with scarves that through their imagination became wings. I noticed that as they took flight they would all lighten up, their innate joy would kick in, and their playful confidence would allow them to stretch into new areas of development and learning. Especially moving for me was seeing the children with physical or emotional challenges opening up with greater confidence through playful flying. I believe that the wings reminded the children of the feeling of freedom that is already alive within them, and that their dreams are possible and within their reach. Just like the freedom the crawling caterpillar must feel as it becomes a butterfly.  

    I spent the next 6 years traveling and exploring community around the world. Though I saw many beautiful sights, I also saw a lot of children suffering. I felt a desire to do something to help these children. In a moment of inspiration I had a vision of beautiful shirts with wings for children to help them connect with their power and freedom within. This reminded me of  my early flying-with-scarves experiences during the children’s music classes. I looked to buy shirts with wings for the children, to remind them that they can grow, achieve their dreams, and soar in life. To my astonishment I could find no children’s shirts with wings like I envisioned. In addition to the winged shirts, the idea to include stories and activities were included to help strengthen the children’s “inner wings,” aiming to nurture empowering qualities to help children fly their highest and shine their brightest. 

    In early 2014 after moving to Sweden I won several contests for business start up support based on My Wings. I received  business development training and business mentorship, and it was finally time for My Wings to take flight. I gathered artists and designers and created the first My Wings designs, and made my initial prototypes. Children absolutely loved these creatively playful shirts and I believed they could help all children, the fortunate and the less fortunate as well. Thus was born the My Wings business model, which includes the Giving Wings program that gifts My Wings to children with special needs. 

    This Indiegogo campaign is my first request for money to help support the My Wings dream. I have self-funded thousands of dollars to get to this point, but now need help from others to take My Wings and the Giving Wings program to children around the world. I humbly and respectfully ask for your help to reach our goal and to uplift children and help them to soar in life. Thank you!

    Lee Giove

    Founder, Designer
    My Wings, Giving Wings

     

     

    How You Can Help

    Beside your generous contribution to My Wings and the Giving Wings program, you can help us spread the word. If our program and story inspire you, please tell your friends, colleagues, and organizations that know children that could use the gift of My Wings. You can use the Indiegogo share tools provided. Please contact us here if you have any ideas to help us grow into our vision. Thank you!

     

    FAQ

    Q: How can we get in touch with your team?

    A: We welcome you to visit our website www.My-Wings.com and if you have any questions regarding My Wings or our Indiegogo campaign, please contact us here. 

    Q: I'm having trouble claiming a Perk. Who should I reach out to?

    A: Email: support@indiegogo.com

    Q: How do I upgrade my perk?

    A: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526756

     

    Q: How can I make multiple Perk purchases or contributions?

    A: You are welcome to select and purchase multiple Perks; however, each Perk requires its own transaction. If you'd like to claim multiple Perks, please make a new contribution for each Perk.

    Q: How do I select the design and styles of shirts I want?

    A:  After the completion of the My Wings funding campaign, a questionnaire will be sent to you asking which style and what size shirt(s) you desire, and to what address you want them delivered.

    Q: How do I know which size to order?

    A:  After the completion of the funding campaign, a questionnaire will be sent out to gather order information. Included in this questionnaire will be a detailed size chart for your reference.

    Q: When will my shirts be delivered?

    A: My Wings shirts will be delivered in September 2016 or before.

    Q: What comes with each shirt?

    A: Each shirt comes with a My Wings card and Activity Booklet.

    Q: How do I choose the language option for the accompanying materials?

    A: After the campaign completion you will receive a questionnaire in which you will choose your preferred language.  

    Q: Can I give a contribution to support this campaign without requiring a Perk in return?

    A: Yes, absolutely. Simply click on the “Contribute Now” button located just above the column of listed perks. In the Perk field it will say, “No perk, I just want to contribute.” You enter your contribution amount and continue to payment.  Thank you for your support!

    Q: If I want a refund, how do I do this?

    A: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/213172367

     

    Q: Can I exchange/return my My Wings shirt?

    A:  Yes, contact us for more information. 

     

    Q: How do I select which organization will receive the My Wings shirts from my contribution:

    A: After the campaign completion, contributors to the Giving Wings program will receive a questionnaire and select which organization they would like to support.

    Q: How many shirts does my contribution to the Giving Wings program provide?

    A: The retail price for a My Wings shirt is $72. The My Wings company gives 1 shirt to a child through our partner organizations for every $27 donated.

    Q: Can I donate shirts to an organization of my choice or does it have to be the official Giving Wings partner organizations?

    A: Giving Wings contributions will be delivered through our partnering organizations. If you have suggestions or represent an organization that serves children with special needs and would like to partner in the Giving Wings program, please let us know by contacting us here.

    Q: How can I become a retail seller or how can I help get My Wings into a retail store near me?

    A: Please contact or refer to us here.
