story:
2016 Mago Work Book Projects: Build the Wheel for Self-Empowerment and Collaboration to Raise the Consciousness of WE in the Primordial Mother 

“The Mago Work is committed to the collective cultivation of the consciousness of WE in S/HE, the Great Goddess/Mago, through publication, self-education, and networking conducted by volunteers. In the process, we become whole in our body, mind, and spirit, regaining nature’s power of self-evolution in ourselves. We know deep down that the gynocentric force of Life is leading the Way. That is the Source of our love, creativity, and compassion." Helen Hye-Sook Hwang, Ph.D., Founding Director of The Mago Work

The Mago Work is a natural outgrowth of Dr. Helen Hye-Sook Hwang's life-long soul-seeking research on the Great Goddess, Mago. Since 2010, The Mago Work has grown steadily and expanded internationally. For example, our readership of the Return to Mago E-Magazine comes from as many as 150 countries around the world. The Facebook Group The Mago Circle has 1,181 members, and is growing steadily. The volume She Rises: Why Goddess Feminism, Activism and Spirituality? was published in 2015. Mago Academy continues to offer online classes and Mago Pilgrimage to Korea. In 2016 we are entering a critical time to actualize the potentiality of The Mago Work, while continuing to lay a solid foundation, i.e., to produce and distribute the following three books (all in three versions: color printed book, black/white printed book, and E-book). Mago Work volunteers toil to build the wheel in which people can nurture, heal, and empower the self, communities, and the eco-system, both alone and collectively.


Project 1

She Rises: How… Goddess Feminism, Activism, and Spirituality? Volume 2 

Co-editors: Helen Hye-Sook Hwang, Mary Ann Beavis, and Nicole Shaw

Planning Committee: Trista Hendren and Rosemary Mattingley

Forthcoming 2016 by Mago Books

The collective writing of She Rises Volume 2 calls for awakening, collaboration, and transformation of individuals, communities, and cultures by answering the question, "How (one lives out one's commitment to) Goddess Feminism, Activism, and Spirituality." See Call for Contributions here. Building on the predecessor anthology, She Rises: Why Goddess Feminism, Activism, and Spirituality (Volume 1) in which the answers of 92 well-known and new authors and artists were interwoven, She Rises Volume 2 anticipates opening another new horizon to nurture, heal, and bond contributors and readers in the consciousness of the Primordial Mother. Like She Rises Volume 1, we expect a larger number of creative minds/hearts/spirits from around the world to contribute as authors. It will be distributed to an international audience.


Project 2

Seasons of the Goddess: Solstices & Equinoxes

Co-editors: Helen Hye-Sook Hwang and Mary Ann Beavis

Forthcoming November 1, 2016 by Mago Books

This anthology project aims at a multi-faceted purpose for readers: educational, reconstructive, and practical. It intends to restore and celebrate the old indigenous ways of celebrating seasonal marks from around the world, while undercutting the entrenched dynamics of patriarchal seasonal customs. See Call for Contributions here. This is a timely work that will provide readers with new lenses for understanding the origins of patriarchal celebrations and how the latter have co-opted the old ways of Goddess cultures.  


Project 3

Mago Pilgrimage: Journey to the Primordial Home via Magoist Epic Narratives and Photo Essays (Volume 1)

Author: Helen Hye-Sook Hwang

Forthcoming 2016 by Mago Books

This book aims to introduce the long-forbidden epic of the Great Goddess, the Budoji (Epic of the Emblem City), which secretly survived throughout history and recently revived in modern Korea. Epitomized as "Return to the Origin of the Great Goddess/Mago," the Budoji, the principal text of Magoism, guides the reader to the primordial consciousness of the Creatrix through the story of the cosmogonic origin and the vicissitudes of the Mago Clan on planet Earth. Dr. Hwang's photo essays open the door to the ancient understanding of Mago Pilgrimage, as known and transmitted to pre-patriarchal Korean ancestors; the journey to ONESELF in which one encounters the Story of the Creatrix. See more info here.


What Co-Editors and the Planning Committee Do

Co-editors: Review and selection, copy-editing and proofreading, communication with contributors, solicitation of contributions, formatting (book-making), cover-designs, structuring book contents, making the list of Table of Contents, and writing Introductions and the list of Contributors

Planning Committee: Promotion, networking, writing Introductions

Publisher: Printing and shipping books in and from Korea to the U.S. and possibly elsewhere


Meet the Co-Editors and the Planning Committee

Helen Hye-Sook Hwang, Ph.D.     

My encounter with the Great Goddess known as Mago in East Asia during my graduate studies marked the point where my consciousness began to focus in the S/HE reality. Through my study of the Great Goddess, I was able to affirm my cultural/historical/spiritual/ontological identity as a Korean-born and bred feminist and discover the female principle of ultimate reality (the Creatrix). For the last sixteen years, I have researched, written, published, and advocated Magoism. Knowing of the Great Goddess is self-transcendental to me; it reaches out to the world/cosmos.

Helen Hye-Sook Hwang, Ph.D. is a scholar, activist, and advocate of Magoism, the anciently originated tradition that venerates Mago as the Great Goddess. She earned her MA and Ph.D. in Religion with emphasis on Feminist Studies from Claremont Graduate University, CA. She also studied toward an MA degree in East Asian Studies at UCLA, CA. Hwang has taught for universities in California and Missouri, U.S.A. Since 2012, Dr, Hwang has founded, directed, co-edited, written for the Return to Mago E-Magazine (http://magoism.net), Mago Academy (http://magoacademy.org), and Mago Books (http://magobook.com). She has co-edited and published She Rises: Why Goddess Feminism, Activism, and Spirituality? Volume 1 (Mago Books, 2015), and authored The Mago Way: Re-discovering Mago, the Great Goddess from East Asia (Mago Books, 2015). For more, see here.


Mary Ann Beavis, Ph.D.

Mary Ann Beavis (Ph.D., Cambridge University) is Professor of Religion and Culture at St. Thomas More College, the University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, Canada). Her areas of specialization include Christian Origins, Feminist Biblical Interpretation, and Women and Religion.

The courses she teaches include “Goddesses in Myth and History,” and her recently published research project, funded by the Social Sciences and Humanities Council of Canada, is a study of women who blend Goddess Spirituality and Christianity. Her book is entitled Christian Goddess Spirituality: Enchanting Christianity (New York: Routledge, 2015) https://www.routledge.com/products/9781138936881. She is the author of many peer-reviewed articles, five of which reflect her current interest in the Mary Magdalene/Mary of Bethany tradition. For more, see here.


Nicole Shaw

My life purpose is creating deeper awareness. This is what motivates me and is the thread that weaves through my artwork, writing, activism, organic farming, advocating for local food production, founding groups and organizations (such as the Bowen Road Farmers' Market and Nanaimo WomanShare), and living as lightly and as sustainably as I can on the earth.

·  Board member of the Coombs Farmers' Institute

·  Founder of Nanaimo WomanShare, a women's time barter group

·  Published Synergy Magazine for 10 years

For more, see here.


Trista Hendren

Trista Hendren is a Certified Coach with Imagine a Woman International and author of The Girl God and other books. She lives in Bergen, Norway with her family. For more, see here.


Rosemary Mattingley

Rosemary returned to Australia 10 years ago after 24 years of study, work and travel abroad. She received a M.Ed. in Japan, worked at the international Girl Guide centre in India, taught at a primary school in north-west Pakistan, and was a Japanese-speaking tourist guide and co-facilitator for the Quaker Alternatives to Violence Project in South Africa. She now works as an editor, Japanese interpreter, peace and interfaith activist, bridge-builder, and intuitive massage therapist.

Rosemary is the Admin Editor for the Return to Mago E-Magazine and copy-editor for Mago Books. Her blog is: nur810.wordpress.com


What We Need 

We need $12,000.00 for production and distribution of three books. Your contribution will help cover the costs as follows: 

A. Editorial expenses (copy-editing, proofreading, cover-designs, and communication with contributors): $3600 or 30%

B. Formatting books (each book in three versions of color printed book, black/white printed book, and E-book): $2400 or 20%  

C. Printing and shipping books from Korea to the U.S., Australia, and/or Europe: $4800 or 40%

D. Materials and distribution of rewards/perks, worldwide: $1200 or 10%


Why Are These Three Books So Important?

Our task of producing and distributing these three books is timely, important, and necessary on all levels. (1) The making of these three books symbolizes a new form of activism in the Goddess Movement. Each of our editorial and planning committee members comes from a different part of the world and is a self-motivated volunteer. (2) Our projects are undertaken as part of The Mago Work, a multi-centered model of the Goddess Movement. (3) Our projects are tools of self-healing and self-empowerment for contributors and readers. (4) Dr. Hwang’s book, Mago Pilgrimage: Journey to the Primordial Home via Magoist Epic Narratives and Photo Essays, will introduce the Story of the Great Goddess that the world deserves to know. (5) Our books will inspire, motivate, and connect people as contributors and readers around the globe. (6) They will blur the divide between individuals, cultures, and peoples. (7) They will make unique contributions to the world, libraries, and individuals who seek truth, solidarity, and peace. 


Support Our Projects

Join The Mago Work by donating to this campaign. Stand with us volunteer Mago Sisters by spreading the word and encouraging people to donate. Email and share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Google, LinkedIn, and the social media you use. Tell your friends and families. Thank you and let’s stay connected to grow and heal as the agent of WE in S/HE!


Perks Items:

1. She Rises Vol 2, forthcoming by Mago Books

2. Seasons of the Goddess, forthcoming by Mago Book

3. Mago Pilgrimage, forthcoming Mago Books

4. She Rises Vol 1 by Mago Books 2015

5. The Mago Way Vol 1 by Mago Books 2015

6. Jesus, Muhammad, and the Goddess by The Girl God 2016

7. New Love by The Girl God 2015

8. 2017 The Mago Work Calendar, forthcoming 2016 by Mago Books
9. 2018 The Mago Work Calendar, forthcoming 2017 by Mago Books

10. 2019 The Mago Work Calendar, forthcoming 2018 by Mago Books

story:
Inreach/Outreach’s purpose is to revolutionize how students in rural Maine perceive and enact their abilities to affect positive change within themselves and their communities.


Learn more about MOS here!

What is Inreach/Outreach?

Inreach/Outreach (I/O) is dedicated to engaging 3-10 year olds in Downeast Maine in exploration of the ways humans interact with and affect the natural world as a means of addressing personal and community resilience to change. Maine Outdoor School (MOS) will send professional educators into the classroom to teach two-day programs where students will work in teams, explore the natural world, identify sustainability challenges in their communities, and develop and implement solutions to those challenges. MOS will also be working with the classroom teachers to help them implement personal and community resilience curricula into their lessons.

Measuring our Success

To ensure  the Inreach/Outreach program is having a lasting positive effect on Downeast Maine, we will implement a program evaluation so that we may make constant improvement in the following areas:

Learning

  • Demonstrating  place-based examples of classroom curricula to teachers
  • Providing students with positive educational experiences
  • Facilitating collaboration and critical thinking about real world problems
  • Engaging students in service learning projects for their school

Action

  • Increasing student engagement and interest in classroom curricula
  • Enhancing the overall quality of classroom educational experiences
  • Providing teachers with enduring educational themes or projects for their classes
Impact
  • Increased critical thinking in students
  • Increased civic engagement in students
  • Increased quality of lower elementary school educational offerings in regional schools

What We Need

To launch the Inreach/Outreach program by September 2016 we need $55,000. This startup capital will fund:

  • Program planning
  • Curriculum development
  • Teaching supplies
  • Program delivery
  • Transportation for students and teachers
  • Program evaluation
  • Legal counsel
  • Insurance
  • Program marketing

Challenges

Starting Inreach/Outreach will not come without some logistical challenges. Here are two key ways we can overcome these difficulties:

  • Low population: Downeast Maine is a rural region with a low population density. Our highly mobile Inreach/Outreach program will allow us to reach the number of students we need to financially "float" the program.
  • Financial need: Though our program will be financially self-sufficient within the first few years of its operation, we will need investors and donors to help make this possible in the meantime. You can help us make this a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't spare a dime?  No worries. There are TONS  of ways you can engage with our efforts to start MOS's Inreach/Outreach program:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!
  • Are you an artist?  We will need help with branding, logos, and the layout of our brochures and newsletters!
  • Are you a strong writer? It's always nice to have a second set of eyes on our publications!
  • Have a background in web design or videography?  Let us know!  We would love your help with our website!

story:
Harnessing young talents

While working on a platform for creative kids, I came across an 8 year old boy who was pretty good in comic writing and drawing but was discouraged by his guardians who told him that such skills can not be a used as a source of income in a third world economy and he should look into professions like medicine and law. In Africa for example, this is a common trend. Everyone wants the child to be a Doctor or a Lawyer. The problem is, the unemployment rates are so high due to lack of jobs, poor educational facilities and quality of education and undecided young minds. I counselled the boy and he realised that every talent and hobby can indeed become a source of income and even create more jobs. This was an awesome moment for me as he got inspired to know more and work on improving his skills. This is the driving force behind StackHill, a skill-based learning academy to help kids harness their talents.

Nancy Udosen

Founder of StackHill


Introducing StackHill

StackHill is a skill-based learning academy that concentrates on developing and applying specific skills for kids. StackHill provides a platform for kids to discover and harness their talents. In a continent like Africa, where unemployment rates are soaring, every child should have the opportunity to harness a talent early on to enable him/her earn a good living. StackHill focuses on children (5-18 years) and aims to develop their skills into profit making careers through skill-based training by qualified counsellors and tutors.

Unlike traditional offline vocational centres and traditional e-learning platforms, StackHill will be offering both online and offline platforms with the following courses for a start;

  • Fashion Designing for Kids - Fashion design would always captivate kids especially little girls with Barbie dolls. From learning digital illustrations and design techniques to creating their own fashion collection. This course will help the kid harness that talent.
  • Photography for Kids - Kids are intrigued by pictures and It's never too early to teach your kids about photography. Kids learn to predict outcomes and with a digital camera, the results are close to instant.
  • Painting for Kids - Kids who paint learn to think with an open mind, to look at situations creatively. They learn to express themselves more deeply through their art and their words. Picasso in the making?.
  • Computer Programming for Kids - Learning to code with StackHill is engaging and fun. Kids rapidly learn fundamental programming concepts as they animate characters, control robots and publish apps


Why StackHill needs your help

We can achieve a great thing by helping African kids take charge of their lives by discovering and harnessing their talents. In order to launch, StackHill needs the following;

  • A centre to start operations of the StackHill academy
  • Skill-based training materials like cameras, laptops, sewing machines etc.
  • Online web and mobile apps to serve children remotely through curated video content.

StackHill will need an estimated initial funding of $30,000 to launch.

Money raised will go into securing an apartment to house the academy, purchasing training materials and equipments, company registration and legal fees and development costs for the online StackHill web and mobile apps.

The StackHill Indiegogo campaign is a flexible one, if we don't reach our goal, the funding raised will go into developing an online platform only. 

The ULTIMATE GOAL of StackHill is to create an avenue to tackle the problem of unemployment on the long run.


What are the perks?

As a way of saying thank you. We will be offering a number of perks. We will be offering full-year subscriptions to kids based on your perks. These perks are;

  • A Digital Thank You card 
  • A StackHill T-Shirt
  • StackHill Branded Inspire Mug
  • StackHill Branded Nike Performance Backpack
  • A Hangout with the Founder
  • Your Name on the Website's Sponsors page!


Other ways to help

Apart from backing the StackHill Indiegogo Campaign, you can help in a number of ways: 

Join the movement, email learn@stackhill.net or signup at www.stackhill.net and we'll add you to the StackHill community.

Spread the word about our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Vine - everything, using the hashtag #StackHillAcademy or the StackHill Indiegogo campaign share link, http://igg.me/at/stackhill

story:
With Go Private Coach, a broad educational and professional network is just a touch away from you, on-demand, 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. The training to a new level.


The GoPrivateCoach creates a new educational platform experience, connecting thousands of learners with available educational professionals. The company was born in the mobile era, a time when (potentially) all people have in their hands a powerful computer always carry with them, and they can do almost everything with him. Everyday life is changing around us. A new economy, on demand economy, formed through the always on, always connected devices that we all have available. We can have almost everything we need, where we need it, cheap, now.


In GoPrivateCoach, starting out as a Desktop Platform and will expand as an application for smartphones that helps users to quickly and simply find the best private coach-trainer to make lesson, and teachers to find customers through a fair remuneration system. But our ambitions do not stop here. We learn to use the data to training people more quickly and more qualitatively. With this knowledge in hand, we want to expand our services in the field of education. We want to be the web link and educating people in the most functional way. We want to make an E-learning system more “intelligent”, fast and effective.



To achieve this we mainly use two tools: technology and customer support. The first helps to build an intelligent data network that provides you with the best solutions to the needs of people in real-time. The customer support solves the problems that the technology cannot predict. In both, we want to provide world class service. We want our users to know that we are the most reliable solution for a fast, safe, high-quality education. But we do not want and take ourselves too seriously. We like humor and vitality. The life and adventure. We love art. We love super design: the intersection of function and aesthetics. We like to try ideas without fear of failure. And if this culture sounds like you, you might be a good fit to work with us.

story:
Our Mission

EMPASI is an international NGO based in Brussels that works to empower vulnerable youth in Eastern Europe through skills and development programs so they can become agents of change in their communities. 

We invest in vulnerable youths as social actors and as drivers of change!

Diana Stratan, Founder of EMPASI, explains why we should care: 

Three years ago in an orphanage in Moldova, I met Ana where we talked about her future plans. “I have no dreams”, she said staring down in defeat. At that time, she was 15 years old and preparing to age out from the state care system. At an age to dream big, she felt hopeless. However, when I asked her what she would do if she had the power to change something in her village, she had a clear answer: build a hospital, because there is no medical center in her community.  Unfortunately, the gap between Ana’s potential and the reality she was faced was large. Although she has the capacity to be a changemaker, she lacks opportunities and support to develop key skills and unlock her full potential. 

That’s the reason why I decided to found EMPASI, so youths like Ana can enjoy their full rights and opportunities for development.

While each and every one of us has inner potential, around the world opportunities do not flow so equally. Many youths growing up in orphanages in Eastern Europe are deprived of quality education, have few chances to discover their talents, and are at big risk of poverty and social exclusion as life in an orphanage doesn’t prepare them for the outside world. Moreover, having limited options they are prone to embrace antisocial behaviors. These youths don’t get the chance to play an active role in their community and are more likely to be dependent on state for their entire life.

 However, we can change that! We believe that every young person can become an active citizen if given the right opportunities. 

As you know, starting non-profits face many challenges, however this hasn’t stopped us from conducting two important youth empowerment programs in our first year of operation. Our passion and enthusiasm drive our projects forward, but we believe that together we can make it bigger.

Be our partner in change!


Our Approach

Using an innovative project-based learning method, we will provide youths in orphanages in Moldova and Serbia with educational opportunities and engage them in roles of active citizens so that they develop 21st Century life and employability skills and adopt humanitarian values.

We believe that acting like an active citizen is the best way to learn how to become one. 

Pilot Project

The main aim of our program is that youths develop and lead a project that generates an impact on their community.  Our pilot project will be implemented in the Carpineni orphanage in Moldova. There will be 25 youths 'ageing out' from this institution in 2017. These youths will create and set-up a photography exhibition, that raises awareness of the issues that affect them or their communities, as a project-goal. In order to be able to achieve this goal, they will take part in project management and photography courses which will provide the youths, by means of a hands-on approach, with the knowledge and skills necessary to complete their project. Unlike their passive daily routine at the institution, the participants will be encouraged to take initiative, identify social issues, manage a budget, work in teams, organize the exhibition and promote the event. Thereby they will be developing a sense of active citizenship and the necessary skills to integrate into their communities. 

In this project, youth in orphanages are our partners in solving community problems.

Scale-up opportunities

We plan to expand this project model to other institutions and communities in Moldova and Serbia to empower thousands of vulnerable youth. 

The Project's Impact

By participating in our programs, youths will develop confidence, empathy, financial literacy, critical thinking, communication, teamwork, creative and IT skills. They will be able to identify problems in their communities and have the tools to address them. Being directly involved in creating and leading a project from the beginning to end, participants will gain first-hand experience in project management which will provide them with the skills necessary to lead similar projects in the future and excel in a professional environment. These skills will give them a competitive edge in the job market, provide them with the knowledge of how to be self sustainable and prepare them for future life challenges. Through a transformative experience of conducting a project that brings a positive change, youth in orphanages build self-esteem, realize the power they have, and are highly likely to continue on the path of changemaking.

                       


What your contribution will provide

With your donation, you could offer these youths an opportunity to discover themselves, acquire life and employability skills and ultimately change their lives. Your contribution would go toward paying for workshop materials, laptops, cameras, the cost of renting the classroom and gallery, exhibition materials, hiring the trainers and other costs related to our pilot project. However, if we exceed the goal, your contribution will go toward our upcoming project.

Spread the Word

Even if you can’t contribute financially, you can still make a big impact by spreading the word to your friends, colleagues and family!


Thank you!


Sincerely yours,

EMPASI TEAM

www.empasi.org
Like us on our Facebook page!

story:
WHO

Join two childhood friends Bear and Jon as they circle the Earth in 60 Days on a mission, to volunteer, document, and enact a better children's youth program. They will be creating a Online Documentary of the experience to share with the world.

Bear and Jon, life-long friends working together to make an impact in our community through after-school programs on Kaua`i. We chose after school youth programs as means to support the world as we know the youth will one day be the key to new answers and change that the world needs. 

PAST & CURRENT VENTURES

We began our non-profit this past year here at our home on Kauai. We started with three %100 free programs — surfing, martial arts, and fine arts —  addressing and supporting the mind, body, and spirit of the youth f our community. From its success and response there is now a waiting list as the programs expand.

As the foundation grows, we can see the positive impact these programs are already making on the keiki (youth) of our home and want to bring these effects to more people and children.

By bringing communities closer together and supporting the youths potential we know there can be more positive change. 

We are determined to make it the best youth program possible,

which has led us to this trip: learning from the best youth programs around the world to bring back the knowledge and understanding to create an incredibly strong program for our youth at home, then to the world.

WHY

By learning from program pioneers around the world with decades of experience, and with strengths ranging from sport or academics, to children in need, to those that deal with creative and spiritual avenues, we will document and bring back the best practices to create a incredible youth program to benefit our youth at home, then show everyone how they can achieve this in their communities.

Our Plan

We will be traveling to the following 8 locations to study, volunteer, and document the best practices of Non Profits from each location.

Locations: Los Angeles California, Fort Myers/Sanibel Island Florida, New York, Paris/Biarritz France, Mumbai India, Jakarta/Bali Indonesia, Auckland New Zealand, and Kauai Hawaii.  

Volunteering: Through volunteer work and research we will gain a deep understanding of these communities and how their solution-based programs are impacting the lives of their youth.

Learning: In each locale we will interview directors of programs, key community individuals, children, experience the roles and relationships between mentor and child, and observe, interview, and collect data on how the existing programs are ran and how to replicate these systems at home and around the world.

Through action in each location with these youth programs we will be able to both learn and share culture and knowledge with each program, building the relationships between our youth programs for a greater impact in the future.

Documentary

With the entire trip being professionally documented, we will produce a 25-45 min documentary to share our experience with others.

-Our goal is to inspire other communities to start after-school programs in their communities, and give them a jump start to do so.


Template and App

Eventually, we aim to make this platform available to the world online, then through an app.

Through the creation an easy-to-use app with simple and  proven systems used in the programs we visit, we aim to have a framework that raises programs nation wide, and eventually world wide.

After the completion of our trip we plan to work with a Hawai`i based innovation hub to construct and create a platform for the international communities to start grass root movements in their youths growth.

Using technology we can provide a social platform for the world to connect, share and to have tools available to create these programs in their communities. 

Impact

Through learning from the best and most innovative youth programs around the world, we will return to Kaua`i to increase the positive impacts our program offers, increasing their size and scope while creating a strong foundation that will change the lives of our keiki through incredible after-school programs that teach awareness, creativity, and strength.

We will then offer detailed steps to other communities that want to do the same.

It takes a village, and on Kaua`i we’re blessed with an incredibly tight knit community that has the ability to help these kids soar. We are dedicated to this mission, and will do everything in our power to make this trip one to benefit the entire community of Kaua`i.


Donate today

All donations are tax-deductible through our umbrella organization, Inter-Nation Cultural Foundation (INCF). INCF is a publicly supported charitable corporation working with organizations and programs that take action to assist and improve quality of life.

How you can help?

-Donate ( all donations are %100 tax deductible)

-Share this campaign on social media

-Talk to friends and family about the project

-Refer us to three people that might be interested in supporting

-Share your network of possible lodging or other cost savers

-Volunteer time or support preparation work
story_txt: WHOJoin two childhood friends Bear and Jon as they circle the Earth in 60 Days on a mission, to volunteer, document, and enact a better children's youth program. They will be creating a Online Documentary of the experience to share with the world.Bear and Jon, life-long friends working together to make an impact in our community through after-school programs on Kaua`i. We chose after school youth programs as means to support the world as we know the youth will one day be the key to new answers and change that the world needs. PAST & CURRENT VENTURESWe began our non-profit this past year here at our home on Kauai. We started with three %100 free programs — surfing, martial arts, and fine arts —  addressing and supporting the mind, body, and spirit of the youth f our community. From its success and response there is now a waiting list as the programs expand.As the foundation grows, we can see the positive impact these programs are already making on the keiki (youth) of our home and want to bring these effects to more people and children.By bringing communities closer together and supporting the youths potential we know there can be more positive change. We are determined to make it the best youth program possible, which has led us to this trip: learning from the best youth programs around the world to bring back the knowledge and understanding to create an incredibly strong program for our youth at home, then to the world.WHYBy learning from program pioneers around the world with decades of experience, and with strengths ranging from sport or academics, to children in need, to those that deal with creative and spiritual avenues, we will document and bring back the best practices to create a incredible youth program to benefit our youth at home, then show everyone how they can achieve this in their communities.Our PlanWe will be traveling to the following 8 locations to study, volunteer, and document the best practices of Non Profits from each location.Locations: Los Angeles California, Fort Myers/Sanibel Island Florida, New York, Paris/Biarritz France, Mumbai India, Jakarta/Bali Indonesia, Auckland New Zealand, and Kauai Hawaii.  Volunteering: Through volunteer work and research we will gain a deep understanding of these communities and how their solution-based programs are impacting the lives of their youth.Learning: In each locale we will interview directors of programs, key community individuals, children, experience the roles and relationships between mentor and child, and observe, interview, and collect data on how the existing programs are ran and how to replicate these systems at home and around the world.Through action in each location with these youth programs we will be able to both learn and share culture and knowledge with each program, building the relationships between our youth programs for a greater impact in the future.DocumentaryWith the entire trip being professionally documented, we will produce a 25-45 min documentary to share our experience with others.-Our goal is to inspire other communities to start after-school programs in their communities, and give them a jump start to do so.Template and AppEventually, we aim to make this platform available to the world online, then through an app.Through the creation an easy-to-use app with simple and  proven systems used in the programs we visit, we aim to have a framework that raises programs nation wide, and eventually world wide.After the completion of our trip we plan to work with a Hawai`i based innovation hub to construct and create a platform for the international communities to start grass root movements in their youths growth.Using technology we can provide a social platform for the world to connect, share and to have tools available to create these programs in their communities. ImpactThrough learning from the best and most innovative youth programs around the world, we will return to Kaua`i to increase the positive impacts our program offers, increasing their size and scope while creating a strong foundation that will change the lives of our keiki through incredible after-school programs that teach awareness, creativity, and strength.We will then offer detailed steps to other communities that want to do the same.It takes a village, and on Kaua`i we’re blessed with an incredibly tight knit community that has the ability to help these kids soar. We are dedicated to this mission, and will do everything in our power to make this trip one to benefit the entire community of Kaua`i.Donate todayAll donations are tax-deductible through our umbrella organization, Inter-Nation Cultural Foundation (INCF). INCF is a publicly supported charitable corporation working with organizations and programs that take action to assist and improve quality of life.How you can help?-Donate ( all donations are %100 tax deductible)-Share this campaign on social media-Talk to friends and family about the project-Refer us to three people that might be interested in supporting-Share your network of possible lodging or other cost savers-Volunteer time or support preparation work

story:
Nach meinem Film “Schools of Trust” (www.schoolsoftrust.com) , der Schulen zeigt, an denen Kinder wirklich gerne lernen, will nun einen Film machen, der der Frage nachgeht:


“Wie kann ich meinen Kindern helfen sich zu glücklichen und erfolgreichen Erwachsenen zu entwickeln?”


Für diesen Film habe ich bereits mehrere Jahre intensiv recherchiert.

Um Kindern zu helfen glücklich und erfolgreich zu leben, ist es meiner Meinung nach auch fundamental wichtig sich mit der folgende Frage zu beschäftigen:

“Wie kann ich meinen Kindern helfen eine innere Stimme zu entwickeln, die sie bedingungslos liebt, auch wenn sie in ihren eigenen Augen oder denen anderer nicht gut genug sind?

Eine warmherzige, geduldige Stimme, die ihnen Mut macht, wenn sie Probleme haben und die sie aufbaut, wenn es ihnen nicht gut geht. Insbesondere dann, wenn niemand anders für sie da ist.”

In den kommenden Monaten möchte ich weltweit führende Wissenschaftler und Experten aus den Bereichen Psychologie, Hirnforschung und Sozialwissenschaften interviewen und ihnen diese und viele weitere, damit verbundene Fragen stellen.

Folgende Personen haben mir bereits Interviews zugesagt:

­


Edward Deci and Richard Ryan, Professoren der University of Rochester,

Sie sind die Väter der Self Determination Theory, einer der einflussreichsten Theorien in der modernen Motivationspsychologie. Gemeinsam haben sie zahlreiche einflussreiche Fachbücher herausgegeben wie z.B. das Handbook of self-determination research und das Oxford Handbook of Human Motivation. In über 45 Jahren empirischer Forschung gelang es ihnen unzählige Male die positiven Effekte von Neugier und Begeisterung den psychologischen Kosten von Belohnung und Bestrafung gegenüber zu stellen.


Alfie Kohn

Er ist Autor zahlreicher wissenschaftlich fundierter Bestseller wie “Liebe und Eigenständigkeit: Die Kunst bedingungsloser Elternschaft, jenseits von Belohnung und Bestrafung” und “Der Mythos des verwöhnten Kindes”, in denen er feinfühlig die Bedeutungen von bedingungsloser Liebe, Mitgefühl und Vertrauen beleuchtet.

Dacher Keltner, Professor an der University of California, Berkeley.


Er ist Direktor des Greater Good Science Center´s in Berkeley und gilt als einer der weltweitführenden Experten in den Bereichen Positive Psychologie, Mitgefühl und Emotionspsychologie. In den letzten Jahren wirkte Keltner auch bei Animationsfilmen von Pixar und in einem Design-Team von Facebook mit.

Michael Steger, Professor an der Colorado State University.

Seit über 10 Jahren untersucht er, wie Menschen es schaffen in ihrem Leben Sinn zu sehen und welche Vorteile es bringt, ein als sinnvoll empfundenes Leben zu leben. Auch er gilt als einer der führenden Wissenschaftler der Positivien Psychologie.


Wendy Grolnick, Professorin der University of Worcester.

Ben-Shahar unterrichtete mehrere Jahre an der renomierten Havard University. Seine Vorlesungen Positive Psychology und The Psychology of Leadership zählen zu den beliebtesten in der Geschichte Havards.


Professor Avi Assor und Dr. Guy Roth sind Forscher an der Ben-Gurion University in Negev, Israel. Sie untersuchen seit über 15 Jahren die negativen Langzeiteffekte “bedingter elterlicher Liebe”. Also davon, was mit Kindern passiert, wenn ihre Eltern ihnen das Gefühl geben nur dann geliebt zu sein, wenn sie den Erwartungen ihrer Eltern entsprechen.


James Pennebaker, Professor an der University of Texas.

Vor 30 Jahren fand er durch Zufall heraus, dass Menschen sehr oft deutlich entspannter und gesünder werden, wenn man ihnen wiederholt Raum gibt über ihre über ihre emotional einschneidensten Erlebnisse zu sprechen oder zu schreiben, ohne dass sie dabei bewertet werden.

Über 200 weitere Studien analysierten seitdem die zugrundeliegenden Zusammenhänge und Ursachen dieses Phänomens. Er gilt als DER weltweit führende Experte auf dem der sprachlichen Integration emotionaler Erlebnisse.


Nantje Otterpohl, Professorin an der Universität Gießen.

Sie erforscht, wie Kinder und Jugendliche mit ihren Gefühlen umgehen und untersucht in Kooperation mit Avi Assor und Guy Roth die Effekte “bedingter elterlicher Liebe” in Deutschland.

Sophie Havighurst, Professorin an der University of Melbourne.

Sie untersucht seit vielen Jahren, wie Eltern ihren Kindern helfen können ihre Gefühle nicht als etwas störendes wahrzunehmen, sondern als eine innere Kraftquelle, die ihnen hilft besser durch das Leben zu kommen.


Auf der Grundlage dieser Interviews – und vieler weiterer – möchte ich in den nächsten Jahren einen Dokumentarfilm produzieren, der weltweit Eltern, Großeltern, Tanten, Onkel, Erzieher und alle anderen Menschen, die mit Kindern zu tun haben inspiriert sich aufrichtig die Frage zu stellen:

Wie kann ich Kindern unterstützen eine bedingungslos liebende, innere Stimme zu entwickeln, die ihnen hilft glücklich und erfolgreich zu leben, auch und gerade dann, wenn sich ihnen Probleme in den Weg stellen und sie sich damit auseinandersetzen müssen?

Wie bei meinem vorherigen Projekt “Schools of Trust” werde ich ehrenamtlich, in meiner Freizeit für diesen Film arbeiten, weil ich von seiner gesellschaftlichen Bedeutung überzeugt bin.

Mit diesem Aufruf bitte ich Sie um Ihre Unterstützung, damit ich die Kosten für die Anreise zu den Interviewpartnern, für einfache Übernachtungsmöglichkeiten, etc. … decken kann.

Sollte dieser Aufruf mehr einspielen, als für die Interviws tatsächlich benötigt wird, werde ich dieses Geld für die weitere Fertigstellung des Filmprojekts einsetzen.

Bitte unterstützen Sie mich bei der Suche nach dem, was unseren Kindern hilft eine bedingungslos liebende, innere Stimme zu entwickeln, die immer für sie da sein wird, auch dann, wenn sie von außen betrachtet ganz allein sind.



Alternativ können Sie uns auch auf den folgenden Wegen Spenden zukommen lassen: 


 Leidenschaftlich Lernen gemeinnütziger e.V. 

IBAN:        DE93213522400189607484 

BIC:           NOLADE21HOL 


Paypal:     

info@vertrauen-ins-lernen.de

story:
College is expensive! Most four-year universities cost between $20,000-$60,000 per year. Most parents assume their child will receive their degree in four years, but currently over 55% of all students take longer- the average being five and a half years. This translates into a “four-year degree” costing $110,000-$330,000. This is before grad school, med school, or other extended college degrees! But it doesn’t have to cost that much.

I have worked with thousands of students and their families, and I am shocked at how few have any idea of how much control they can have over the cost of their education. Even worse, I see parents taking on a huge amount of debt when they easily could have saved themselves 20-60% of that debt.

The number one indicator of scholarships is the student’s GPA, and yet most students treat B’s as though it is a “good” grade. Few, if any, schools offer scholarship money for a 3.0 GPA. And parents- do not make the mistake most do. A B in Honors or AP classes is NOT the same as an A! Miami University of Ohio does a great job at being transparent about the fact they only look at unweighted GPA’s. Many schools are not as transparent as Miami and give families a false sense of where their child really stands.

So, how do you save thousands of dollars on college?

There are several painless things you can do, but the first is to help your child achieve A’s. This does not involve putting pressure on them. It involves giving them the tools to succeed and investing in their success long before college. Most students will tell you that no one has ever taught them how to study. They have never been guided on creating the best study habits, instructed on how to study, what to study, or when to study. Many schools also no longer issue students their own text book to take home, so how would they ever know if there is valuable information to be gained from the book? Maybe you have a straight-A student, but they put so much pressure on themselves, you would like to see them enjoy high school a little more. Again, the proper tool can eliminate their stress and help them become a well-rounded student.

I believe the proper tool is the difference between digging a ditch with a spoon and digging with a backhoe. Sure, you might get the same result using a spoon, but why put in more work than you need to when a backhoe is much more efficient?

The idea behind the 168 Planner Ultimate Success Planner is to provide the student with the right instruments and the instructions to achieve their best grades without the stress or spending a ridiculous amount of time on trying to achieve that A. The 168 study system and planner is that tool. It is filled with study tips based on scientific research and tested over the past year with clients of College Recruiting Specialists. The 168 not only provides insight on how to study but also what to study, and most importantly, a time management system to define when to study.

College Recruiting Specialists has tested this system with high school and college students with amazing results: our students took control over their time and homework allowing them to improve grades, lower stress levels, and ultimately lower the cost of their future education. To make The 168 even more user-friendly, we have an instructional video on YouTube so students can reference it at any time to ensure they are using the planner to its full potential.

There are only 168 hours in the week- let's make sure that your child puts them to good use.

If you have questions about The 168 Ultimate Success Planner, please email us at kelly@collegerecruitingspecialists.com.

story:
נזר הקודש - המכון ללימודי הכהונה מיסודו של מכון המקדש

The Nezer HaKodesh Institute for Kohanic Studies

The Temple Institute, established nearly thirty years ago, has now established the world's first school for training Levitical Priests to serve in the Holy Temple.  Your support will help to strengthen and develop this school.

After millennia of yearning, only one organization is paving the way for the rebuilding of the Temple: the internationally-acclaimed Temple Institute (מכון המקדש), a research organization founded nearly thirty years ago and located in the Old City of Jerusalem. The Temple Institute is dedicated to every aspect of preparing for the renewal and ultimate construction of the Third Temple, and has succeeded in bringing about a spiritual awakening - bringing the concept of the Holy Temple back to forefront of our consciousness. The Institute has created nearly all of the sacred vessels needed to resume the Divine service in the Holy Temple, including the High Priest's breastplate featuring the twelve precious stones of the tribes of Israel, the half-ton golden menorah, and the musical instruments of the Levitical choir. It has also made huge advances in preparing the architectural plans for the building of the Temple, and many other areas of research. 

But who will serve in the rebuilt Holy Temple? The Temple Institute has established the world's first school for the training and preparation of Kohanim - the Levitical Priests: Nezer Hakodesh, Hebrew for 'Crown of Holiness,' the Institute for Kohanic Studies. The Kohanim (plural for Kohen, the Temple priests) are the representatives of both the Creator and all of Israel, as well as all of humanity. The Institute's goal is to prepare these men to assume their duties and responsibilities in the Holy Temple. 

Nezer Hakodesh brings alive the knowledge required by the kohanim through educational practice drills on every aspect of the Temple service, held throughout the year. In addition to all the relevant sources of Torah halacha and knowledge, the school's curriculum also includes in-depth courses such as:

  • The Role and Application of Modern Technology in the Third Temple 
  • The Mathematics of the Holy Temple
  • The Temple Service: Theory and Practice
  • Holy Temple Administration
  • The Sacred Temple Vessels: Aspects of Engineering and Design
  • The Topography of the Temple Mount and the Structure of Ezekiel's Temple

The Nezer Hakodesh Institute for Kohanic Studies was established four years ago with an initial student body of 12 participants. At present there are many potential students from all over Israel with whom this great responsibility resonates, who wish to register for these programs to prepare for their duties. 

Where Will Your Money Go?

Your generous donation will help to provide:

  1. Funding for the practice educational drills of each aspect of the Temple service that are held throughout the year
  2. Scholarships for needy candidates
  3. Authentic, kosher priestly garments made in precise accordance with Torah instructions, for each kohen student
  4. A full set of practice vessels to aid in teaching the details of attending to the Temple service, and for the practice educational drills, for each student
  5. Lecturers, educational and classroom materials
Some More Information About the Kohanim (Levitical Priests):


Who are the Kohanim ?

“And it shall be for them an appointment as priests forever, for all generations” (Ex. 40:15)

“For the L-rd your G-d has chosen him out of all of your tribes, to stand to serve in the name of the L-rd, him and his sons forever” (Deut. 18:5)

The first kohen, the founder of the priestly clan of Israel, was Aaron, brother of Moses, of the tribe of Levi. Levi was the patriarch Jacob’s third son, and Aaron was a fourth generation descendant of Levi. Aaron and his four sons were designated as the first priests; Aaron served as the first High Priest. As the verses indicate, all of his male descendants were chosen by G-d to be priests forever; it is an eternal covenant. Thus even today, a kohen among the Jewish people is genealogically a direct descendant of Aaron. In our time, new advances in science and medicine have established the identity of the descendants of Aaron beyond any doubt, through DNA. 

The Role of the Kohanim in the Holy Temple

G-d chose these men to be in a position of spiritual leadership. They are responsible for the sacred service in the Holy Temple  -- and in general they are responsible for our spiritual welfare. The Hebrew word kohen actually means ‘to serve,’ and a deeper linguistic connection can be found in the word ken, meaning ‘yes,'  itself related to the word kivun,‘to direct.’ Thus a kohen is called upon to direct in the proper service of G-d: "And you, separate your brother Aaron and his sons from among the Israelites, and bring them close to you... so they can serve me" (Ex. 28:1).

A Conduit for Divine Blessing

In attending to the various aspects of the Divine service, the kohanim serve as a conduit to bring G-d's radiant blessing into this world. It is on this account that they are commanded to deliver G-d's blessing of peace and love to the people, as well: "Say to Aaron and his sons... Thus shall you bless the people of Israel: 'May the L-rd bless you and protect you. May the L-rd shine His face upon you, and be gracious unto you. May the L-rd lift up His face to you and may He grant you peace' " (Numbers 6:22 - 26).

The kohanim represent the attribute of kindness, and the focusing of life's energies on sanctity and Divine purpose. It was the attribute of kindness, understanding and love for all which Aaron, the first Kohen Gadol - High Priest, was best known for, and his descendants are entrusted to exemplify Hillel's famous dictum in the Chapters of the Fathers (Avot 1:12): "Be of the disciples of Aaron, loving peace and pursuing peace, loving your fellow-creatures, and drawing them near to the Torah."  

The daily blessing of the kohanim in the Temple serves to open the Heavenly gates of mercy. Through it, the people of Israel and the entire world merit not only material well-being - including offspring and longevity - but spiritual blessings as well; mercy, Divine protection and the greatest blessing of all... true peace. Since the kohanim represent the attribute of kindness,  G-d channels His blessing through their service in the Holy Temple. 

Myth and Fact

Myths:

  • The Temple will come down miraculously from the sky.
  • The Temple will be achieved through violence.
  • The Temple will be open to limited Jewish groups. 

Facts:

  • The Third Temple will be built through human effort in the natural course of human events. 
  • As stated by the prophets: the Holy Temple stands for the sanctity of human life and peace and therefore will be rebuilt as an expression of unity and peace; 
  • The Holy Temple will once again be the focus of prayer for the entire world;
  • The Holy Temple will be the focus of an inspiring pilgrimage for all people. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Share our video and campaign with others. 

Contact

If you'd like to contact us about this campaign, visit the contact page of our website or e-mail us at infotempleinstitute@gmail.com

You will receive a receipt for your donation. Please note, donations via this IndieGogo campaign are not tax-deductible in the USA. If you'd like to donate the old-fashioned way via check, or to make a USA-recognized tax-deductible donation, please click here to be redirected to our website's donation page. 

A Word About This Campaign's Unique Perks

In addition to exclusive photographic displays, a beautiful Certificate of Recognition, a tour of the Institute's Holy Temple Visitors Center, and  membership status, the Temple Institute is also offering a unique opportunity for a personal dedication to appear in your name or the name of a loved one, in its much-anticipated upcoming publication, 'The Holy Temple of Jerusalem,' to be published by Koren Publishers of Jerusalem early in 2017. See the list of perks for more details, and see images of the newly-published Hebrew edition of this book in the Gallery section of this campaign .
story_txt:
נזר הקודש - המכון ללימודי הכהונה מיסודו של מכון המקדשThe Nezer HaKodesh Institute for Kohanic StudiesThe Temple Institute, established nearly thirty years ago, has now established the world's first school for training Levitical Priests to serve in the Holy Temple.  Your support will help to strengthen and develop this school.After millennia of yearning, only one organization is paving the way for the rebuilding of the Temple: the internationally-acclaimed Temple Institute (מכון המקדש), a research organization founded nearly thirty years ago and located in the Old City of Jerusalem. The Temple Institute is dedicated to every aspect of preparing for the renewal and ultimate construction of the Third Temple, and has succeeded in bringing about a spiritual awakening - bringing the concept of the Holy Temple back to forefront of our consciousness. The Institute has created nearly all of the sacred vessels needed to resume the Divine service in the Holy Temple, including the High Priest's breastplate featuring the twelve precious stones of the tribes of Israel, the half-ton golden menorah, and the musical instruments of the Levitical choir. It has also made huge advances in preparing the architectural plans for the building of the Temple, and many other areas of research. But who will serve in the rebuilt Holy Temple? The Temple Institute has established the world's first school for the training and preparation of Kohanim - the Levitical Priests: Nezer Hakodesh, Hebrew for 'Crown of Holiness,' the Institute for Kohanic Studies. The Kohanim (plural for Kohen, the Temple priests) are the representatives of both the Creator and all of Israel, as well as all of humanity. The Institute's goal is to prepare these men to assume their duties and responsibilities in the Holy Temple. Nezer Hakodesh brings alive the knowledge required by the kohanim through educational practice drills on every aspect of the Temple service, held throughout the year. In addition to all the relevant sources of Torah halacha and knowledge, the school's curriculum also includes in-depth courses such as:

The Role and Application of Modern Technology in the Third Temple 


The Mathematics of the Holy Temple


The Temple Service: Theory and Practice


Holy Temple Administration


The Sacred Temple Vessels: Aspects of Engineering and Design


The Topography of the Temple Mount and the Structure of Ezekiel's Temple

The Nezer Hakodesh Institute for Kohanic Studies was established four years ago with an initial student body of 12 participants. At present there are many potential students from all over Israel with whom this great responsibility resonates, who wish to register for these programs to prepare for their duties. Where Will Your Money Go?Your generous donation will help to provide:

Funding for the practice educational drills of each aspect of the Temple service that are held throughout the year


Scholarships for needy candidates


Authentic, kosher priestly garments made in precise accordance with Torah instructions, for each kohen student


A full set of practice vessels to aid in teaching the details of attending to the Temple service, and for the practice educational drills, for each student


Lecturers, educational and classroom materials

Some More Information About the Kohanim (Levitical Priests):Who are the Kohanim ?“And it shall be for them an appointment as priests forever, for all generations” (Ex. 40:15)“For the L-rd your G-d has chosen him out of all of your tribes, to stand to serve in the name of the L-rd, him and his sons forever” (Deut. 18:5)The first kohen, the founder of the priestly clan of Israel, was Aaron, brother of Moses, of the tribe of Levi. Levi was the patriarch Jacob’s third son, and Aaron was a fourth generation descendant of Levi. Aaron and his four sons were designated as the first priests; Aaron served as the first High Priest. As the verses indicate, all of his male descendants were chosen by G-d to be priests forever; it is an eternal covenant. Thus even today, a kohen among the Jewish people is genealogically a direct descendant of Aaron. In our time, new advances in science and medicine have established the identity of the descendants of Aaron beyond any doubt, through DNA. The Role of the Kohanim in the Holy TempleG-d chose these men to be in a position of spiritual leadership. They are responsible for the sacred service in the Holy Temple  -- and in general they are responsible for our spiritual welfare. The Hebrew word kohen actually means ‘to serve,’ and a deeper linguistic connection can be found in the word ken, meaning ‘yes,'  itself related to the word kivun,‘to direct.’ Thus a kohen is called upon to direct in the proper service of G-d: "And you, separate your brother Aaron and his sons from among the Israelites, and bring them close to you... so they can serve me" (Ex. 28:1).A Conduit for Divine BlessingIn attending to the various aspects of the Divine service, the kohanim serve as a conduit to bring G-d's radiant blessing into this world. It is on this account that they are commanded to deliver G-d's blessing of peace and love to the people, as well: "Say to Aaron and his sons... Thus shall you bless the people of Israel: 'May the L-rd bless you and protect you. May the L-rd shine His face upon you, and be gracious unto you. May the L-rd lift up His face to you and may He grant you peace' " (Numbers 6:22 - 26).The kohanim represent the attribute of kindness, and the focusing of life's energies on sanctity and Divine purpose. It was the attribute of kindness, understanding and love for all which Aaron, the first Kohen Gadol - High Priest, was best known for, and his descendants are entrusted to exemplify Hillel's famous dictum in the Chapters of the Fathers (Avot 1:12): "Be of the disciples of Aaron, loving peace and pursuing peace, loving your fellow-creatures, and drawing them near to the Torah."  The daily blessing of the kohanim in the Temple serves to open the Heavenly gates of mercy. Through it, the people of Israel and the entire world merit not only material well-being - including offspring and longevity - but spiritual blessings as well; mercy, Divine protection and the greatest blessing of all... true peace. Since the kohanim represent the attribute of kindness,  G-d channels His blessing through their service in the Holy Temple. Myth and FactMyths:

The Temple will be achieved through violence.


The Temple will be open to limited Jewish groups. 

Facts:

As stated by the prophets: the Holy Temple stands for the sanctity of human life and peace and therefore will be rebuilt as an expression of unity and peace;

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Charli Baker and I am a 16 year old girl from Southern California. My friends Alex Abrams and Jack Mazzeo are helping me put on a show at my local high school as my senior year project based on our mutual love of special effects makeup and the performing arts. The proceeds of our show go to the Children's Hospital in LA because when my cousin was 13, he was diagnosed with a rare cancer and as of now he's over 7 years cancer free and living strong thanks to them so we wanted to give back but we need funding to put on the show to do so. 

What We Need

The campaign goal on this Indiegogo is $500 because we need to pay for makeup and set. Anything we don't use for this show, raised by this campaign, will go to the Children's Hospital. It means a lot to us that the hospital get as much money as we can give them because they save lives every day and ultimately families.

The Impact

This campaign will benefit tons of children and families that go to this hospital in the long run. The show we want to put on will raise cancer awareness but also bring as much light as we can to such a heavy subject.

Risks & Challenges

This show will be hard to put on and the money we raise may not be enough to make a huge difference but every penny counts in cancer research. 35,000 children are currently in treatment for cancer in the United States and our goal after this show is to make that 35,000 survivors. That won't be easy and is almost impossible but we dream big. This show means a lot to us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's ok. Every share is just as important. Make some noise about our campaign because the more money we make, the better the show is, the more we can donate to the hospital and ultimately the more lives we can save.

story:
Four Years is Enough!

For four years, Governor Brownback and his allies have been trying to strip public education funding in Kansas. For four years, education advocates and moderates of both parties have fought him, tooth and nail.

This year, this election, we have the opportunity to bring about real change in the Kansas Legislature. Help us advocate for public education. Help us convince voters of what you already know: an excellent public education is a right guaranteed by the Kansas Constitution.

We expect a record number of voters in this year's elections in Kansas. Help us reach as many of them as we can with the message that a well-funded, inclusive system of public education is critical to the future of Kansas and Kansas children.

We are the MainStream Coalition, a political advocacy group in Kansas that fights for moderate values. Founded in 1993, we spent more than twenty years fighting for strong public schools, reasonable fiscal policies, and good government. Our members are Republican and Democrat and Independent, and they know that to take Kansas back from Brownback and the extremists, we need to do more than just vote.

Won't you help?

What We Need & What You Get

We need money to fund postcards supporting public education. $5,000 is enough to send 10,000 postcards, enough to cover targeted households in one Kansas House district. In 2014, we sent thousands of postcards, so we know how to do this.

If we go over $5,000, we'll target households in another House district, Then another. There are 125 House districts in Kansas, so your donation won't go unused!

If we don't reach $5,000, we will still send postcards out, just not as many. But every vote adds up, and every voter counts.

What do you get? The glow of having made a difference? While a new direction in Kansas would be a gift we'd all accept, we do have some items to give out as thanks for your contribution, and some amazing opportunities to really get involved.

$1 will fund two postcards, and gets you our popular weekly email. We send just one a week, with a unique article on Kansas politics, a calendar of events you might love, and the latest political news from the legislature and the state.

$10 will send out twenty postcards, and you will get our newsletter and a coaster that says "Restore Sanity to Kansas."

$20 will send forty postcards, gets you our newsletter, and one of our bumper stickers: "If you didn't vote, this is all your fault."

$35 will let us send seventy postcards, gets you the newsletter, a bumper sticker and an individual membership to the MainStream Coalition.

$100 lets us send out two hundred postcards, and you'll get all the above swag, plus one of our new t-shirts: "Be a voter," on the front, and "Do more than vote," on the back.

The next levels are special opportunities to meet and get intimately connected to the world of Kansas politics.

$500, besides letting us reach one thousand voters, will get you everything you've seen so far, as well as a unique opportunity to sit down for coffee or drinks with our Executive Director. If you're interested in just what is going on in Kansas politics, you won't find a better opportunity.

$1,000 will send two thousand postcards, and along with all the items above—the newsletter, the bumper sticker, the coaster, the membership, and the shirt—but also two invites to our annual Patron's cocktail party. Meet and greet some of the key elected leaders and most dedicated supporters of moderate values in the area, at a catered party in a private home.

$5,000 will allows us to reach an entire House district. In addition to all the swag above, you will receive two invites to a private dinner with our Executive Director and a moderate legislative leader. You won't find a more exclusive opportunity to really get involved.

Finally, a $10,000 donation will let us reach two entire House districts, will net you all the swag above, and we will host a private event at your home for up to twenty of your friends, with a moderate legislative leader. We will provide drinks and hors d'oeuvres.

The Impact

This election year, voters will be hearing from all sides, including from the extremists about how they purportedly support public education. Voters deserve to hear the truth about what it takes to support public education, what votes were taken over the past years both for and against public education, and who supports what positions on the issue.

We have a track record in 2014 of sending out postcards and influencing races. In the races where MainStream worked in 2014, all moderate seats from both parties were retained, and one more was added to the list of reasonable legislators.

This year, we are attacking this election from several fronts. We are managing an extensive get out the vote effort, and our PAC is working to directly contribute to candidates. With these postcards, we are doing the hard but necessary work of educating voters about public education and the candidates racing to represent them.

Every vote counts. Every postcard helps.

Risks & Challenges

Every donation will go towards postcards. While there are some economies of scale, postcards can be printed and mailed for roughly $0.50 each. We already have relationships with printers and distributors. We are knowledgeable about the issues, and have years of political savvy to call on with our staff and Board. We have every expectation that postcards will be delivered, and will have an impact.

That said, we cannot guarantee the outcome of the election, despite our best efforts and your generous contributions. Postcards are one step. Do consider doing more, more than this, more than voting. Get informed, get involved, and make a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute a postcard or two to this effort, you can still help us raise the importance of public education with Kansas voters. Share this campaign, and make some noise about public education. There are social media sharing tools on this page. Use them! Getting the word out about this campaign will help us get the word out about education in Kansas.

Thank you.

story:
In December I graduated VIA Design, Denmark, (former TEKO) with the highest grade 12+. My final project focused on traditional tailoring based cores of garments and combining complex construction with clean visuals. My final collection was chosen to represent the school in many competitions and shows in Copenhagen and Aarhus. (my online portfolio: www.annatalvi.com)

Twice I have interned at master tailor Mason Jung in London, where I have learned about complex tailoring and construction techniques on a micro level.

In the future I see myself combining the traditional tailoring techniques with modern approaches to garments, such as using 3D CAD/CAM. I am aiming to result in a concept that combines modern consideration in terms of the garment's adaptation to the human body and its dynamics.

The Royal College of Art is the best place in the world to do that and I am very motivated to invest all my energy, time and passion into the studies I marvel.


I have already received support from:

The Ministry of Culture of Estonia

Eesti Kultuurkapital

Grosser L.H. Foghts Fond

Knud Hojgaards Fond

Oticon Fond

Augustinius Fond


Royal College of Art rankings: 

http://www.topuniversities.com/university-ranki... 

---

Detsembris kaitsesin oma bakalaureuse kraadi moe erialal Taanis VIA Universty College’is kõrgeimale hindele 12+. Minu lõputöö keskendus traditsioonilistel rätsepatehnikatel põhinevatel rõivaskelettidel. Sama lõpukollektsioon valiti kooli esindama moeetendustele ning võistlustele Kopenhaagenisse ja Aarhusi. (minu e-portfoolio: www.annatalvi.com)

Soovin jätkata projektidega, mis põhinevad rõivaste adapteerumisel füüsilise keha ja selle dünaamikaga. Mulle meeldib töötada oma mudeli kallal seni, kuni ta puhkab keha peal, justkui  hooliks oma kandjast.

Olen tugevasti seotud oma juurtega ning soovin tutvustada eestimaist esteetikat ning käsitööd maailmas. Soovin arendada oma visooni traditsiooniliste rätsepatehnikate lõimuisest 3D kehaskänneri tehnoloogiaga. Arendan konseptsiooni, kus rõhk on kantavusel ning meisterlikult valmistatud tootel, mitte haibil ja marketingil.

Taotletav rahaline toetus võimaldaks mul pühenduda oma loomingule ning annaks hindamatu võimaluse areneda ennast oma ala meistrite käe all.

Royal College of Art paistis mulle alati kättesaamatu unistus. Nüüd oleks armetu ta finansilistel põhjustel käest lasta. Teie toetus aitaks mul maksta 9500- naelast (11.000€) aastamaksu ning kõrgeid materialikulusid.

Iga minu keharakk on motiveeritud andmaks endast kõik nende kahe magistriaasta jooksul.


Mind on toetanud juba:

Eesti Kultuuriministeerium

Eesti Kultuurkapital

Grosser L.H. Foghts Fond

Knud Hojgaards Fond

Oticon Fond

Augustinius Fond

Nüüd oleks armetu ta finansilistel põhjustel käest lasta. Teie toetus aitaks mul maksta 9500- naelast (11.000€) aastamaksu ning kõrgeid materialikulusid.Iga minu keharakk on motiveeritud andmaks endast kõik nende kahe magistriaasta jooksul.Mind on toetanud juba:Eesti KultuuriministeeriumEesti KultuurkapitalGrosser L.H. Foghts FondKnud Hojgaards FondOticon FondAugustinius Fond

story:
Short Summary

We need your help in sending a group of inner city youth to Egypt this summer. The cost of the trip is $253,000. Our students have raised $244,000 thus far.but   We need your help to raise the remaining $9,000 by July 25th.

African Genesis Institute (www.africangenesis2.org) is a Philadelphia based, 501c-3 “school without walls” that produces a 24-month study program for Black and Latino youth between the ages of 7 and 14.  Our motto is “it is better to build a child than repair an adult”.

During the 24 month program, the students:

  • Attend 10 classes at the African American Museum of Philadelphia,
  • Complete 24 reading and writing assignments from an African history curriculum designed by Dr Edward Robinson, Jabari Osaze and Chike Akua
  • Make oral presentations
  • Travel on 5 field trips in the United States and Canada to sites that are relevant to the history of our people in both countries and
  • Participate in 3 fundraising drives
Once they successfully complete the program, their graduation reward is a free 10-day, life altering trip to Egypt where they can see with their own eyes what they have been learning about for the past 2 years.

What We Need & What You Get

For your generous donation, you will help us take the students to Egypt.  They will return primed for future leadership in our communities.  You will also receive the amazing gifts listed on this site.

The Impact

The results have been impressive:

  • Since inception, we have taken over 3000 students to the African continent
  • There has been an increase in academic performance, scores on standardized tests and respect for elders
  • There has been a dramatic decrease in absenteeism, lateness and incidences of disruptive behavior
  • 97.2 % of our graduates attend college, many on 4-year fully paid scholarships

Risks & Challenges

Without you, this year's trip is in jeopardy!  Don't let the students diligent work go unrewarded! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to make a donation in the amounts listed?  Please go to our website (www.africangenesis2.org) and make a donation in any amount that you are able.  Please share this page and the mission of the African Genesis Institute with you friends and follow us on Facebook.
